story:
Hello!

We are a young business that brings together students, parents and teachers in a common cause, healthy choices in school!  Our school is very close to a commercial street where fast food restaurants are numerous.  Since our start in 2013, our goal has been to offer interesting options that are nutritious at a great price!  We feel that our cause is just and that students can make the right choice.   Already our biggest seller is fruit!  We feel we are on the right track to being the first choice for a lot of students and we need your help to continue to be available to them.

Bonjour!  

Nous sommes une jeunes entreprise qui rassemble étudiants, parents et enseignants dans un même but qui est d'offrir un choix santé à l'école.  Notre école se situe très près d'une rue commerciale où les restaurants abondent.  Depuis notre conception en 2013, nous avons travaillé à offrir aux élèves des repas intéressants qui sont nourrissants et peu dispendieux.  Nous croyons que notre cause est importante et que les élèves sont capables de faire les bons choix.  Déjà, les plus gros vendeurs sont des fruits.  Nous croyons être sur la bonne voie et nous avons besoin de votre aide afin de demeurer disponibles pour eux.

What we need from you is simple, its a chance.

We all know how difficult it is to start a business at any given time but our clientele is a really small one and they have been going out to lunch for years now.  We need to make them see that the cafeteria is a great place and that we have what they need!  For this we need time and well, time is money.  The money we are asking for is just a little help in the day to day.  We need a little backup for when thing break, and they do!  We are housed in the first building to get electricity in our city, that means, its really old!  We are a non-profit organization that just want to have the time to get established and we see that this will work because our most loyal customers are the younger students.  

Ce dont nous avons besoin est simple, c'est une chance.

Nous savons tous combien il est difficile de démarrer une entreprise à n'importe quel moment mais notre clientèle est très petite et elle sort pour aller diner depuis des années.  Nous avons besoin de leur faire voir que la cafétéria est un endroit intéressant et que nous avons ce qu'ils veulent!  Pour cela, nous avons besoin de temps et le temps, c'est de l'argent.  L'argent que nous vous demandons servira un peu au jour le jour.  Nous avons aussi besoin d'un petit coussin pour quand les choses brisent, et elles brisent!  Nous sommes situés dans le premier bâtiment à recevoir l'électricité dans notre ville, ce qui veut dire qu'il est vraiment vieux!  Nous sommes un organisme à but non lucratif qui veut seulement avoir le temps de s'établir et nous savons que cela va fonctionner parce que le plus gros de notre clientèle se compose de jeunes élèves.  

It's quite simple.

We are an integral part of the school, we participate in every activity and we have special meals for holidays, we employ students every day and give them lunch as pay.  We revitalize the physical place where the students have lunch, we give students a chance to work in a real entreprise and can give them references for later.  We would like to give cooking lessons so the students know how to prepare the foods they love.    

 

C'est vraiment tout simple.

Nous faisons partie intégrante de l'école, nous participons à chaque activité et nous avons des repas spéciaux lors des fêtes.  Nous employons des élèves à tous les jours et nous les rémunérons avec un diner.  Nous avons amélioré les lieux physiques où les élèves dinent.  Nous offrons la possibilité à des élèves de prendre part à une vraie entreprise et leurs offrons des références.  Nous aimerions offrir des cours de cuisine pour que les élèves apprennent à cuisiner les repas qu'ils aiment.  


Don't forget to share

Thank you!

N'oubliez pas de partager

Merci!

story:
I am Pamela Tilley, a retired, disabled, U.S. Army female veteran who served 21 years including during the Vietnam campaign. We've created a product campaign to support our veteran efforts.

This BuddyVet is a simple vehicle designed for social entrepreneurship. BuddyVet initially inspires all persons to support a veteran from any level they can. The hand-made object itself is charming, catchy, and it draws others to support veterans.

BuddyVet is an important campaign because it is an example of how to give support to other non-profit veteran services that we have established. It provides opportunities to other veterans -- especially disabled vets -- a place for part-time employment by producing BuddyVets. Several designs for products are already established, but it takes capital to generate a factory concept to both employ veterans and serve large retail organizations with our products. We have interest but cannot supply in large enough quantities until we establish a larger stock and a factory concept.

Contributors can help us achieve large quantities through mass production and help service other BuddyVet products for the same intent.

Our first major hurdle is having the right tooling for mass production of our hard plastic BuddyVet; that being the digital designs and the molding development, which are the most costly. Our molding process is $35,000 - $40,000; materials (fabric, thread, sewing machines, and stuffing) and standardization of our BuddyVet plush requires $8,000 - $10,000; the remaining $10,000 is for product processing, packaging and shipping, wherein lies the part-time employment vehicle for our veterans.

This is the essence of our factory concept and the total estimate for this initial project is approximately $60,000. We can produce large volume products, supply large retail outlets, and employ veterans all within one year of this funding. Our challenge is not having funds in a timely enough fashion to meet upcoming market opportunities, thus losing a year that could have employed veterans.

People love our BuddyVet products! It reconnects them with their veteran family members regardless of where they are. It reminds us all of veterans who have served.

If funded, our project will employ veterans, increase awareness for veteran support, and most importantly, be a duplicating avenue for other veterans to re-establish themselves through social entrepreneurship. Your contributions will make this possible. And by helping to spread the word, you are creating a lasting way to support veterans.

story:
My son, has served in the US Army and Guard for the last 14+ yrs. Before his last deployment he got married, 1 week before shipping out.  Last week he got the Proverbial "Dear John" letter via Facebook. His wife has taken his money and his only place to live. My son is hurt emotionally and broken financially, he does not know I am doing this, I too am financially strapped and over 1000 miles from him.

He has ALWAYS worked hard, had good marks in school and his military service, and in my opinion his Service to his country, and made him a Hero in my eyes.

He will have a job when he returns, but his current car has a bad transmission, and his former place of housing was 20+ miles from his job.

All i ask is that ,you-the community-show my son that his Service was not in vain, whether or not if we agree with the reason we are in the Middle East.

All funds will be used to either fix his car or replace it, and pay for deposit/rent for a simple bachelors apt near work and his Base, until his enlistment expires.

The amount asked for is the Maximum we figured he will need to sign a 1 yr lease and replace his car-if he cannot find a transmission.

story:
My name is Helen Pearson and I have been an enthusiastic skateboarder since I was a kid.  Since skating at the local indoor park as a teenager I had dreams of one day opening a park of my own.  In May 2014 that dream came true.

Taly's is important to me because it was born from a passion and a desire to enrich the lives of skateboarders in my community.

From Competitions to Private Parties to Late Night Skate Sessions Taly’s Skate Park has brought fun to skateboarders of all ages and skill levels.

 By contributing you will be investing in the future of skateboarding, your future and the next generations.

Our goal is to raise $15,000 to help keep Taly’s open until it can run without outside support.

We have built an amazing Indoor Skate Park, now we need help running it until more people hear about us.

The donations are to help pay to run Taly’s for the remainder of 2015 (Heat, hydro, electricity, rent, inventory, supplies and maintenance).

Check out the perks you can receive......most of the perks are experiences you cannot find anywhere else.  You can help design and build our next obstacle, skate with a sponsored skater, have your name on a Taly's deck etc.

If we do not reach our entire goal of $15,000 we will use the money raised to stay open for as long as possible while continuing to build our customer base.

Please help us by contributing and getting the word out about our campaign.

When you share this campaign (by using the indiegogo share tools) tell us what Taly’s means to you and you could win a 1 year membership to the park if we meet our goal.  Check back often to see how we are doing and if your comments have been added to the campaign updates.
    Thank you for your support!!!!!

story:
Twin Sisters Market ~ A Short Summary

The mission of Twin Sisters Market  is to Support development of a strong local food system in the Foothills region of Whatcom County by increasing affordable access to locally grown, healthy foods.

Twin Sisters Market is the product of a group of farmers in the Mount Baker Foothills area of Northwest Washington State coming together to improve access to local food and create a market outlet for produce grown in the Foothills region.  

Through aggregation and cooperative sales of local produce, farmers hope to lower the costs associated with direct market sales.  This allows farmers to get paid a fair price for their produce and allows us to sell produce at more affordable prices in order to better serve Foothills residents.  

Twin Sisters Market aims to embrace our local marketplace and food access challenges.  There are a growing number of young farmers looking to support local markets in the Foothills community while a ‘Food Desert’(Whatcom County Food Summit Report, Dec 2014) simultaneously exists in the same area.  21.1% of all Foothills households rely on food stamps and 68% of children at Kendall Elementary qualify for free-and-reduced lunch. 

History of the Market
In January 2015 a few small-acreage farmer friends started brainstorming the idea of starting up a farmers market in East Whatcom County as there were no fresh produce markets to be had.  An application to the Community Food Coop's Farm Fund kickstarted the project with a $2,000 grant that allowed us to rescue an old abandoned trailer frame from the blackberries and buy supplies to begin transformation into a mobile produce-moving machine.  Our trailer subcommittee spent the next 5 months getting the trailer constructed for opening day.  We purchased metal from the local scrapyard and constructed our mobile enterprise.  
A call was sent out to the local farmer community to see if any other farmers would be interested in participating.  In the end 8 farms signed on for the season, to try out a new model of market.  The Twin Sisters Market is non-traditional.  Farmers collaborate on supplying produce each week, i.e. one farm brings beets, carrots, and kale, while another brings tomatoes, peppers, and cucumbers.  We strive to keep thing equitable and fair, making sure each farm has the opportunity to get a fair piece of the pie.  As a full member of the market you are also expected to work your fair share of the market.  With 8 farms, this meant that each farm had to work approximately one market per month for our June through October season.  
We survived year one with a great response from the community and ran a profitable enterprise.  Farmers made money and the community experienced a huge uptick in access to fresh, local, healthy, and affordable produce.  
The main reason we created and continue to develop this market is that last bit..."access to fresh, local, healthy, and affordable produce".  In order to increase the amount of this type of food that Foothills residents get to eat, we have partnered with the Opportunity Council, Community Food Coop, and  Sustainable Whatcom Fund of the Whatcom Community Foundation to make Foothills dollars go further with a program called the Fresh Bucks program.  With almost a quarter of the residents relying on EBT/SNAP dollars, Twin Sisters Market signed up to  be able to accept EBT/SNAP at both locations.  The Fresh Bucks program lets EBT/SNAP recipients to purchase produce at our market and receive double their food benefits, i.e. for every $10 EBT spent, they receive an additional $10 worth of fresh, healthy food.  

What We Need 

In order to continue this work we need to finish our infrastructure development and we need your support to renovate our mobile produce stands.  This means that we need to install permanent roof material, ensure the electric brakes and other safety features are fully serviced and operational, and install a simple wash station on the trailer.  Additionally we have begun crafting designs to modify the rented market truck to also serve as a mobile produce stand which allows us to serve multiple market sites simultaneously.
The estimated costs are described below:
  • To purchase needed market supplies including an additional scale, tables, tablecloths, plus remaining trailer improvements = $2000
  • To repair trailer brakes and make sure trailer is road safe = $1000
  • To install wash station = $500
  • To purchase a market canopy (plus a few other supplies) and/or modify the truck bed for our Kendall market to provide an instant market = $1000
Our base request is $3500.  With this amount we will be set for an incredible market season.  Currently we rent a truck from Cloud Mountain Farm Center just up the road.  The team at Cloud Mountain have been incredibly helpful and supportive of our project.  But, if we can secure an additional $6,500 we could also purchase a dedicated truck to haul the trailer and modify it to have a permanent pop-up market potential.  

What You Get

Fresh, local, and sustainably grown food...check out the Perks page to see what we can provide you in exchange for your financial support!

The Impact

As you can see, we are in this project because it needs to happen.  Produce needs to make it up valley and people need to be able to afford it.  With our collaborative model we can reach more of our neighbors and offer them high quality food at an affordable price.  Your support helps get us there.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate at this time, please come by and support us in person by buying local at one of our two market locations at Nugent's Corner or Kendall from the first week in June through the last week in October.  Your patronage helps keep us in business.  Also share this fundraiser and information about our Market with your friends.  Thanks!!

For more information remember to check out our webpage at www.twinsistersmarket.com

story:
My name is Nikki Patin. I'm a spoken word artist, graphic designer, photographer, Mom and long-time advocate of survivors of domestic and sexual violence. I'm also a survivor of domestic and sexual violence. 

For almost 15 years, I've used spoken word as a way to teach, heal and advocate. I've appeared on the critically acclaimed HBO's Def Poetry Jam. I've addressed the United Nations in Geneva, Switzerland on behalf of sexual assault survivors. I've headlined a tour in New Zealand and Australia. I've also released several albums and a collection of writing and design. 

I've seen what trauma does to people. As a teaching artist who has taught in juvenile detention centers and some of the toughest schools and communities in Chicago, I know that a kind word and believing people makes all the difference. I also know that we're all surviving something. 

My performances and workshops, as well as the gifts that I'm producing all drive towards the same goal of showing people that we all deserve to tell our story and survive well. My mission is to help people do that. Tell the story. Survive well.

This campaign is important to me because, as much work as I've done, I've never been able to devote my entire life to my performance, advocacy and education work. 

Performing connects me to people and vice versa. I'm often asked what to say to survivors and I repeat the same thing every time:

I'm sorry that this happened to you.

I believe you.

What was done to you was not your fault.

How can I support you?

Many of my friends and collaborators are survivors. Most of us were not supported when we first start talking about what we survived. Friends and family were well-meaning,  but awkward. 

I finally came upon the thought that survivors need their own greeting card and line of healing, inspirational gifts, as well as access to performances and workshops that are designed to help survivors survive well. 

I've designed a prototype, which includes what I always say to survivors and a list of crises hotlines and resources on the back of the card. 

How we respond to survivors has a correlation with how much PTSD they may or may not suffer. I'm hoping that survivewell's gifts, performances and workshops will help people respond to survivors in a supportive way. I'm hoping that survivewell will help folks heal and inspire them to keep surviving well.

Your contribution will fund the first run of the survivewell greeting card, designed to be given to survivors. Your contribution will also help with the fees associated with setting up an LLC, including a consultation with financial and business planner and hiring a PR person. Your contribution will also support the production of survivewell t-shirts, made with organic cotton and manufactured in the U.S.A., as well as small gifts, such as buttons, bookmarks and posters.

The first goal is to register survivewell as an LLC in the state of Illinois. The second goal is to set up an online store. The third goal is to produce first runs of the products listed above. The fourth goal is to meet with a financial and business planner to finalize the business plan. The fifth goal is to design a marketing and publicity strategy. And the eternal goal is use survivewell's multiple platforms to inspire survivors and their supporters to survive well. 

If you contribute up to $20, you'll receive a survivewell small gift set, including a button, greeting card and acknowledgment/link on the survivewell website. 

If you contribute between $20 and $100, you'll receive the survivewell small gift set, a survivewell t-shirt and acknowledgment/link on the survivewell website. 

If you contribute over $100, you'll receive the survivewell gift basket, which includes the small gift set AND survivewell's favorite handmade beauty and bath products, as well as acknowledgment/link on the survivewell website. 

If you contribute over $1000, you'll receive all of the above, plus a free webinar on using spoken word to heal, inspire and transform, facilitated by Nikki patin. 

If you contribute over $10,000, Nikki will write and perform an original piece for you live, anywhere in the world. 

For those who can't contribute financially, shouting out this campaign helps. Vocalizing your support helps. Believing me and all survivors helps. Well wishes and good thoughts help.
story_txt:
My name is Nikki Patin. I'm a spoken word artist, graphic designer, photographer, Mom and long-time advocate of survivors of domestic and sexual violence. I'm also a survivor of domestic and sexual violence. 
For almost 15 years, I've used spoken word as a way to teach, heal and advocate. I've appeared on the critically acclaimed HBO's Def Poetry Jam. I've addressed the United Nations in Geneva, Switzerland on behalf of sexual assault survivors. I've headlined a tour in New Zealand and Australia. I've also released several albums and a collection of writing and design. I've seen what trauma does to people. As a teaching artist who has taught in juvenile detention centers and some of the toughest schools and communities in Chicago, I know that a kind word and believing people makes all the difference. I also know that we're all surviving something. My performances and workshops, as well as the gifts that I'm producing all drive towards the same goal of showing people that we all deserve to tell our story and survive well. My mission is to help people do that. Tell the story. Survive well.This campaign is important to me because, as much work as I've done, I've never been able to devote my entire life to my performance, advocacy and education work. Performing connects me to people and vice versa. I'm often asked what to say to survivors and I repeat the same thing every time:I'm sorry that this happened to you.I believe you.What was done to you was not your fault.How can I support you?Many of my friends and collaborators are survivors. Most of us were not supported when we first start talking about what we survived. Friends and family were well-meaning,  but awkward. I finally came upon the thought that survivors need their own greeting card and line of healing, inspirational gifts, as well as access to performances and workshops that are designed to help survivors survive well. I've designed a prototype, which includes what I always say to survivors and a list of crises hotlines and resources on the back of the card. How we respond to survivors has a correlation with how much PTSD they may or may not suffer. I'm hoping that survivewell's gifts, performances and workshops will help people respond to survivors in a supportive way. I'm hoping that survivewell will help folks heal and inspire them to keep surviving well.Your contribution will fund the first run of the survivewell greeting card, designed to be given to survivors. Your contribution will also help with the fees associated with setting up an LLC, including a consultation with financial and business planner and hiring a PR person. Your contribution will also support the production of survivewell t-shirts, made with organic cotton and manufactured in the U.S.A., as well as small gifts, such as buttons, bookmarks and posters.The first goal is to register survivewell as an LLC in the state of Illinois. The second goal is to set up an online store. The third goal is to produce first runs of the products listed above. The fourth goal is to meet with a financial and business planner to finalize the business plan. The fifth goal is to design a marketing and publicity strategy. And the eternal goal is use survivewell's multiple platforms to inspire survivors and their supporters to survive well. If you contribute up to $20, you'll receive a survivewell small gift set, including a button, greeting card and acknowledgment/link on the survivewell website. If you contribute between $20 and $100, you'll receive the survivewell small gift set, a survivewell t-shirt and acknowledgment/link on the survivewell website. If you contribute over $100, you'll receive the survivewell gift basket, which includes the small gift set AND survivewell's favorite handmade beauty and bath products, as well as acknowledgment/link on the survivewell website. If you contribute over $1000, you'll receive all of the above, plus a free webinar on using spoken word to heal, inspire and transform, facilitated by Nikki patin. If you contribute over $10,000, Nikki will write and perform an original piece for you live, anywhere in the world. For those who can't contribute financially, shouting out this campaign helps. Vocalizing your support helps. Believing me and all survivors helps. Well wishes and good thoughts help.

story:
Who We Are

Red Elm Café is the brain-child of three sisters living in the Hilltop neighborhood of Tacoma, Wash. What started as a dream of buying a coffee shop to run, quickly turned into a dream of creating a place in our neighborhood where people could meet with friends over good food.

This is a big dream that has been in the making for two years. It is a dream for a community gathering place in the neighborhood we love. It is a dream for a bacon cheddar waffle and a really great cappuccino on a Tuesday morning.

Red Elm Café will be the mom and pop (or sister and sister and sister) home away from home—where the place smells like espresso and blueberry muffins and the staff is happy to see you (the staff is us and we will be happy to see you).

Two years ago we started planning and searching for a space to open up shop. In that time we have filled Adina’s garage with refrigerators and her basement with tables and chairs. We have stacked dishes and high chairs in Jenn’s office and parked an espresso machine in her laundry room. And a shiny pile of kitchen sinks greets Sarah at her front door every morning. We are so ready to move these treasures into our café space and plug in and go, but we need to make one final push to get us open.

Help us make this dream a reality and get Hilltop a great place for breakfast and coffee!

What We Need & What You Get

We are reaching out to our friends and neighbors for support to bring this cafe to Hilltop!

We are looking to raise $25,000 (or more!) to get our espresso counter built in and put up walls for a reservable conference room (you can reserve it for a birthday party, or maybe a business meeting!). We also need to purchase a few last pieces of equipment to bring you the tastiest waffles and sandwiches, plus we need to pay to get the lights on and water running.

Be a part of building Red Elm Cafe & check out the sweet perks of donating!


$5 – A high-five and a coffee when you visit Red Elm Cafe! And our eternal gratitude (of course)

$10 – Red Elm Bumper Sticker 

$30 – Upcycled Red Elm T-shirt (no two shirts are the same!)

$50 – 10 pre-purchased coffees (when we open you get to use your coffee card for 10 drinks of any size)

$50 – 10 Pre-purchased Bacon-Cheddar Waffles

$100 – Red Elm T-shirt + 1 lb whole bean Caravan coffee + hand-written Thank You note + our undying love

$250 - Two Red Elm Upcycled T-shirts + Red Elm Bumper Sticker + 1 lb whole bean Caravan Coffee + our eternal gratitude & undying love

$500 – One Coffee Training session to make the perfect cappuccino (limit 5)

$1000 – Coffee Training + Latte Art Class for you and a friend (limit 4)

$2000 – UNLIMITED Coffee for One Year

All donations will go toward bringing Red Elm Cafe to life!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please spread the word about Red Elm Cafe using the share tools on this page or posting the link to your Facebook page. 

Every little bit helps!

story:
Times Square, New York, the US                                      

Media all over the world



Amy's team will establish "Amy's foundation" and contribute 5% of the sales to charity to help dropouts.


                                            

  


We are seeking for international cooperation. Any questions, please feel free to contact us: sales@amyrobotics.com



FAQ

Q:Does AMY Robot need Internet?

A:Yes, it needs to connect with WIFI/4G.

Q:How many administrator accounts it has to remotely  control the AMY robot? Is there any maximum number limite??

A:There is no administrator accounts number limites, AMY robot supports multiple user connection. You can download an AMY client APP and register a personal account to controle Amy’ move remotely. 

Q:How to use AMY Robot?

A:You can find Amy`s user manual once come with AMY Robot package.

Q:Will Amy hit into the furniture or the wall?

A:Amy has self-protection system with obstacle avoidance, she can recognize the obstacles in 500px circle around her body automatically.

Q:How long is the battery life of Amy? And how is she got charged?

A:Her battery can last 10-12 hours with full capacity. She will go to the charger dock and charge herself automatically when the battery is under 10-20% capacity. 

Q:How many languages can Amy speak?

A:Amy supports multiple languages. We will keep the official website posted as we add languages.

Q:Can Amy climb stairs?

A:No, she cannot. She can only move on the flat floor currently.

Q:What is the difference between Amy’s tele-presence with IMs?

A:Amy`s tele-presence is different to traditional IM communication. Amy can be your physical presence at home or office, you can controle her’move remotely through Appas a friendly speech interaction and alsosupports she supports tele-presence between multiple people anytime, anywhere without interrupting handswork,she provides a better and more real communication experience through friendly speech interaction, face recognition and powerful artificial intelligence. 

Q:How to clean Amy robot?

A:You can use soft towel in the package and whipped it softly you are also welcome to Amy’s store and cleaninside body of in a stable period. 

Q:Does it work with iOS and Android Devices or my computer? 

A: AMY is compatible with Android devices,IOS will be available in the near future. She also has a web interface so you can interact via computer.

Q:How does AMY protect my privacy?

A: AMY only collects data it needs, keeps it encrypted, and doesn’t transmit any personal data back to our servers. All sensitive data like passwords are encrypted with 256-bit AES encryption to ensure that no one can ever gain access to them. AMY may collect some data anonymously for purposes of improving the product. You will have control of how much data AMY shares with us and can turn off sharing if you like. 

Q:When will my AMY ship?

A:We plan to ship AMY on August 2016. You will be the very select few to receive AMY first around November this year.

Q:Which countries do you ship AMY to?

A:We provide worldwide shipping. 

Q:Can I give AMY a different name?

A:For now, you have to call her by her name, AMY, to start interaction with her Name customization will be available in the future.

Q:Is AMY under warranty?

A:All product specifications, illustrations, drawings, particulars, dimensions and other information on the Site or made available by us are intended to represent no more than a general illustration of the Product and its features and do not constitute a warranty or representation by us that the Product will conform with the same.

We offer 1 year warranty on Amy except for artificial damage.

Q:If I have other questions, who should I contact?

A:We are receiving a lot of inquiries and are responding as fast as possible. Please contact sales@amyrobotics.com with any other questions you may have.

story:
It's all about a great browser extension!

The EU regulations require that every website must get user's permission before installing cookies. If you surf anonymously or if you delete cookies regularly because you care about your privacy, you'll see the same cookie notices and warnings many many times all over again, probably every day, on every website, and you'll have to click some "confirm" or "ok, i agree" button on all of them all the time. Fun, right? :)

"I don't care about cookies" is my browser extension which removes these cookie warnings from tens of thousands of european websites. I develop it for 2 years and it now works in Firefox (and Firefox for Android), Pale Moon, Chrome, Opera and it can also be installed into ABP or uBlock so you can use it in Internet Explorer, Safari and others.



Take a look at the Project Homepage for download instructions.


Please help it grow

People from all over EU report remaining cookie notices. With help from a good friend from the Netherlands (he's retired, I'd be really happy to send part of your donations to him), I regularly check thousands of reported websites and implement new rules into extension.

I try to make it better almost every day and it's really time consuming. If you can, please make a small donation. Your money will matter, I feel great when someone decides to support the project which makes me work on it even harder.

And spread the word! :) At the moment, more than 55.000 satisfied people use it daily. Many more need yet to find it.


I thank you in advance!
Daniel

story:
What is CROW Recycling?

CROW recycling is a social enterprise with charitable status, established in 1985. Its work force is comprised of full time staff, part-timers and volunteers with learning disabilities. These volunteers spend a large amount of their time at CROW interacting with the other employees as well as helping out with the recycling business which helps keep them busy and feel productive. We try to create a "win-win" situation for our community by helping the disabled as well as promoting and providing recycling of various materials.
This year due to the loss of important clients to large corporate waste management firms CROW has lost a lot of revenue. We have discovered many potential ways of raising funds to make up this revenue but we require some time for our efforts to pay off. I am trying to help my charity stay afloat long enough to allow us to put it back on its feet again.

Most importantly, this campaign is a saviour for the people working at Crow Recycling. For most employees CROW is like a second home. John Gatter, 67 our longest serving volunteer of 20 years says “I never want to retire from CROW, I’d just sit around at home with nothing to do. I don’t want to vegetate”

Who is running this campaign and why?

My name is Julia Gandy. I was initially the Scrapstore Manager at CROW and have since become the Center Manager. I see CROW as more than a job. The ultimate reason for CROW’s existence is to offer people who have learning disabilities or who are otherwise disadvantaged in the work place somewhere to come and learn basic skills, socialise and feel part of a team. I feel very strongly about keeping CROW alive!

What We Need & What You Get

Our needs: 

The money from this project will be used to meet expenses for the month of April after which, if everything goes to plan then we should be self sustainable once more! 

5000£ will be spent as follows: Rent - 250; Water utilities - 84; Phone and Broadband- 36; Gas and Electric - 209; Security - 70; Tax + Insurance on vehicle - 84; Van repairs - 150; Fuel - 167; Insurance costs - 883; Wages - 3,084

We have come up with a list of unique rewards that will make you feel part of the CROW family from the moment you donate!

1)  Biggest donor reward -  You will get a personalised item hand-crafted by the CROW volunteers made especially for you materials from the CROW Scrapstore.

2)  100£ –  A random item from the Scrapstore materials hand-crafted by a volunteer.

3)  50£ – An invitiation to a tour of the CROW recycling facility in Coventry and an opportunity to meet the volunteers.

4)  30£ – Free Access to the CROW Scrapstore for the year. 

5)  10£– Your name will be added to a list of donors which will displayed in the lobby of the CROW Recycling facility visible to all that visit/ work at CROW.

6)  For Business owners that donate and want CROW to take care of their future recycling needs - A  one off  free collection /shredding for your confidential documents /records.

7) For all donors -Invitation  for  you to join  with us  this Summer 2015 to celebrate our 30th Anniversary !

Your Impact

Your donations will have an immediate impact. We will be able to pay our bills for April and continue to operate. We also hope that the awareness around CROW that we create through this campaign and through our new marketing strategies will start to help us gain new clients and set us back on the path of self-sustainability.

Risks & Challenges

  • CROW has always had to be flexible with our approach to the challenges of running a small charity. Our dedicated team of staff and our board of trustees have always been hands-on when it comes to problem solving. As a business CROW has had to reinvent itself in the past to take advantage of opportunities as they have arisen, we have organically evolved to build our customer base. Between us we feel that we have the skills and abilities needed to overcome any hurdles to keep CROW going.
  • Loss of funding and changes in the market are the biggest obstacles to CROW staying successful in our mission to provide a supported work experience environment for our volunteers

Other Ways You Can Help

We urge to promote this campaign as well as help spread the word about CROW and what we do. Even if you are not convinced enough to contribute to our cause we would greatly appreciate you sharing any ideas you may have about possible solutions for helping us.

story:
POUR LA VERSION FRANCAISE, CONSULTEZ WWW.SYNAPSE-LABS.FR




IOTA (noun) : The very first complete media center that is also a Bitcoin relay, rewarding you in bitcoins.


PC/Mediacenter acting as Bitcoin relay : IOTA



// IOTA - THE HARDWARE


Personal multimedia computer.


Dimensions : L20cm x L20cm x H5cm

Specifications :

- Intel i3 processor 17W low consumption / high performance

- MSATA64Go (+ HDD 1To) - RAM4G

- HD Intel Series Graphic card

- 802.11ac Wifi

- Infrared remote control

- Gigabit LAN

- 4xUSB3 – 2xUSB2

- HD Audio line IN/OUT

- VGA – HDMI 1.4



The IOTA box is black brushed-aluminum, with a contemporary world-class design perfect for any home office or living room, produces no noise (0db) and consumes only 30 watts.

              


// IOTA - THE SOFTWARE

Where your mediacenter becomes and entertainment center !

IOTA is ready for use, out-of-the-box, and connects to any TV by the standard HDMI. IOTA integrates the Kodi® Entertainment Center (known previously as XBMC™) the most useful and most successful mediacenter.

Access your digital data from any virtual source, including CD, DVD, USB drive, Internet and LAN. Connect to the Internet Movie Database or CDDB to retrieve cinema, video and music information. The IOTA software also offers the possibility of streaming videos and Internet radio, including Shoutcast and Last.fm or Spotify®!

Your IOTA system offers an all-in-one, music, photo library management and video center enabled for a long list of video codecs and formats.

This flexible interface is fully customizable and is adaptable to multiple application. Thanks to linux and Kodi® technology, additional online modules are available, including: film trailer and radio modules, subtitle services, CD art and video art management, as well as access to YouTube, Facebook, and Twitter.

NB: Neither IOTA nor Kodi® provide media content.


Music

IOTA can play most all audio formats, but also arrange and manage your music files in a comprehensive library. Your music library allows search by artists, genre, or year. Through its Internet connection, IOTA can even display the lyrics of your favorite songs.


Movies

IOTA allows you to import, browse, and play your videos from any source connected to, or networked with IOTA! Via third party plugins, IOTA supports all video formats and live video streaming.


TVShows

Create a library by saving your favorite TV shows stored on an internal or external drive, as well as from your shared server. IOTA allows organisation of your favorite shows by season and episodes and keeps track of the shows you’ve watched, so you always know where you left off.


Streaming Channels

Access hundreds of live TV channels as well as VOD like Netflix !


Photos

Import your images into your IOTA library and browse through the different views available. Right from your couch, using your remote, you can build a slideshow or categorize and organize all of your photos.



Weather

Display weather data of your location and your favorite cities ! 


Interface customization


Create your own categories with an intuitive and fully customizable interface! Add some widgets or create your own submenus, everything is possible with IOTA!


Addons

                 


You can always add functionality to your multimedia experience from your sofa or anywhere else ! Kodi® is an open source software for which a community of web developers constantly create new features. A wide selection of plugins are available through various portals, and addons are available from most web services.



UPNP (Universal Plug and Play)

With its UPnP compatibility, you can share from/to IOTA. This universal network protocol, allows you to enjoy and share your media to or from any mobile device or computer on your local wireless or Ethernet network.

IOTA is also Airplay ready.





WHY IOTA ?

IOTA is a technology born of the demand to strengthen and support the rapidly increasing number of transactions over the Bitcoin network. Our technology will achieve this by an even distribution of Bitcoin relays around the globe. By multiplying the number of relays throughout the world, the transmission time of Bitcoin transactions will decrease from the present delay of minutes, to just seconds.

Bitcoin is a decentralized digital cash system, that differs from all state currencies as bitcoins are not produced by a central bank, but are generated by a digital process called ‘mining’, which takes place in hundreds of datacenters throughout the world, called mining farms. One bitcoin today trades at 241.2 USD, and is created as a reward for payment processing work.

All Bitcoin miners offer their computing power to verify and record payments into the public ledger. These users are rewarded with new bitcoins proportional to the amount of computing power they donate to the network. 

But the public Bitcoin network is also made up of merchants, exchangers, users and other relay nodes. These are essential members of the network who are not compensated for securing and strengthening the network. 

Your IOTA mediacenter is a paid Bitcoin relay.

To strengthen Bitcoin it is necessary to spread evenly around the globe a great number of transaction relays.


// THE REWARD


When IOTA is ON whether you use it or not it acts as a relay and you get paid !

How ? In bitcoins.

How often ? Daily.

How much is worth one bitcoin ? today: ~$242 USD.

Can you trade it ? yes (www.bitstamp.net).

What could i buy with bitcoins ? Whatever you want or need.

How much IOTA pays you ?

The goal of the node is to be online 24/7 and thus can relay transactions in its perimeter. 

By default, IOTA will only use 100kbits/sec IN and OUT (10% of an average dsl line OUT) ~1Mbits/sec).

Thus, the user letting IOTA switched on will be rewarded as a Bitcoin miner owning around 150GH/s mining power. A miner with this computing speed will get rewarded around 1 bitcoin among 36 months*, knowing the payments are on daily basis : 0,001BTC or 100000 Satoshi per day. (One Satoshi is the tiniest fraction of a Bitcoin (0,00000001BTC)).

How does it work ? 

You create a Bitcoin wallet on a platform like Blockchain.info / Coinbase / Paymium ( France ). You fill your Bitcoin wallet address (account number ) in your IOTA interface. See a daily payment satoshis on your interface against part of the  uptime of your IOTA .

It can stay always on because its power consumption is reduced below 30W. IOTA still acts as a relay during media player sessions and do not affect in any way your experience.

IOTA will not mess with your internet bandwidth or your DslTV broadcast because you can set a limit in the usage of your your connection

IOTA’s custom interface will show you the hosted Bitcoin Core activity. It will display the status of the node and activity surrounding it : blockchain size, connected pairs, total bitcoins mined, total number of bit coin nodes, and more…

Today (2015/05/19) one bitcoin can be bought around 240$, its value went from $00 in 2009 to over $1000 in november 2013.

What will 1 bitcoin earned with IOTA be worth in 3 years ?

* estimate of total awards received between 04/15/2015 and 04/15/2018


Who are we ?

IOTA is supported by the business startup, Synapse Labs. 

www.synapse-labs.fr 

The Synapse Labs is a team of six community-oriented, multimedia specialists and crypto-currency enthusiasts aiming to share the success and benefits of free software through innovative products and services to as many people as possible.

With over 15 years experience, our team at Synapse Labs works passionately to leverage our competence in systems integration and security, network engineering, the graphic and media arts, and in all Internet technologies.

Our primary objective is to strengthen Bitcoin and make the Bitcoin network more efficient, multiplying the number of active bitcoin relays by distributing a maximum number of units across the globe.

Secondly, we offer IOTA users exclusive services and both additional software and hardware features to make the most of the system’s potential.


Why do we need your help ?


The IOTA project is a community vision, and it is as a community that the IOTA System will succeed. It is in this spirit of community that we are initiating our crowd-funding campaign with INDIEGOGO to raise funds for the completion of the IOTA Project and secure the manufacture of the IOTA box.

The aim of the campaign is to finance the production and delivery of 200 IOTA boxes, in order to have a primary beneficial impact on the health of the Bitcoin network, and to enable the distribution of a larger number of units. For this we have established our first level goal of $ 65000 (60 000 €).

The first 100 IOTA units will be available at the exclusive price of $299 USD.

The next 200 units will be available at $359 USD, as a special price before market availability to the public.

Once available to the general public, the IOTA mediacenter will be priced at $379 USD.

A small precision : IOTA will be made in France.


THE ROAD MAP:

yesterday, today and tomorrow


March 2014 - A growing demand for the Bitcoin Relay

June 2014 - Birth of IOTA concept : 

Reward for Bitcoin Relay supply through a competitive multimedia product.

October 2014 - 

Proof of concept IOTA, version 0.1, achieves marriage of hardware and software


December 2014 - Design for IOTA 1.0

February 2015 - IOTA is out of the box-ready

March 2015 - First prototype goes into production

May 2015 - IOTA appears on the web and in social networks!


Finance campaign began ! May 19 2015


May 2015 - Refined interface and production model finalized

June 2015 - Final testing and certification.

August 2015 - The first 100 units of the IOTA Mediacenter go into production.

September - October 2015

Deliver the first 200 units and launch production of next 100 units of IOTA mediacenter.

December 2015 - Further development of new IOTA modules:

- wireless (inductive) charging station

- home surveillance caméra

- home air quality detector


- DECRYPTION - lexicon


Encrypted Currency

Often called crypto currency is a medium of exchange and electronic payment using cryptography to secure the transactions and to control the creation of new monetary units.

BlockChain

A distributed data store that holds a public ledger of transactions in cryptocurrencies. This record is enforced cryptographically and hosted on machines running the software.

P2P or Peer to Peer

P2P is a distributed, non-centralized information network in which there is no single server containing the exchanged data. The data is divided and distributed among several copies to all network clients.

BTC, XBT, mBTC, µBTC

The abbreviated currency code for the bitcoin is BTC or XBT. BTC is an informal acronym as with most crypto-currencies and XBT is the acronym validated by ISO standards. As bitcoins have appreciated in value, it has become increasingly common to work with thousandths or even millionths of bitcoins, which are called millibitcoins (mBTC) and microbitcoins (μBTC), respectively.

Satoshi

The smallest unit, a hundred millionth of a bitcoin (0.00000001 bitcoin), is called a satoshi in honor of Satoshi Nakamoto

0,00000001BTC.

ASIC

ASIC stands for Application-Specific Integrated Circuit, which is a microchip designed for a special application. In crypto-currencies, ASICs are used to solve a mining puzzle algorithm, for example, SCRIPT or SHA-256.

Mining

This refers to the actual creation of currency by the solving of the mining puzzle algorithm.

Hash

The term «hashing» means how quickly your hardware is processing data from the Blockchain. A hash algorithm turns an arbitrarily-large amount of data into a fixed-length hash. The same hash will always result from the same data, but modifying the data by even one bit will completely change the hash. Like all computer data, hashes are large numbers, and are usually written as hexadecimal.

GH/S - Gigahashes/sec

The number of hashes calculated in a second. This measures the power of a component or ASIC network.

“Mining farms”

Large spaces (buildings) combining a number of ASIC generating units blasting powers of the order of Petahash (1000000GH).


- CONTACTS -


Nordine Rharrabti - Founder

nordine@synapse-labs.fr


Pascal Forest - Co-Founder

pascal@synapse-labs.fr


Veronica Gallardo - Sales manager

veronica@synapse-labs.fr


Hakim Achahbar - Community manager

hakim@synapse-labs.fr


Yennis Bouillet - Community manager

yennis@synapse-labs.fr



David Cuel-Oller - Webmaster 

david@synapse-labs.fr



http://www.synapse-labs.fr / info@synapse-labs.fr

https://facebook.com/IOTAbySynapseLabs

https://twitter.com/JeSuisIOTA

story:
Why another search engine?

Nowadays we have a several free and open source operating systems, applications and services: GNU/Linux, Firefox, Gimp, Wikipedia, etc. Why we do not have a online, ad-free, powerful and open source search engine?


What are the principles of the project?

  1. Trokam respect your privacy. Trokam does not collect any private data. Trokam deliver the same results no matter who or where the user is.
  2. Trokam does not have advertisement mixed with search results. There is no commercial mechanism to influence the visibility of a particular result.
  3. Results are auditable. A user could easily know what words Trokam considered relevant in an specific web page using ‘audit’ button.
  4. Trokam is free software. All the code is available under GPLv2 (github.com/trokam). There is a web site to discuss development ideas (dev.trokam.com).
What is the benefit for you: trust.


You could help!

There is a lot of work to do! You could test the current development of Trokam, a far cry from a world class search engine. Fortunately, there several ways you could help in order we reach such goal,

  • Try Trokam and send me your opinion. Remind that this is an ongoing project, however if users do not find it valuable this is over!
  • Are you expert in C++, web development or databases? Take a look a the open issues and the Trokam Dev web site. Any suggestions?
  • Your contribution to fund this project fundamental! Trokam does not have advertisement.
  • Spread the word!


If you donate

If you donate, I would be happy to publish a short bio of you, a picture (of you, your pet, etc.) and some links (your profile, your web page, your project, etc.) in the Thanks! page.

Tell me also if you would like that I publish the amount of your donation.

I will not publish your email, unless you explicitly tell me that you want I do so.

Write me to nicolas.slusarenko@trokam.com

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Frans Swanepoel, I am a warm hearted family man, married with 5 children, and I have a passion for people. I have been awarded a PhD degree in Business Management and Marketing in 2008, and I have vast experience in Farming, Telecommunication, Medical, Assurance, starting up and building up new business successfully. 

Due to the poor quality and the serious shortage of FOOD in South Africa (quite frankly all over the world). I have designed an extremely powerful and highly productive Micro ORGANIC farm that fits into ONLY 200 square meters.This farm is built out of our own uniquely designed "Thermo Mat Plastic" that breaks up the sun's light bundles and re-binds it into separate light bundles that are perfect for enhancing plant growth. We create the perfect weather inside the greenhouse all year long. Ensuring the continuous and yearly growth of produce, including, more than 5 000 vegetable and herbal plants as well as 3 Ton's of Fish and 850 chickens. We can place these farms anywhere in the world, as they are easy to assemble, small and mobile.

This is the solution to one of the world's largest challenges, namely, food shortages. My campaign is now to get this awesome solution out there and give YOU, and other people, access to healthy food and supply food to people where it was never before possible. We have created a self sustainable, community up-liftment, initiative to be used all over the world. We all TALK about the frightening statistics of people dying of hunger every day, but what are we DOING about it?

Please I need your help, to make a difference in the world. Give people hope where it was never before possible. Your contribution will save lives and will have a very large impact on our children's future and that of all the other wonderful people on earth. 

What We Need & What You Get

My aim is to raise $ 2 000 000 that will be utilized to build these Micro Farms. They will be placed it in the most needed areas where people currently don't have access to food or fresh foods. We have over 12 000 000 people going hungry to bed every night just in South Africa alone.

Imagine how your contribution will create a permanent solution of placing food into peoples hands who are so close to dying of hunger. You will leave a legacy on earth, giving life to people in dire straits. 

BUT AT THE SAME TIME WE WANT TO OFFER YOU THE OPPORTUNITY TO BECOME PART OF OUR BUSINESS. 

NOW, FOR A LIMITED TIME, YOU CAN BECOME A MEMBER FOR ONLY $100 PER MONTH. ONCE YOU ARE A MEMBER YOU WILL AUTOMATICALLY  BECOME A BENEFICIARY OF THE TRUST. THE OUTLETS, BUILT WITH THE FUNDS WE RAISE, WILL BE REGISTERED IN THIS TRUST. THIS MEANS YOU WILL BECOME A CO-OWNER OF ALL THESE OUTLETS.

If I don't raise all the money it purely means that I will build less farms out there, than I imagined, to help people in serious need.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are NOT in a position to help us money wise, you can still make a huge difference by spreading the news. Please folks help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

to be used all over the world. We all TALK about the frightening statistics of
people dying of hunger every day, but what are we DOING about it?
Please I need your help, to
make a difference in the world. Give people hope where it was never
before possible. Your contribution will save lives and will have
a very large impact on our children's future and that of all the other wonderful
people on earth. 
What We Need &
What You Get
My aim is to raise $ 2 000 000 that will be utilized to build
these Micro Farms. They will be placed it in the most needed areas where people
currently don't have access to food or fresh foods. We have over 12 000 000
people going hungry to bed every night just in South Africa alone.
Imagine how your contribution will create a permanent solution of
placing food into peoples hands who are so close to dying of hunger. You will
leave a legacy on earth, giving life to people in dire straits. 
BUT AT THE SAME TIME WE WANT TO OFFER YOU THE OPPORTUNITY TO
BECOME PART OF OUR BUSINESS. 
NOW, FOR A LIMITED TIME, YOU CAN BECOME A MEMBER FOR ONLY $100 PER
MONTH. ONCE YOU ARE A MEMBER YOU WILL AUTOMATICALLY  BECOME A BENEFICIARY
OF THE TRUST. THE OUTLETS, BUILT WITH THE FUNDS WE RAISE, WILL BE REGISTERED IN
THIS TRUST. THIS MEANS YOU WILL BECOME A CO-OWNER OF ALL THESE OUTLETS.
If I don't raise all the money it purely means that I will build
less farms out there, than I imagined, to help people in serious need.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are NOT in a position to help us money wise, you can still
make a huge difference by spreading the news. Please folks
help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
***Just one day to go, now is the time to show your support.***

I've been getting really great feedback about our concept and we've had an outstanding amount of traffic on the site in the last few days. Thanks to everyone I met at Paleofx in Austin for taking the time to look us up and check out our story.

We want to make low-carb options as easy as getting your favorite cup of coffee! Consider contributing the amount of your favorite cup of coffee. We believe in truth and wisdom and want to give you more control of your food choices and make it easier for you and family to enjoy the benefits of a low-carb diet. 

Participation at just one dollar will demonstrate support. Now is the time to make it happen. Thank you for helping us reach our goal!

Our Story

We want to open a shop serving delicious low-carb food that is convenient when you are short on time. We all know where to find fast food, but we want healthy fast food. We want to open Tambourine where everything we serve is low-carb (gluten-free and sugar-free too!), delicious, and reliable: your go-to on the go. Our name comes from being inspired by music and travel. Tambourines make us happy and we like to eat foods that make us happy too! We will offer food that both tastes good and makes us feel good!

Low-carb diets are already preferred by many people. A diet with low-carbs and healthy fats helps regulate blood sugar, energy, moods, and weight. With current options, it's not always easy to come by.

Our mission is to give you more control of of what you eat by making delicious low-carb meals readily available while living our busy lives.

                             

Why are low-carb options important? 

  • Scientific research shows physical and mental health benefits when carbohydrate consumption is reduced. Our son was 7 years old when he was diagnosed with a mental illness. After several years of medications and therapies, it was the low-carb eating plan that brought us real hope in managing his symptoms. We have experienced so many benefits from the low-carb lifestyle including having more energy and more mental clarity.  

  • Low-carb diets have been shown to improve symptoms of the following mental and physical conditions: ADHD, anxiety and stress, chronic headaches and migraines, depression, diabetes, epilepsy, focus and concentration problems, inflammatory conditions and diseases (arthritis), insomnia, intestinal problems, gluten sensitivity, memory problems related to preliminary Alzheimer’s, mood disorders, overweight and obesity, Tourette’s, and more. 
    -Perlmutter, David, Grain Brain, Little, Brown and Company, New York, 2013.

  • Families, athletes, professionals, and others are looking for healthy low-carb food options!

                 

Why IndieGoGo?

For everyone who understands low-carb high-fat eating, many people think it’s crazy because it contradicts the dietary guidelines from the last 40 years. Have you or someone you know ever had success with low-carb eating? It can be hard to maintain because sugar and carbs have become so pervasive in our eating habits. Tambourine offers all low-carb options, so you can enjoy everything without feeling guilty or worrying about the consequences.

We need the wisdom of crowds to help get this idea off the ground as shown in this presentation by Tom Naughton:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KzPnnDDCIjo&feature=youtu.be
He had an alternate title called, “Why people looking for health advice are turning away from doctors, nutritionists, government agencies, medical trade organizations, and other established authorities and are instead getting information from bloggers, podcasters, independent filmmakers, and countless other dedicated amateurs who communicate through social media.”

Our great-grandparents knew about sensible eating, so did athletic trainers and doctors of their generation; it’s time to bring this wisdom back and we need everyone to be a part of it.

It's about community. We want to build community together and offer something new!  In fact, we have decided to donate a portion of our proceeds from this campaign to the Edgewood Center for Children and Families and the UCSF Pediatric Obesity Clinic.

Contribute now and we can get the word out together!

Support for Tambourine

Nina Teicholz, best selling author of The Big Fat Surprise, supports our idea and contributed at the founder level.  

Here's what some people have been saying about a low-carb diet and Tambourine:

"This is a great idea! I can't believe it doesn't exist already. I am always frustrated when I can't find low-carb options. I needed Tambourine yesterday." - Renee, executive coach, Arizona

"Switching to low-carb meals was like waking up from a coma." - Dave, software engineer, San Francisco

“I do it because I want better health. It doesn’t change my previous diet, Just removed some part.” - Rie, speech pathologist, Japan

"I used to do it, but then it was too hard to find the right food and I didn't have enough time." - Maria, nail salon owner, San Francisco

Your donation is important to make Tambourine a reality. We are committed that everything we offer will be low in carbohydrate content. Our dishes will be made with natural, antibiotic-free, GMO-free, and gluten-free ingredients. There will be a range of dishes from vegetarian to dairy-free and more so that everyone can get what they know is best for them and it will be quick and easy! Even better, the food we serve will be so tasty that everyone will want to come and enjoy it.

                     

What We Need

While our long-term goal remains the same, to open a storefront, this initial campaign will help us with our first step to open a pop-up restaurant this year. We have a potential location near Golden Gate Park that we are very excited about! 

Contribute now and for $25, you will get a $100 gift certificate to be redeemed when we open! Tell your friends so they can get this special offer too. This will only be available for a limited time!

For $100, your name will be along side Nina Teicholz and others on Founder's Wall in our shop and on our website. 

Check out our family dinner special and get a preview of our tasty options!

Tambourine offers you familiar favorites prepared without carbs and without having to do all the research and time-consuming food preparations. That is something you can count on!



We are passionate about this idea and we are committed to making Tambourine a reality for everyone to enjoy. We understand the value and benefits of low-carb living and want to make it accessible for everyone.

When you contribute today you get to help develop the idea. You will be a part of Tambourine as we build the business from concept to reality. 

The Impact

Have you seen the latest headlines and research about nutrition? The recent Diabetes Summit offered a whole day of seminars about how low-carb diets reduce symptoms of diabetes and can even reverse the disease. Those suffering from mental illnesses also see a reduction in symptoms when following a lot-carb diet. Past and current research is revealing the truth and our food choices do not yet reflect the most recent scientific studies. 

Imagine being able to choose low-carb nutritious food in the same context that you can get quick and easy pastries or sandwiches. We need low-carb options to have more control of our choices.  

Recent science has shown that our bodies perform well with a low carbohydrate diet enhanced by healthy fats and that too much sugar and too many carbohydrates cause inflammation and disease. We need Tambourine to offer convenient and healthy food options. Support us today to make this happen!

We need  convenient low-carb options, just like vegetarians have vegetarian options and burger lovers have burger joints. Tambourine has a mission to make that happen! "The most rigorous science now support this [a diet high in fat is healthier than a diet high in carbohydrates]" idea, (Nina Teicholz, The Big Fat Surprise, 2014).

Sheila is a certified Primal Blueprint Expert and has thoroughly researched the science and the benefits of grain-free and sugar-free meals. She understands the nuts and bolts of a low-carb diet and is ready to share this knowledge so everyone can benefit!  

                                                        


Please contribute what you can today to support Tambourine. With your help we can make low-carb food a convenient reality for you and everyone.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for supporting our campaign. There are many ways for you to get involved:
Spread the word about Tambourine !
  • Tell people you know about our campaign.
    Access the easy to use share tools to spread the word as far and wide as possible.
  • Is Tambourine something you need too? Participate as soon as you are able to and and encourage your friends and family to do the same. The more support we get, the more others will jump on board too.
  • Do you have friends at the gym or the office who are obsessed with a paleo or primal diet? Tell them about the Tambourine campaign so they can have control of their convenient food options too.
  • You just never know and you can be a part of something special and changemaking from the start! Participate today and then tell your friends about it. 
  • You support your community, value diversity of choice, and respond to the results of scientific studies! We look forward to sharing recipes and meals with you!
                   

We would like to send out a special thanks to the supporters in preparing this campaign: IndieGoGo, Project5 SF, Ben Estabrook, Goodie Godmother, David Manning, Owen O'Connor, Sage O'Connor, Ruby O'Connor, David O'Connor, Natalie de Bord, Howard and Tracy Cummings, Nene Burns-Norberg, Ed Chin, Alison Chaput, Renaissance Entrepreneur Center, Lia Haber, Jen Nurse, Thomas Lee, Kej Suk, Elaine Hwa, Beck Park, Kathy Yu, and of course, my outstanding team, Clarissa Nagy and Coya Elliott;  I could in no way move forward without their support, vision, and encouragement.

story:
Brief summary

We launch the funding "HELP FOR HELPERS" to help cover the daily costs of volunteers.
Numerous tourists coming for holidays become volunteers and help a lot where they can, resident or ex-pat volunteer on site and bring a value manual and logistical help, spending money (e.g. for gas) and energy, some other volunteers pay out of their own pockets for trip, accommodation, food, transport... just to come and to help (mostly a lot). Some of them take special leaves without pay. Others cannot afford a hotel's room and have to camp.
I, Frederic Morlet (https://es.linkedin.com/in/fredmorlet), and my wife Ceyda Goral (https://es.linkedin.com/in/ceydagoralmorlet) volunteer for UNICEF in Spain (delegación Baleares). Watching the catastrophic situation of refugees in Greece, we took the initiative to go to Lesvos last summer and to help refugees on the field during almost 3 months mainly in the refugee transit camp of Kara Tepe on Lesvos, but also in Moria, and in Turkey. We dedicated ourself to interact directly with refugees, improving or organizing the distribution of non-food items, collecting information for NGOs and collaborating effectively with them. 

hoto: Distribution by Ceyda of draw & colour kits for children
We suggested elements to improve the camp and implement solutions (e. g. to avoid that people take advantage of refugees in the camp...), and provided refugees basic hygiene and WASH advices and answered, when possible, all questions based on Dublin III, they may have regarding Europe or life conditions in the different countries.

Photo: Warning refugees against the trafficking currencies in the camp
Since we're back to Spain, we decided to continue our action while helping international volunteers before they come. We federated within 2 weeks more than 700 sympathizers, volunteers, donors, NGOs, activists, and UN-staff... on our Facebook page (Volunteers-coordination Lesvos), and coordinate thus crowd-funding actions, propose improvement solutions for refugees, organize the logistic upstream, search for survival items providers etc...
Volunteers are an indispensable cluster of the humanitarian assistance. Their daily contribution on the field is enormous. They are for example still the only helpers at the arriving of the numerous boats of refugees in the north of Lesvos. That's the reason why we dedicate currently to support them on the island. This initiative is important in terms of assuring their stay and facilitate their work and logistic.
What volunteers do
Their work is very useful in terms of strengthening the coordination between different structures on the island and due to the daily interaction giving a certain confidence to refugees who feel themselves completely unsecure. 
Today this situation led us to create a task consisting of coordination and camp management. We created an official Facebook page (...) where all NGOs and helpers gather for all information requested to help in Lesvos. This initiative facilitated the task of each group of volunteers and also drew the attention of volunteers from all over the world wanting to help us in Lesvos. Each day demand increases. 
We took the opportunity to create a volunteers network to be able to organize their arrivals on the island and place them to appropriate tasks between groups taking action. We established effective relations with local and diverse other organizations (Mayor of Lesvos, IRC, Christian Peacemaker Teams, MDM, Red-Cross Greece and Belgium, Village of all together...) active on the island. We collaborate with them in order to bring our help in the refugee camp of Kara Tepe. Here are some examples of our help to the extent of our means:

Photo: Volunteers prepare and offer warm meals in Kara Tepe for 900 refugees
  1. Crowd-funding to buy draw and color kits for children and distribution in the camp
  2. Buying and distributing in the camp of olive oil soaps
  3. Giving WASH instructions to refugees
  4. Camp cleaning
  5. Storage and sorting out of received items
  6. Identifying of sick children and report them to MDM and MSF
  7. Interpreting work for MDM (Turkish – English)
  8. Shelter allocation
  9. Giving info on their stay in Lesvos, their trip to Athens and on life in general in European countries
  10. Daily interaction with refugees
  11. Chasing the merchants trafficking currencies in the camp and taking advantage of refugees
  12. Summary Report to IOM

Photo: Sorting of donations by volunteers, 2 days hard work in Pikpa camp
What volunteers need

This initiative concerns all volunteers. In order to strengthen our solidarity with them and also bring more contribution to refugees, we suggest a crowd-funding to "help the helpers". The funds collected will be used to cover their basic needs like accommodation, food, or gasoline. 

We suggest the following sharing out:

1) For volunteers on holidays or resident on the island, the providing of the food on the field + gas + car's repair when necessary (some helpers use their private car to transport refugees covering until hundreds of kilometres a day)

Photo: Thom's car broken, after having transported during months numerous refugees from Molyvos to the registering points in Mytilini

  1. Food and gas, or a daily forfeit (8 EUR)

2) For specialized volunteers and volunteers coming on purpose and taking special leave without pay, at least:

  1. Accommodation (in a shared house), or a daily forfeit (5 EUR)
  2. Their food for the whole stay, or a daily forfeit (5 EUR)
  3. The transportation by bus on the island, or a daily forfeit (3 EUR)

Lots of volunteers accept to help in very limited conditions, and sleep in tents because they can’t afford rooms. Some volunteers simply cannot join us by lack of money.

How you can help

3,000 Euro would help us to fit out a big house in Mytilini and host until 12 volunteers for 50 euro/each per month. 

With 6,000 Euro we fit out a big house in Mytilini, can host until 12 volunteers for free, and provide gas and food also for the resident volunteers during 1 month. 

With 9,000 Euro we fit out a big house in Mytilini, can host until 12 volunteers for free, provide gas and food also for the resident volunteers during 2 months, and have Thom's car repaired. 

Thank you very much to everyone who has donated and/or taken notice to an important struggle.


help@volunteers-coordination-lesvos.org 

You can also help while sharing this page.

Their
food for the whole stay, or a daily forfeit (5 EUR)


The
transportation by bus on the island, or a daily forfeit (3 EUR)







Lots of volunteers accept to help in very limited conditions, and sleep in tents because they can’t afford rooms. Some volunteers simply cannot join us by lack of money.




How you can help
3,000 Euro would help us to fit out a big house in Mytilini and host until 12 volunteers for 50 euro/each per month. 
With 6,000 Euro we fit out a big house in Mytilini, can host until 12 volunteers for free, and provide gas and food also for the resident volunteers during 1 month. 
With 9,000 Euro we fit out a big house in Mytilini, can host until 12 volunteers for free, provide gas and food also for the resident volunteers during 2 months, and have Thom's car repaired. 
Thank you very much to everyone who has donated and/or taken notice to an important struggle.
help@volunteers-coordination-lesvos.org 
You can also help while sharing this page.

story:
Hi, I’m romance author AJ Harmon and I’d like you to help me help survivors of domestic violence.

I’ve written two books that have changed my life. I’ve written 15 total, and I love them all, but two have really had an impact on my life: First Class to New York, my very first book, and A Choice for Claire, the novel I published in February, 2015.

A Choice for Claire has touched my life and the lives of thousands of readers and it has awoken me to the sad reality that thousands of women and children who are survivors of domestic violence need help finding safety and starting over.

I want to help them, like Rebekah helps Claire in my book. But the need is too big for one person or even a dozen people to handle alone. So I'm asking you to join us.

Ways to Help:


So what can you do?

1.  Give your voice to the cause. Share this campaign on your social media and help raise awareness of the desperate needs women and children have when trying to escape a violent situation.

2.  Give them a choice. By supporting a shelter like Bradley Angle, you give them somewhere to go to escape their abuser.

3.  Give them a chance. Programs like Bradley Angle give tools, resources and a fresh start to survivors of domestic violence.

You can do all of the above right here in this campaign.
Choose your level of support and start sharing this on your social media.

Why I Wrote "A Choice for Claire":



It's not enough to talk about helping or "not talking about" domestic violence.
We need to join together and take action to help others escape the cruel actions of abusers. Your small effort now could help save someone tomorrow.

Your Rewards for Helping:

Any Size Contribution: Personalized Thank you on my Social Media Network

 $5 Level - Collectible "a Choice for Claire" Wrist Band


$10 Level - Digital Download of "a Choice for Claire" for Kindle, Nook or iTunes


New $20 Level Butterfly Pendant and Earrings 


$25 Level - A signed paperback of "a Choice for Claire"
personalized with signed bookmark


$50 Level - A signed paperback of "a Choice for Claire"
personalized with signed bookmark and tote bag


$75 Level - Audiobook of "a Choice for Claire" with a signed paperback


$150 Level - Audiobook of "a Choice for Claire" with a personalized signed paperback, autographed bookmark, wrist band and tote bag



My Grand Experiment:

Now that I've witnessed the care and support offered to survivors received at shelters like Bradley Angle, I just have to do more.

I’m trying to use what little influence I have as an author and the story in my book to recruit more voices and resources to the cause. When I prove that an author can raise funds for this cause using the Indiegogo platform, I can go to my author friends and together we can launch a larger national campaign with regional shelters as benefactors.

This is only the beginning. Your support will give me proof of concept, allowing me to recruit more authors and corporate donors  to launch phase two. Thank you for being part of this grass roots effort.

40 Years of Safety - Bradley Angle:




Help Raise Awareness:




Creating Happily-Ever-Afters One Person at a Time:



All Funds, minus the cost of fulfillment, distribution and administration of rewards, will be donated to Bradley Angle to help domestic violence survivors escape their abusers and get the fresh start they deserve.
