story:
is a humanitarian aid worker with 6 years of experience in logistics, finance & human resources. She has been the country director of a Swiss Non-Governmental Organization in Haiti for the last 2 years.

As a Water, Sanitation and Hygiene specialist humanitarian worker,Laure has spent the past 5 years of her life working with Non-Governmental Organizations providing clean water, sanitation and hygiene ?to people in need.

is a communications consultant with 4 years of experience working in graphic design, web marketing & video montage for companies such as Dior, Guerlain, Alstom, and Coca Cola.



This project has been in Laure's mind for several years now. Her passion for water, hygiene and sanitation combined with her dream to start her own organization took root in 2014 when she met Melanie. They spent one year working in the same city in Haiti and from there, developed the desire to work together. Through their friendship, they quickly realized they shared many humanitarian aid values and wanted to make an impact on Haiti's growth using the same approaches. One of these approaches was to continue providing access to hygiene and drinkable water to the poorest, as they both knew these basic needs could save thousands of lives.

Julie and Laure have been friends ever since college and have always stayed in touch, supporting each other's hopes and aspirations.  

In June 2015, Julie, Melanie, and Laure met in Haiti for the first time and the three of them discussed further the idea of starting a soap recycling initiative. 

To turn this dream into reality, Laure left Haiti in July 2015 and spent several months in South East Asia, researching soap manufacturing methods. While in Bali and in Cambodia, she met with successful soap recycling organizations who helped her understand their activities and made it clear to her: it could also work in Haiti. 

In January 2016, she came back to Haiti, ready to start this new adventure with Melanie and Julie.... and ANACAONA was born!


      

Haiti is located in the Greater Antilles archipelago of the Caribbean, on the island of Hispaniola, shared with the Dominican Republic.

 The 3 black stars you see on the picture below is where we work currently: Jacmel, Port-au-Prince and Cotes des Arcadins. In the coming months, we are hoping to expand to Cap-Haitian and Les Cayes Region. 

  

               

                             

                                                      



                Since every penny matters, here is how YOUR donation will be spent: 

         Check-out the UNIQUE and EXCITING gifts you will receive by helping us! 

                                


                                        

                           


                                       

                             


       


Congratulations! You have made it this far! 

As you are now among our biggest supporters, it's imperative that we be 100% transparent with you...

If we do not raise 50,000 USD by May 16th, we will not be able to sustain our activities for the next 12 months. 

ANACAONA is interested in providing a long term solution for the Haitian people and it would make no sense for us to stop just as we are getting started! 

Imagine us telling our schools partners: "Sorry, we have helped you for 6 months, but for the rest of the school year, the children will have no soap..." 

Imagine us telling our women employees: "Sorry ladies, we have been able to provide a salary for you and your family for the past few months but now we have no money left to continue..." 

You may then ask yourself, "What happens to my money if the girls are not able to raise 50,000 dollars?" if this is the case, you will have allowed the country a head start in health and hygiene, for your donation will have been put to use for the costs incurred during the first months of the project: workshop expenses, soap ingredients, soap donation, and logistics. 

And oh, for what it's worth , our salaries (Melanie, Laure and Julie) are not included in the 50,000 USD.

Last but not least: life in Haiti is challenging. After several years spent living in the country, we are well aware of the daily difficulties and we have already overcome many of them to say the least ! Even though Haiti is often in the press for its turmoil, we believe it is now the time to give the country a sustainable chance. 


            


  • Donate to our cause campaign today! Every dollar counts ! 


  • Talk about our campaign with your friends and family 
  • Visit our website: www.anacaona.org
  • Make noise on the social media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc... 

  • Have you ever thought of linking your business to a Corporate Social Responsibility Program ? Now is the time to do it! If our values meet yours, we would love to hear from you. To become a partner, drop us a line at contact@anacaona.org

  • Like our Facebook page and write something nice on it / send us a mail
  • If you are in Haiti, or plan to come, encourage us by stopping by our workshop and see us at work! 

                                              

                              Thank you so much for supporting our campaign! 

  / VERSION FRANCAISE: 

                                               L'EQUIPE ANACAONA

Mélanie GEISER (Chargée des Opérations) : a travaillé dans le milieu humanitaire pendant 6 années dans les domaines de la logistique, des finances et des ressources humaines. Elle a été Directrice Pays d'une ONG Suisse ces deux dernières années en Haïti . 
Laure BOTTINELLI (Fondatrice): En tant que spécialiste Eau, Assainissement et Hygiène dans le milieu humanitaire, Laure a passé ces 5 dernières années au sein de différentes ONG afin de faciliter l'accès a l'eau, l'hygiène et l'assainissement pour les plus démunis. 
Julie ALA (Chargée Communication): Consultante en communication depuis 4 années, Julie travaille dans le domaine du graphic design, web marketing et montage vidéo pour des entreprises telles que Dior, Guerlin, Alstom et Coca-Cola. 
-----
                                        COMMENT TOUT A COMMENCE

Depuis plusieurs années, ce projet trottait dans la tête de Laure. Sa passion pour la thématique de l'Eau, l'Assainissement et l'Hygiène associée à son rêve de démarrer sa propre organisation a pris racine en 2014 quand elle a rencontré Mélanie. Pendant une année, elles ont vécu dans la même ville en Haïti et de là est née l'envie de travailler ensemble. Au travers de cette amitié, elles ont rapidement réalisé qu'elles partageaient de nombreuses valeurs humanitaires et souhaitaient avoir un impact sur la croissance d'Haïti en utilisant les mêmes approches. L'une d'entre elles consistait à pérenniser l'accès aux services d'eau potable et d'hygiene pour les plus vulnérables car elles savaient que répondre à ces besoins de base pourrait sauver des milliers de vie. 

Julie et Laure sont amies depuis leurs années universitaires. Elles sont restées proches et se sont soutenues mutuellement dans leurs projets et leurs  aspirations. 

En Juin 2015, Julie, Mélanie et Laure se sont rencontrées en Haïti pour la première fois et ont discuté plus en profondeur de leur envie de commencer une initiative de recyclage de savon. 

Pour que ce rêve devienne une réalité, Laure a quitté Haïti en Juillet 2015 et a passé plusieurs mois en Asie du Sud Est avec l'idée de récolter davantage d'informations sur les méthodes de fabrication de recyclage de savon. A Bali et au Cambodge, elle est allée à la rencontre d'organisations de recyclage de savon prospères qui l'ont aidée à comprendre leurs activités et modes de fonctionnement. C'est à partir de ce moment qu'elle était convaincu: ceci pouvait aussi fonctionner en Haïti. 

En Janvier 2016, elle est retournée en Haïti, prête à commencer cette nouvelle aventure avec Julie et Mélanie.... et ANACAONA est né ! 

                                           

                                                 NOS LIEUX DE TRAVAIL

ANACAONA travaille en Haïti sur 3 zones géographiques: Jacmel, Port-au-Prince et la Côte-des-Arcadins. Dans les prochains mois, nous souhaitons nous étendre à la zone des Cayes et au Cap-Haitien. 

                                                   OU VA VOTRE ARGENT? 
Avec 50,000 USD: 

- 2,500 USD: 100 kits d'hygiène pour des écoles primaires 
-5,000 USD: 100 formations d'hygiene pour des professeurs d'écoles primaires
-6,000 USD: 60 filtres à eau pour des écoles et des hôpitaux
-20,500 USD: 12 mois de salaire pour 7 employées 
-6,000 USD: Collecte et distribution mensuelle de savon 
-10,000 USD: Une année entière de savon pour au moins 5000 écoliers

                                                       RISQUES ET DEFIS

Felicitations d'être arrivé jusqu'ici ! 

Comme vous êtes maintenant l'un de nos plus grands supporters, il est impératif que nous soyons 100% transparentes avec vous...

Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif de 50 000 USD au 16 mai, nous ne serons pas en mesure de maintenir nos activités pour les 12 prochains mois. 

Pour ANACANONA, il est important de proposer une solution sur le long terme pour le peuple haïtien et il ne fait aucun sens pour nous de nous arrêter alors que nous commençons à peine. 

Imaginez-nous dire à nos écoles partenaires: "Désolée, nous vous avons aidé pendant 6 mois, mais pour le reste de l'année scolaire, les écoliers n'auront pas de savon..." 

Imaginez-nous dire à nos employées: "Désolée mesdames, nous avons été en mesure de vous payer un salaire pour vous et votre famille depuis quelques mois, mais maintenant, nous n'avons pas assez d'argent pour continuer à vous employer..."

Vous vous demandez alors surement: "Que devient mon argent si ANACAONA n'atteint pas les 50 000 USD?" Si tel était le cas, votre aide aura permis au pays d'avoir une aide supplémentaire au niveau de l'accès à l'eau et l'hygiène, dans la mesure où votre contribution aura été mise à profit pour couvrir les frais des premiers mois du projet: les frais d'atelier, les ingredients pour le savon, les distributions de savon et la logistique. 

On aimerait aussi vous dire que nos salaires (Laure, Melanie et Julie) ne sont pas inclus dans les 50,000 USD. 

Dernier point, mais non le moindre: la vie en Haïti est un défi quotidien. Après plusieurs années passées à vivre dans ce pays, nous sommes bien conscientes des difficultés et le moins qu'on puisse dire c'est que nous en avons déja surmonté beaucoup! 

                                       NOUS AVONS BESOIN DE VOUS MAINTENANT! 

Soyez généreux!
  • Faites un don aujourd'hui pour notre campagne. Chaque dollar compte! 
Faites du bruit! 
  • Parlez de notre campagne avec vos amis et votre famille
  • Visitez notre site web: www.anacaona.org
  • Faites du bruit sur les réseaux sociaux: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc..
Commencez un partenariat entre votre entreprise et ANACAONA
  • Avez-vous deja pensé à developper un Programme de Responsabilité Sociale au sein de votre entreprise? Voici l'occasion de le faire! Si vous partagez nos valeurs, nous serions ravies de rentrer en contact avec vous. Pour devenir partenaire, écrivez-nous à contact@anacaona.org 
Encouragez-nous! 
  • Aimez notre page Facebook et laissez un gentil commentaire/ écrivez-nous un email 
  • Si vous êtes en Haïti, ou planifiez de venir, passez-nous dire bonjour à notre atelier et voyez-nous à l'oeuvre! 

                                            

                                      Un grand merci pour votre soutien !

  Donate to our cause campaign today! Every dollar counts ! 






Talk about our campaign with your friends and family 
Visit our website: www.anacaona.org

Make noise on the social media: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc...

                                                                            Thank you so much for supporting our campaign!

Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif de 50 000 USD au 16 mai, nous ne serons pas en mesure de maintenir nos activités pour les 12 prochains mois. 

Pour ANACANONA, il est important de proposer une solution sur le long terme pour le peuple haïtien et il ne fait aucun sens pour nous de nous arrêter alors que nous commençons à peine. 

Imaginez-nous dire à nos écoles partenaires: "Désolée, nous vous avons aidé pendant 6 mois, mais pour le reste de l'année scolaire, les écoliers n'auront pas de savon..." 

Imaginez-nous dire à nos employées: "Désolée mesdames, nous avons été en mesure de vous payer un salaire pour vous et votre famille depuis quelques mois, mais maintenant, nous n'avons pas assez d'argent pour continuer à vous employer..."

Vous vous demandez alors surement: "Que devient mon argent si ANACAONA n'atteint pas les 50 000 USD?" Si tel était le cas, votre aide aura permis au pays d'avoir une aide supplémentaire au niveau de l'accès à l'eau et l'hygiène, dans la mesure où votre contribution aura été mise à profit pour couvrir les frais des premiers mois du projet: les frais d'atelier, les ingredients pour le savon, les distributions de savon et la logistique. 

On aimerait aussi vous dire que nos salaires (Laure, Melanie et Julie) ne sont pas inclus dans les 50,000 USD. 

Dernier point, mais non le moindre: la vie en Haïti est un défi quotidien. Après plusieurs années passées à vivre dans ce pays, nous sommes bien conscientes des difficultés et le moins qu'on puisse dire c'est que nous en avons déja surmonté beaucoup! 

                                       NOUS AVONS BESOIN DE VOUS MAINTENANT! 


Soyez généreux!

Faites un don aujourd'hui pour notre campagne. Chaque dollar compte! 

Faites du bruit! 



Parlez de notre campagne avec vos amis et votre famille
Visitez notre site web: www.anacaona.org

Faites du bruit sur les réseaux sociaux: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc..

Commencez un partenariat entre votre entreprise et ANACAONA
Avez-vous deja pensé à developper un Programme de Responsabilité Sociale au sein de votre entreprise? Voici l'occasion de le faire! Si vous partagez nos valeurs, nous serions ravies de rentrer en contact avec vous. Pour devenir partenaire, écrivez-nous à contact@anacaona.org 
Encouragez-nous! 

Aimez notre page Facebook et laissez un gentil commentaire/ écrivez-nous un email 
Si vous êtes en Haïti, ou planifiez de venir, passez-nous dire bonjour à notre atelier et voyez-nous à l'oeuvre! 


                                            



                                      Un grand merci pour votre soutien !

story:
Short Summary

Hello. I am the Tardigrade Supreme, leader of the Tardigrade Army. We tardigrades believe in helping out those less fortunate than ourselves (our illustrious selves). We hope to dominate the world one day, so it's important to help it out today. Even if that means helping humans instead of tardigrades. If you share this opinion and love tardigrades, please consider buying a Hail Tardigrada shirt. All profits go to Save the Children, a charity that provides relief and support to children in 120 countries, including the USA.

The shirt: 

What You Get

100% of the profit made from this campaign will go to Save the Children. Because Indiegogo tracks the total funds raised, the amount donated will be lower than the amount shown on the campaign page. I don't yet know what percentage of the funds will go to the charity because the cost of printing the shirts depends on how many are bought.

The shirt is Bella+Canvas's unisex 3001 style in heather slate. It is 52% cotton and 48% poly. For more information and a sizing chart, please visit this website: http://www.bellacanvas.com/product/3001/3001-cv-ss-tee.html

For $25 + shipping*, you will receive a Hail Tardigrada shirt as well as the invaluable thanks of the Tardigrade Supreme. You will be updated via email when the campaign ends, when your shirt ships, and when the donation amount is finalized, so make sure the email associated with your account is the one you check.

Important: The shirt is available in adult sizes XS-4XL. Each size is a separate perk. Make sure to select the correct one.

You also have the option of donating to the campaign without receiving a shirt. 100% of your donation will go to Save the Children. This is also greatly appreciated and you will receive the invaluable thanks of the Tardigrade Supreme.

*Shipping:

The shirt ships internationally. Shipping is $5 if you live in the United States and it varies for by country for the rest of the world. Your shirt will ship by May 31, 2016.

The shirt design up close: 

 

About Save the Children

Save the Children was established in 1919 and they have focused on the health, safety, and education of children worldwide ever since. In 2014 they responded to over 103 humanitarian conflicts and reached over 4 million children affected by conflicts, disease, and natural disasters. Through their Literacy Boost program, they have supported basic reading skills for tens of thousands of children in countries such as Malawi and Pakistan. They also work with UNICEF to coordinate education for children during emergencies. 

Save the Children has trained nearly 500,000 health workers since 2010 and implemented a community-based Saving Newborn Lives program in 18 countries. They supported the treatment of 5.8 million cases of diarrhea, pneumonia, malaria, and malnutrition in children under the age of five in 2014 alone.

Charity Navigator gives Save the Children a rating of 4/4 stars. 89.6% of Save the Children's total expenses are spent on its programs and services (as opposed to overhead costs).

For more information, please visit savethechildren.org

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page! Whether by Twitter or Facebook or email or word-of-mouth, anything you can do to get the word out about this campaign helps. 

Follow @mrwaterbear on Twitter and retweet my tweets about this fundraiser.

story:
The first time I submitted a story for publication, I waited for months before receiving a polite form letter rejecting my story. With no idea why it wasn’t chosen, I submitted it to a different publisher with the same results. After several attempts, I made a few minor modifications and submitted again. This time it was selected for publication, but I never knew if it was because of my changes or if the editor would have liked the original just as well.

Years later, I was working at a prominent literary magazine and saw first hand how their selection process worked. They would go through hundreds of manuscripts in a day and reject many of them on first glance. They didn’t spend the time to really examine a story. Then Interns stuffed a copy of the form letter into the envelope and send it to the writer. Only occasionally would the editor take the time to write a personal note to a rejected author. One such author waited almost a year and received a message saying, “Close. Please submit again.” The problem is, they just didn’t have the staff or the time to do it differently.

Call us crazy, but the staff here at Mad Cats Press wants to start a traditional publishing company, but run it in a very non-traditional way.

These situations are not unusual in the publishing industry, but we’d like to change that.

Call us crazy, but the staff here at Mad Cats Press wants to start a traditional publishing company, but run it in a very non-traditional way. Starting with the selection process. We plan to evaluate each manuscript carefully so that we can provide feedback to the authors. This way the author will have an idea why we didn’t choose their work, and more importantly, what they can do that might improve their story and get it published.

We’re not expecting every manuscript to be perfect. We know that isn’t possible. Everyone on our staff is an experienced writer and editor and we know how much work goes into writing. What we want to do is to help authors produce the best manuscript possible and realize their dream.

That brings us to the next way we plan to be a little different. We also plan to offer editing and design services to writers that might want a little help. With the popularity of self-publishing continually rising, the amount of virtually unreadable books rise with it. It’s not because the stories are bad, it’s because they haven’t been professionally edited. After writing and revising a manuscript, it is very hard for an author to catch their own errors. Stories sometimes contain subtle problems with the storyline or important details go missing. Simple mistakes in grammar and spelling are common. Too many of these mistakes become distracting and cause many readers to stop reading a book altogether. That’s why books need to be professionally edited before publication.

This is where Mad Cats Press can help. Our content editors can carefully inspect a manuscript for problems and suggest minor changes that could significantly improve the work. After revisions are made, our copy editors can go through and check punctuation, grammar, spelling, and detail accuracy to polish the manuscript prior to making it into a book. Our artists and designers can even create book covers or do internal book design if that’s what an author wants. Even if all that is needed is a simple proofread, we plan to make any of our services available to those who desire them.

We feel everyone deserves a chance to have their stories and dreams heard. We’re listening.

Our goal is to help. So, if there is a service you think we’re overlooking or a service you’d like to see us provide, tell us in the forum on our website. We don’t want to be a faceless publisher that just produces books. We want to be a part of all aspects of the process and help the writing community as a whole.

To do all of this, we’re going to need your help. Starting a small press from the ground up is expensive. There are legal costs, fees, licenses, equipment, software, and numerous other expenses we need to cover before we can get started. Not to mention production costs for the first round of books. Because of this, we’ve started a crowd funding campaign with three goals in mind. If we can raise $10,000 we’ll have enough money to get started. This will allow us to cover initial expenses and start the editing and manuscript selection process. At this level, the first year will be a real struggle, but we can make it with enough hard work and clients.   Our next major goal is raising $20,000. At this level we can get everything we need to produce audio books as well as the print books and ebooks. Our ultimate goal is to raise $50,000. This would be enough to get everything we need, but would also cover printing, marketing, and production costs for our first year of operation. We need to produce at least six books in our first year, but the more money we raise, the more books we can produce.

We hope you’ll consider donating to help us get the press started. Our rewards list consists of some Mad Cats Press branded swag, book preorders, invitations to our first book release party, and discounted editing services. If you are able to donate $300 or more and are not interested in the editing services, please let us know when we contact you and we will be happy to issue you books instead.

We know that some of you would like to help, but can’t afford to help us financially. If this is the case, there is still an important roll you can play. Spread the word. Tell your friends and colleagues. Share this on your social media feeds. Use the Indiegogo share tools. The only way we’ll succeed is with your help.

In the end, remember that we feel everyone deserves a chance to have their stories and dreams heard. We’re listening.

story:
The craft beer industry is exploding as consumers demand more variety and complexity in their brews. However, beer drinkers on a budget have been left behind…. until now. MadHops® Flavored Brew Drops deliver a satisfying craft beer experience at a fraction of the price.

Squirt a few drops of MadHops into a 12 ounce glass and transform your boring beer!

Each bottle of MadHops will flavor up to 18 12-ounce beers and fits in your pocket or purse.

Two years in product development, MadHops uses craft beer ingredients like hop oils, bittering and malt to elevate the base beer flavor and then mixes in some popular flavorings to upgrade the color, aroma and taste. The results are surprising.

"Yep, you’ve turned Coors Banquet into a pale ale. Pat yourselves on the back. It adds hop bitterness, but also a malty balance as well... Talk about a great way to survive your neighbor’s kegger!" Focus on the Beer

“Mad Hops does make [a budget beer] look, smell and taste better... “ Bill Cord, mybeerbuzz.com

Where it all began

In the spring of 2014, MadHops Founder Peter Hanley planted a hopyard in the Finger Lakes region of New York state, a center of fine wine and beer-making. His plan was to sell his harvest to one of the many local craft brewers.

Peter had a lot of help from his family, and when his kids and his nieces and nephews came over the talk often turned to beer - what new varieties of craft beer they had discovered, what new breweries in the area were popular, the challenges of buying good beer on a budget.

One day while working in the hopyard, Peter had a wonderful idea. Why not infuse flavors into a hops-based tea, then then condense it down into highly-concentrated drops? You could create a product like MiO, but for beer, that would make drinking an everyday beer a lot more interesting.

After a lot of experimentation and many cans of PBR, we developed 6 great flavors:

The next step was to contract with leading beverage flavor houses to develop our secret recipes into a product that could be consistently produced in larger quantities. We went back and forth a bunch of times until we were satisfied that we had something truly delicious. Then we found a great bottling and packaging company who will take the brew drops to a finished product. 

Now all we need is YOU 

Everything is set, the contracts are signed, and we are ready to place our initial production order. But we need your help. Pre-order product in this Kickstarter campaign and let the Mad Rumpus begin!

We are planning a nice long run to meet demand, because we believe that consumers and home brewers are ready for a tastier brew.

Check out our rewards on the right. Each one includes bottles of MadHops, some with fun add-ons like high-quality branded shirts and caps. 

Live the story, make money 

We wish we could sit down and have a beer with all of you! But for now, this is the next best thing. Join our Affiliate Program by purchasing our Hopster perk and we will send you everything you need to bring MadHops to your town as our representative.


 Here's what you get:

  • Two variety 6-packs of MadHops
  • 500 coupon cards with your unique code

Here’s what you do:

  • Share MadHops with your friends, your softball team, your roommates, at keg parties and tailgates, anywhere people are drinking beer. 
  • Pass out your card to anyone interested in buying some MadHops. When they visit gomadhops.com and enter your unique code, they get a special discount.
  • Collect cash - you earn up to $1 for every bottle sold with your code.

We can’t wait for you to try MadHops. There’s nothing like it on the market. Tasting is believing!

Cheers!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Lizeth and I am a 23 year old ambitious lady living in Milwaukee. I love small businesses. I was 18 when I created my first LLC to offer consulting services to my community. At that time, I was unable to work because of my undocumented status. I was born in Mexico but I have lived in Milwaukee for 20 years! This is my home. I started getting involved with a local organization that introduced me to a national immigrant's rights movement. They were able to hire my business for consulting services. This is where my dream began.

The purpose of this page is to create awareness of Good Deal services. I want young entrepreneurs to know they have someone they can talk to or ask questions. I have a space available for meetings in West Allis and would love artists and designers to stop by and "hang out".


What We Need & What You Get

My funding goal is $1000.00. It will be used to create a space where entrepreneurs and artists can meet with potential clients. I will not take any profits from funds raised on this page. I will use it solely for creating space.

If you contribute and are seeking help with your own small business, I can offer my services and expertise to you. I appreciate any donation so contact me with your questions and I will respond. 

The Impact

Your contribution will allow me to reach more entrepreneurs! I want to be available to anyone with questions or concerns. I also want this to be a space where entrepreneurs can meet to discuss their ideas.

Risks & Challenges

I promise to be an open book. If you have any questions about my campaign or focus, email me (Lizeth@gooddealbookkeeping.com). 

Other Ways You Can Help

My biggest challenge I believe will be to find clients. I am not much of a marketing expert so thatis I why I am here. Even if you can't contribute financially, just sharing this page will get me one step closer to creating my space.

story:
Salvadoran on wheels

Our name is Francella López and Carmen Castellanos, we're from El Salvador, the smallest county in Central America and we wanted to have our own business to help our future and our family.
We not only work for us, we work for a lot of artisans in our country, after all FashionTruck is a service business. We work as a display store for artisans and handmade crafters to show their products on our truck and of course our social media channels.

With this project we'll be capable to offer a better place to sell.

We began with this project almost a year ago. We didn't have the money to open a traditional store, so the idea got stuck for a while. After some time trying to figure out what we must do, Francella inherited her grandfather's Volkswagen Kombi, a relic. This is how we started.

After a year learning the hard way how to manage the business, struggling between full time jobs, university and the truck, and barely surviving a robbery 2 months after the launching, we're ready to see the business the way we see it in our dreams. 

With this project we learned that effort pays off and not only money but personal satisfaction of doing what we love and demonstrating others like us with financial need that anyone is capable of making their dreams come true. We attend talks to students and fellows about entrepreneurialism and when we see their faces full of hope, we understand the power of empowering people to build a new El Salvador.


What We Need 

The FashionTruck still holds a lot of mechanical problems and we got stuck a lot with a bad engine in the middle of nowhere after an pop up event or sell, basically the money we gathered trough out the day is gone after the tow. So our plans for the money are the following:

  • Get the engine ready $700
  • Pimp the Truck $3,300
  • Pimp the Truck means: change the rotten can, wheels, change the glass packaging (it sucks when it's raining), lining and remodelling the inside so it actually looks like a store
    .

The Impact


We not only work for us, we work for a lot of artisans in our country, after all FashionTruck is a service business. We work as a display store for artisans and handmade crafters to show their products on our truck and of course our social media channels.

With this project we'll be capable to offer a better place to sell.

We not only work for us, we work for a lot of artisans in our country, after all FashionTruck is a service business. We work as a display store for artisans and handmade crafters to show their products on our truck and of course our social media channels.

With this project we'll be capable to offer a better place to sell.


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest obstacle is that the engine need something else that's not not the budget but we're sure we could overcome it with time.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about our business and the two crazy girls in El Salvador that are trying to make a change for a change. You could also share this project and like our pages in Facebook and Instagram.

We're working on a coming soon webpage www.fashiontruck.sv please do click to see our progress.

THANK YOU!!!!!
If you've made it this far. It means a lot to us we're not alone in this!
story_txt:
Salvadoran on wheels
Our name is Francella López and Carmen Castellanos, we're from El Salvador, the smallest county in Central America and we wanted to have our own business to help our future and our family.
We not only work for us, we work for a lot of artisans in our country, after all FashionTruck is a service business. We work as a display store for artisans and handmade crafters to show their products on our truck and of course our social media channels.With this project we'll be capable to offer a better place to sell.
We began with this project almost a year ago. We didn't have the money to open a traditional store, so the idea got stuck for a while. After some time trying to figure out what we must do, Francella inherited her grandfather's Volkswagen Kombi, a relic. This is how we started.
After a year learning the hard way how to manage the business, struggling between full time jobs, university and the truck, and barely surviving a robbery 2 months after the launching, we're ready to see the business the way we see it in our dreams. 
With this project we learned that effort pays off and not only money but personal satisfaction of doing what we love and demonstrating others like us with financial need that anyone is capable of making their dreams come true. We attend talks to students and fellows about entrepreneurialism and when we see their faces full of hope, we understand the power of empowering people to build a new El Salvador.

Get the engine ready $700
Pimp the Truck $3,300

story:
HELLO! Welcome to Tori Ramen's humble beginning. We are very excited to bring you a whole new bird to the art form of Japanese ramen. Wait...what does that mean you ask? Well, ramen by "tradition" consists of a broth made from pork bones cooked over long periods of time as you may already know. For you ramen geeks, this means it will produce rich and velvety tonkotsu, a balanced shoyu, or a very flavorful miso soup. 

4/19 UPDATE#1: Our funding is nearly complete. Though we didn't get our funding goal, we are still going to open the restaurant. Our lease is signed and were ready and motivated to bring you the best ramen shop ever. Please stay informed with our Facebook page for more info. 

Thanks!

WHAT WE DO: Our spin on ramen will bring you a soup that can achieve the same results with chicken and other birds, hence Tori (bird in Japanese)...made from the best ingredients available. Think Kadjen and Wild Acres Farms. At Tori, we also want to bring you food that we value and care about. This means you will not see corn syrup, artificial flavors or colors, GMO's, or MSG. We also love the challenge of creating a vegetarian made broth, so 'veggies' have no fear, we are looking out for you too!

OUR BACKGROUND: Asiya and I got our start at United Noodles during the Minneapolis Ramen Revolution and brought you Ramen Mondays at United Noodles. We took over the Unideli and produced Minnesota's first hits such as "Tantanmen", "Tonkotsu Black", Tsukemen, and the ever popular "DRAMEN". We believe 2016 is our year to make a mark on the city for what we hope to be many years in the making. 


THE NAME: (significance)

Tori Ramen is not just unique in name and practice. Tori, short for Victoria is a name we settled on when we found out we were have a baby girl due in late July.This is all great news to us and we hope you will be excited to have our family in the Twin Cities serving you the best ramen you may ever have!

WANTS VS. NEEDS: (bare essentials)

Tori Ramen, like any other restaurant or business needs funding. We are going to invest every dollar we have accumulated over the past few years to bring you our dream, but we will need your help in getting there. We don't want a hand out though, so we intend to give back what you give us in the form of fantastic food, and superior service to boot. To keep our costs low, Asiya and I are going to do the build out in house with our own bare hands. We are going to look for the best possible prices on equipment and economical materials. This will keep our project at a minimum of 22-30k. We have a great building picked out with a super nice landlord in the purrrfect area. 

THE IMPACT: (rooted in the community)

We value honest food, great experiences, and helping others. This is not an understatement in any sense. Our morals are in line with the way food began, and the way it should be to this day, cruelty free and non modified. To pair with this, we believe in celebration with food and drink, and giving back what we receive to the community and others that are on the same path as us. A portion of our proceeds will go back to enrich the neighborhood and help young entrepreneurs in food and arts. 

RISKS & CHALLENGES: (determination)

We have learned so much in the past year, that it has given us great insight into the how and what we need to make this a success. It has literally taken us to rock bottom and back up again. We've endured so many challenges in the planning and execution of this business model, from the search of partnerships and investors, to raising capitol, and finally deciding that the best coarse of action is through our own means, with our own ideas at the forefront. 

Though funding is the most important part in any restaurant, we also know that there a lot more contributing factors involved such as acquiring all necessary licenses and permits (registration, building permits, food inspection, liquor license, plumbing) the restaurants build out/remodel, equipment sourcing, vendor sourcing, and hiring staff. 

All of this is undoubtably a huge task to take on - all before the doors even open. Once open, we face more obstacles in becoming an established restaurant, and sustaining a foothold in St Paul. Our business will be live in August of this year to give us the time we need to open and lay the roots. 

Thankfully, having the experience working in restaurants has enabled us to recognize each arising set back that may occur. We have been part of restaurant openings, build outs, and have attained knowledge that will be key in opening our own restaurant. We have learned that one of the biggest issues in opening a restaurant is patience. Having the patience to not rush the opening, waiting for the state departments to approve licensing, setting up social media, building the restaurants floor plan, and making sure everything is in place before opening so as to have a strong start. We know we can make the Twin Cities proud!

WE NEED YOU! (thank you)

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help...

If you believe in what we are trying to do please share this on your social media. If that isn't your thing, simply tell a friend about us. The more exposure we get the better! 

Thank you very much!

Jason & Asiya

If you believe in what we are trying to do please share this on your social media. If that isn't your thing, simply tell a friend about us. The more exposure we get the better! 
Thank you very much!

story:
Fund numi, and fuel a nu world with a better, cleaner environment. 

nümi Scooters is a passionate, privately-held start up dedicated to eco-friendly, next-generation transportation with fun, quiet, stylish, zero-emission, low-maintenance electric bikes and electric scooters—perfect for college campuses and city neighborhoods. 

Our electric scooters and ebikes are 100% electric (or combination of pedal power and electric assist as in the case of the mountain bikes). nümi Scooters means the highest quality—for great performance and low-maintenance, resulting in the highest customer satisfaction. 

We are the only company in the U.S. providing high school seniors or college students with the option to have their electric scooters and ebikes delivered directly to their school for on-campus pick up during student move-in. (An option for home delivery to residences is also available.)

nümi Scooters is also passionate about the environment, and is pleased to support the Rainforest Foundation in its mission with a donation of 2% of every sale.

Please help fund numi, and help us cover more ground, while leaving nothing behind.

In fact, you might like to jump on the electric revolution with an electric scooter of your own. We promise they're crazy-fun and easy to operate. Check out our products at www.numiscooters.com, or call Ron, the founder, at 888-591-NUMI (6864).

numi electric scooters are great for urban roads, campus quads, rural properties, equestrian events, and anywhere you want to go off-road and on-road. Where would you like to numi?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NJoGxhvMQeI

My story: I'm Ron Glogovsky, Jr. founder of numi, and father of five children. For several years, I've only driven electric vehicles, driven by my passion and concern of clean air and clean water for all. I'm environmentally-driven, and have been entrepreneurial my whole life. With these traits, and a huge motivation to leave this place better than how I found it, I'm putting everything I have behind numi scooters. Electric transportation is next-generation transportation, and it's here and growing. And because I'm very much aligned with the Rainforest Foundation, I've committed to donating 2% of every sale to the Rainforest Foundation.

While the company model is built around selling directly to customers, much as Tesla has done, our funding campaign will help enable the opening of showroom locations that will allow buyers to touch and test ride these products. This capability is critical to the success of the business. I am hoping you can help.

Ron founded and successfully operates the only electric car limo service which shuttles customers to Chicago O'Hare and Midway airports using only solar powered Tesla Model S cars.  In 2015  the car service prevented the following from entering the atmosphere:

  • 121,712 Pounds of CO2
  • 6,212 Gallons of Gas
  • 3,100 Pounds of CO
  • 229 Pounds of NOx (nitrogen oxides et al)
  • 341 Pounds of VOCs

Ron has created a team that includes  the owner of a micro Brewery which is solar powered among others who are dedicated to the sustainability of our resources.  

Use of Funds

Numi is seeking $150,000 in this campaign and will use the proceeds to continue to spread the word about fun, eco-friendly personal transportation and to make it available to people around the US and, hopefully, take a few cars off the road. Funds will go towards opening 5 retail showroom locations and will fund:

  • Education and outreach programs regarding sustainable, eco friendly personal transportation alternatives
  • Obtaining leases and making space ready for showroom operations
  • The hiring and training of staff
  • Purchase of inventory

Risks and Challenges

The risks facing the business are not unlike those facing any business. Do we have the right location, the right product? Are we selling it to the right market? Are we positioned correctly versus any competition? I believe so.

Since this is a combination of online and brick and mortar business models, the store locations and the online marketing program are key. Showrooms are targeted for population dense markets with a significant percentage of younger drivers. The message is focused on creating acceptance of the electric scooter from a performance perspective and helping reduce our carbon footprint in one of the most fun ways possible. A reputable international manufacturer produces the appealing and cost-effective product for numi. My team and I know how to overcome the challenges numi will face moving forward; and we need your help.

You Can Help

If you can contribute, thank you for your support. If you can't contribute, you can still help. Spread the word. Check out the Numi website at www.numiscooters.com and tell your friends. Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo sharing tools.

story:
Short Summary

I am a father of two young boys and concerned with the direction of the country. The polarization of the political process has left me without a party and seemingly alone in the middle. I declare it is time to find and organize other Undecided Voters and to take back the country.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking to raise $20K to bring a convention for Undecided Voters to Columbus, Ohio. My hope is to be noticed by John Oliver and have him headline a one-day outdoor venue. 

The Impact

Redirect the attention of the candidate's from pandering to their bases and force them to pay attention to a newly vocal middle, aka normal people.

Risks & Challenges

The risk of not acting is to continue down the current path. Politicians don't believe that Undecided Voters exist so their strategy is only to mobilize turnout of their base. They do this by inciting anger and spreading lies. I propose that we demand that they come to us with respect and on our terms.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word that a grass roots protest has begun from the middle.

story:
Tree of Life Cafe & Bakery

Tree of Life was planted in Downtown Fresno, California, in March of 2016, to provide jobs for men and women who have major barriers to employment. They have completed drug and alcohol rehabilitation programs in Fresno County, but many have criminal backgrounds that make job searching very difficult. We (Steve & Carolyn) wanted to create a place where people are motivated to work hard, hang onto positive changes in their lives, and become a beacon of hope to others in the community! You can help fund these jobs while we work hard to establish a great restaurant in downtown Fresno!

We Want to Help You Help Us

Here's where you come in:

  • Your contributions will directly reward men and women for good behavior. As they leave destructive lifestyles behind, they set a new and better example for their children and for society. You can help make this happen!
  • Because you are part of a great social enterprise, we want you to be reminded of your generous spirit and caring heart every day! For those who contribute $25 or more, we will send you this beautiful magnet: 

  • For those who contribute $100 or more, you will receive this handsome mug:

  • For our partners of $250 or more, you will be able to wear this great hat:
  • For a partnership of $500 or more, you receive this Tree of Life Company apron:

  • Our partners who give $1,000 or more will receive this reusable canvas shopping tote with the recipe for our signature Chinese Chicken Salad:
  • This is a win-win proposition. The jobs you help fund will become an example for cities everywhere, inspiring men and women to pursue worthwhile goals and work hard to get there! All of your donations will be used to fund these social enterprise jobs.

The Rewards of Hard Work

Tree of Life has already built a name for itself with delicious farm-to-table cuisine and excellent customer service. Our staff has built a loyal customer base through hard work, creativity and a caring attitude. Tree of Life staff members are seeing their hard work and dedication paying off as customers increase daily. Our staff is experiencing the rewards of team work and sweat equity!

For some employees, this job is the first legal source of income they have had in years. A paycheck that can be handed over-the-counter, not under-the-table, builds self-respect and strong communities.

 A "Hand Up" Not A "Hand Out"

By creating jobs for men and women who formerly relied on government assistance, Tree of Life is restoring a sense of dignity and humanity to men and women whose lives had been stripped of dignity. Tree of Life chefs and servers are creating joy and good memories for customers every day as they serve the best home-cooked food in town!  Our staff love their jobs and want to come to work because they participate in making decisions and setting policies at Tree of Life. Our staff members listen to our customers and the owners listen to our staff members. All opinions matter at Tree of Life!

By working as a team, our staff is reclaiming the human dignity lost to addiction and poverty and the hopelessness those evils breed. Because we are located in downtown, near the Fresno County Courthouse, our staff members are finding themselves cooking for and serving the very lawyers and judges who heard their criminal cases! 

How Can You Help?

Donating money is only one way to help. If you need your paycheck for something like rent or groceries, we understand! But, you can help get our story out to people you know. Share our story with your friends on social media. Invite them to be part of this great social enterprise!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this Crowdfunding Campaign.
  • To make it simple, use the Indiegogo share tools.

And that's all there is to it.

Here are some links to stories about us in the news:

http://www.fresnobee.com/living/food-drink/article68345967.html

http://kingsriverlife.com/01/23/a-tree-of-life-...

http://kingsriverlife.com/04/09/tree-of-life-gr...

 By creating jobs for men and women who formerly relied on government assistance, Tree of Life is restoring a sense of dignity and humanity to men and women whose lives had been stripped of dignity. Tree of Life chefs and servers are creating joy and good memories for customers every day as they serve the best home-cooked food in town!  Our staff love their jobs and want to come to work because they participate in making decisions and setting policies at Tree of Life. Our staff members listen to our customers and the owners listen to our staff members. All opinions matter at Tree of Life!
By working as a team, our staff is reclaiming the human dignity lost to addiction and poverty and the hopelessness those evils breed. Because we are located in downtown, near the Fresno County Courthouse, our staff members are finding themselves cooking for and serving the very lawyers and judges who heard their criminal cases!    How Can You Help? Donating money is only one way to help. If you need your paycheck for something like rent or groceries, we understand! But, you can help get our story out to people you know. Share our story with your friends on social media. Invite them to be part of this great social enterprise!  Get the word out and make some noise about this Crowdfunding Campaign. To make it simple, use the Indiegogo share tools.   And that's all there is to it.Here are some links to stories about us in the news:http://www.fresnobee.com/living/food-drink/article68345967.htmlhttp://kingsriverlife.com/01/23/a-tree-of-life-...http://kingsriverlife.com/04/09/tree-of-life-gr...

story:
Smartroad Tools
Early Warnings of Pavement and Dike Failure

Smartroad Tools (tm) is a system to test and monitor highways and other high-value infrastructure for hidden damage.

Roads, highways, airport runways, railways, and levees (dikes) consist of multiple layers resting on an earthen subbase. Over time, erosion, nearby construction, weather, seismic activity, and other causes can create gaps in this subbase. There is no sign of this on the surface, until a collapse suddenly occurs. This collapse leads to expenses for immediate repair, costs to the surrounding communities due to disruption of transport, environmental and property damage, and human casualties.

At present there is no practical way to monitor the condition of the earthen subbase. We have invented a "smart" material which is embedded during construction or reconstruction, and which provides a fast and easy-to-use way to check the subbase.

In addition to roads and highways, this technology is applicable to flood prevention levees, railways, tunnels, and airport runways. In some cases this technology may apply to oil and gas pipelines, to mining waste ponds, to bridges and highway overpasses, and to high-security buildings such as bank vaults and nuclear power plants.

Who We Are

We are computer specialists who have been designing and building computer software and hardware for many years. One of our specialities is geospatial analysis - processing information usually acquired from earth satellites or GPS, and building geographic information and computer mapping systems.

Smartroad Tools (patents applied for) is a radical departure from traditional geospatial methods. No satellites are involved - it all happens here on earth - yet it still uses our image processing and data analysis expertise.


                          Sally describes the Smartroad Tools mission


                         Kurt tells how he became interested in collapsing roads


What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we need exposure. Tell your friends about us. Better yet, tell your Congressperson about us.

We have several presentations lined up over the next few months at international conferences. At these events, we can show our technology to scientists, industry leaders, and government decision-makers. Unfortunately exhibits at these conferences cost a bundle. We're asking you to help send us to these conferences: in London, in Stockholm, in Korea, and in the U.S. If we do not reach our target, we will go to as many of the events as we can afford. If we exceed the target, the money will go for other, future events and for advancing our research and development. Please contact us with questions or suggestions. We try to reply within 3 days.

What you get from this is a safer life: safer travel and better defence against super-storms like Hurricane Sandy and Hurricane Katrina. But, just so you can get a more direct and immediate reward, we also have a selection of souvenirs:

                                              T-Shirt Designs (S,M,L,XL)


                     Sara and Ploy (anoogo.com) Make Our Custom T-Shirts

story:
Today there are over 940 million vehicles on the road worldwide. In the United States alone there are over 240 million vehicles on the road. Worldwide car registrations and owners are increasing at a rate of 6% yearly making the roadways a large venue for recreational driving as well as for everyday usage.  Our goal is to provide the needs that today's vehicles lack. 

                         

ArmRestor Deluxe- the introduction of our Multi-Functional Arm Rest with a Custom Hand Made Stitched Air Cushioned Pad (100% Cotton) that gives your vehicle the look and feel of a unique style and look to your interior. Fits and adjust to all makes and models and offers so many features and functions. Check out the rest of the story to see how the ArmRestor provides the necessities for your Car, SUV,Truck, Van.....


  



  
The ArmRestor serves many uses besides a slid-able arm rest, so if you don't fancy the arm rest feature,  the ArmRestor offers other useful purposes for your vehicle. Use it for the driver or use it for the passenger-yes-all features are reversible!! Use it for storing, organizing and dispensing your coins and storage and dispensing of tissues (2 types-large and compact) or use the swiveling cup, bottle and cell phone holder. It like having your own personal service attendant. 

Lets face it, cars get messy and cluttered. Coins are thrown in ash trays, glove compartments or stored in the cup trays.  Making a messy appearance, or worse, glued and stuck to the tray after a coffee or soda spill. Good luck trying to pickup your coins in that mess!!!You can never find the coins you need when you need them. Always looking for spare change for coffee, news paper, tolls-whatever it may be. Simply annoying!!!  

Tissues have  bulky boxes and are thrown in the car, crushed between the driver and passenger seats, stuffed or stuck under the seats, or worse- misplaced in the back somewhere- never in reach when you need it most, when driving. A need for a sneeze, a wipe after a bite , a drip after a sip. Those tissues are never there when in need. 

And we can always use a trilateral cup holder that accommodates bottles, cups and cell-phones. Convenience right at your disposal with its swiveling action. Can't ask for a more personal service when available at a moments notice.

                                                                              Features and Benefits

·  Safety-access to all your needs-no distraction

·  Medicinal for better sitting stance-no slouching or sagging

·  Air Cushioned slid-able pad 

·  Hand made pad- Stitched cotton with air cushioned effect

·  Interactive features-holds and dispensers coins and 2 types of tissues

·  Swivel cup holder for bottles, cups and cell phone

·  Convenience and comfort-making your ride more enjoyable and relaxing

·  Ergonomic design-parts simple mate-easy to clean, remove and install

·  Universal fit for all vehicle types

·  Scratch resistant-made of high grade resin with scratch resistant properties

·  Weather tolerant in all weather conditions

·  Reversible features for driver or passenger side




                                                   Safety is our Concern

                     



When you "do not" correctly positioned in a sitting stance, and rest your arm(s) on an arm rest, you tend to have more drag and weight being placed on your back and shoulders. Simply said, you tend to Sag your body! When correctly using a positioned arm rest, your body posture is in its natural sitting stance. The arm is resting naturally, reducing your back from slouching and shoulders from sagging inwardly while driving. 

Without the rest of your arm, this in itself causes stress to the shoulder area and back extremities, an effect due to sagging or total weight distribution from the top part of your body–from your shoulders down to your lower back. The result leads to an uncomfortable body posture causing the body to eventually strain and fatigue to the areas.  The lower arm rest are just too low and drivers always tend to rest their arms on the upper door panel, simply because it is more natural height.  With the air cushioned pad, this discomfort is alleviated, as the comfortable arm rest pad slides to your desired position and comfort, reducing the strain to your body, and simply makes you drive more comfortable.  

                               




 Drivers like when their vehicles are organized and more importantly, like to have easy access to their daily traveling needs.  No longer thrown displaced coins in the center console or ashtray or crushed displaced tissues.  

                                               Solution- ArmRestor

     

            


                             

                            An Ergonomic Design

Parts simply mate without the use of tools, screws or other outside materials. Easy to clean, easy to remove, easy to attach.



1. Comfort in all weather conditions 

We all spend a lot of time on the road, if you don't sit right, you will notice the small discomforts of the low back, upper back, shoulders, and neck. Leaning against the door will hurt your back in a long run. The air cushioned slidable armrest pad allows you to rest your arm in a more comfortable fashion, thereby giving your body a more relaxed resting position, removing the restless feeling of driving.


2. Safety- Keep your eyes on the road.


3. Convenience- One central location for your stuff


4. Easy to use and Tool-less installation

It will take less than a minute to install ArmRestor to your car without any tool. That's right, no tool! A 2 step process. The ArmRestor lip slips into any area on your door panel between the weather stripping & window in an open or closed position. Position the hook and slide in the main body-that is it.

PAD ADJUSTMENT:

The ArmRestor can be fitted along any area of your door panel. The slid-able cushion pad helps to avoid any objects on the door panel without sacrificing the comfort of arm resting. By slightly pressing the release button located in the center of the pad, the pad can slide easily with slight pressure: the pad will move along the base and lock in various preset intervals by releasing the button. The pad can be removed from the uni-body base unit for cleaning purposes. The pad has a slid-able capacity area of about 4-5 inches out from the base ends. 

Hook Adjustment:

The universal hook attachment has a unique patented mechanism that allows the expanding and contraction of the hook, permitting the ArmRestor to fit on all vehicle types.

>>>insert the video here>>>


Tissue Compartment:

The tissue dispenser holds large household tissues or standard size Kleenex tissues purchased at any shopping grocery center. In the back of device, simply insert the tissues in the center of the inner backside lip. Pull out one tissue to have the tissue exposed through the tissue lip for easy dispensing.

Coin Dispenser:

Holds your quarters, nickels and dimes. Simply insert your coins into the proper coin chambers (Q,N,D) from the front: the puck attaches to a spring, securely holding your coins for disbursement. Removing a coin is simple, just place your finger under the mouth opening and slide the coin out. 

Detachable Bottle/Phone HOLDER:

The bottle holder allows swivel action to accommodate the end user comfort by just moving the bottle holder in a 270-degree fashion with preset locking positions. The ergonomically designed cup holder allows for standard Industry bottles,  cans and Styrofoam cups. The cup holder will tightly hold any drink into position while driving.

The swivel action allows cell phone to be at your fingertips for easy access. Avoid Cell Phone Tickets- or get road side distractions. The cell phone holder allows you to have direct access to your cell phone right where you need it, near your body for easy hearing and one touch finger action.


                 CUP HOLDER HAS MANY USES:

         Hot cups, Sweaty bottles-no more. Protective rim and grip handle


                   PAD HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT

The ArmRestor has the capability to incline the pad to your comfort level. Now you can have the pad up high or down low!!!! If  the pad is to high for your comfort, simply either raise your seat to accommodate the use of the ArmRestor's pad or lower the pad by pressing the adjustable hook to incline the unit. Caveat: ensure not to incline more then the 2nd or 3rd preposition lock, for a more secure fit and ensure the cup holder is not in use.


****************************************************************************

                    2 types of Custom Stickers


      

Questions and Answers:

Q: I have a big truck, small car, or SUV-will ArmRestor fit it? 

A: ArmRestor was made to fit all vehicles types. The hook mechanism expands to allow a universal fit.  The ArmRestor also fits vertically perfect on the interior door pane for a snug fit since the dimensions are standardized in all vehicles between the vertical X axis .

Q: Does the ArmRestor need any adhesives, screws, or other attaching elements? 

A: No, the ArmRestor device was developed and patented to allow the unit to station on your door panel without the use of these tools or attachment materials. The lip adjustment allows the device to fit securely & comfortable along any door panel. 

Q: Will ArmRestor be intrusive on the side airbags?

A: NO! , the hook mechanism that holds the body's mainframe will give way upon the pressure of the air bag opening if one happens to be in the general area where the ArmRestor is placed, thereby giving the cover to release upon the air bag dispensing. Also it actually happens to be a protectorant in that many covers of the door fly outwardly upon the bag being pressurized and released. This keeps the panel from flying out into the person while the airbag commonly disperses from the bottom upward where it is stored. The ArmRestor does not cover the lower extremities of the cover or where the airbag dispenses from.! 

Q: What type of leather ArmRestor is using?

A: Synthetic leather- it is made with high-grade vinyl which is tough and durable, easy to clean and maintain.

Q: Will the ArmRestor look or appear to fit smoothly or look right? 

A: Yes, the patented features and ergonomic design fits smoothly on the door panel. The adjustable lip will allow the ArmRestor to press tightly along the door panel for a tight and smooth fit without the lumbered appearance. 

Q: Is the ArmRestor permanently positioned on the door panel? 

A: NO, it is your choice to leave it there permanently or not. The device is portable and the adjustment mechanisms allow you to easily remove it, reposition it, or replace it back on your door panel. 

Q: Can the ArmRestor Device only be on the driver’s side door panel? 

A: No, the device was designed & patented to be used as a reversible Armrest and can be used on any one of your door panels. The bottle holder positions on each side of the Device, allowing the bottle tray removed and positioned on either side. This will allow the bottle tray to position in the front. 

Q: Can you place the bottle holder on the back end of the Device? 

A: Yes, the bottle holder has two positions, one on each end. It is up to the owner to use it to their best intentions. We recommend having the bottle holder rest in the front side for easy access while driving. For passenger use, the bottle holder can be in either position. 

Q: Will the Lip scratch the window? 

A: No, the material used is plastic. The ergonomically developed Lip avoids the back end from rubbing against your window. 

Q: What material is ArmRestor using?

A: The ArmRestor is made of automotive friendly plastics with UV stabilizers and is scratch resistant.

Q: Will a drink spill while driving? 

A: No, the design of the bottle holder and unit will withstand road bumps, so it acts as a shock absorber. Your bottle of water will be safe. 

Q: Will the drink come out of the bottle holder if I slam the door? 

A: It is intended for water bottle, so it will be fine. Let's not slam your door, bad for your car!

Installation instructions

1) Place the ArmRestor in an area along the door panel where it avoids any intrusion of your door latch or door LIP release knob.

2) The best option of inserting the lip of the hook, is to have your window rolled down completely and in some cases, to leave the window slightly visible, then locate the lip between the window and area of your weather stripping, then roll the window up to ensure it is attached properly.

3) The device will comfortably stay in position by simply pressing the body of the ArmRestor against the side of the inside door panel, first by pressing in the hook release button located on the top side of the hook area device: Adjust the hook according to the depth of your door panel. This will ensure the device properly secures against the door base by allowing the adjustable hook attachment to adjust to the depth or thickness of your door panel & allow the device to stay in position with the window open or closed, without coming off.

NOTES: 

- Allow the positioning of the ArmRestor along the door panel to avoid interference with the steering wheel, so that you have the most comfortable positioning of the Device. The slidable pad allows you to use the device as close or far from you since the pad feature moves along the base. 

- Be diligent where you place the device on the door panel so to avoid the objects that may be on your door panel such as the handle to open the door or the doorknob. 

- Before closing or slamming your car door, be sure to remove any drinking cup from the bottle- holder that does not have a lid cover, as precaution, so to avoid the cup from potentially spilling out any liquid. 

- Be cautious of drinking hot items placed in your bottle holder as you may unintentionally hit the cup while driving and may burn your hand or leg. Place water bottle only in the bottle holder in the appropriate position.

Disclaimers:

➢Allow the positioning of the ArmRestor along the door panel to avoid interference with the steering wheel, so that you have the most comfortable positioning of the Device. The slidable pad allows you to use the device as close or far from you since the pad feature moves along the base.

➢ Be diligent where you place the device on the door panel so to avoid the objects that may be on your door panel such as the handle to open the door or the doorknob.

➢ Before closing or slamming your car door, be sure to remove any drinking cup from the cup-holder that does not have a lid cover, as precaution, so to avoid the cup from potentially spilling out any liquid.

➢ Be cautious of drinking hot items placed in your cup holder as you may unintentionally hit the cup while driving and may burn your hand or leg. Place the cup holder in the appropriate position.

Project Creator

Nova Creations genesis was in part due to myself, Rob Nova with an entrepreneurial spirit. I converged my design ideas and paired up with an engineering professor to bring this product to life. I began my journey in financial analysis, studying and toggling with creating products that are consumer useful. My knowledge of manufacturing was broadened by my endeavor as a controller of a manufacturing operations-giving rise to my dreams of manufacturing. Many conceptual ideas I have created for eventual introduction in areas of housewares, stationary goods, Aftermarket.... My first success begins with the ArmRestor.

The ArmRestor is a product that aids all drivers and passengers with functionality that today's vehicles lack. This lack of amenities gave rise to my passion to introduce to the market a unique vehicle accessory and arm rest, allowing safety, convenience, and medicinal options.
Supporters are an immense part of the project not only to see the vision come to life through their financial support but through their on-going interest in seeing this through, making it a joint venture.


Risks & Challenges

It took me many years and more than 30 revisions to design and perfect the ArmRestor. I had spent most of our time in the main body design starting with multi-components to the unibody design. Our concern was mainly the durability of the product. The snap-in features were the most critical parts of our design process. We made several prototypes for initial testing. The supplier liked my ideas and agreed to start the mold for real product testing. I have been using the real product for strength and temperature testing rather than the ONLY one expensive and weak 3D printed prototype. The supplier has helped us to troubleshoot and perfect the product to the final stage where we are now.

My supplier is an injection molding company located in China. It has over 20 years of experience and a complete quality management systems including ISO9001 and ISO14001. The good news is the tooling is done. Your pledges will help cover remaining of the tooling cost and MOQ (minimum order quantity), as well as packaging and shipping. I will ship ArmRestor rewards to backers by the end of 2015, so you will be ready for your road trip in the Summer!

Your support comes in many ways not only financial but to help me get the word out. This link is a share link that combines Pinterest, Facebook and Twitter in one single button, automatically adding our link to your social media. This would be a great wahoo.

It could be the entire length of a FOOTBALL FIELD without looking!!  Thousands of people die each year as a result of distraction while driving.
