story:
Short Summary

(right to left) Jennifer Bierma CMT (Owner) & Nicole Haapala (Reiki Master)


No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork, Inc. has, for years, had big ideas on how we can expand to help more people meet their health and wellness goals. For those of you that know our owner, Jennifer, you know that her heart is always focused on her clients and how she can serve one more person and eventually save the world. (Insert laughter here) While saving the world may be her end goal, we need to start a little smaller…increasing the number of people and ways that we can serve clients through No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork, Inc.

That is the reason that we have decided that we are going to run a Crowd-funding campaign to help us raise the capital needed to expand our business. We understand that a certain percentage of people will think that using Crowd-funding is a tacky way to help us expand, and to those people, we are sorry that you feel that way.  As a small business that does not sell a lot of retail (yet) and relies on our massage therapists’ time (and ability to continue working) to make money, it is hard to expand. Unfortunately, it is not as easy to get a loan for expansion when your business relies solely on the time of a few people. However, that just means that we have to get creative! 

Watch our video to hear more about what this expansion means to our owner, Jennifer.  In the meantime, let us tell you a bit about ourselves, as well as our expansion goal, so that you can see where we are coming from and how we are going to move forward when we have the funds.

At the age of 19, Jennifer started No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork by providing in-home massage services to clients 6 days per week.  Shortly after she started she was approached by an amazing woman who was the sole caregiver for her adult daughter who was disabled from Multiple Sclerosis. Jennifer quickly found that connecting with people and providing them with safe, loving touch, not only gave benefit to clients but filled her heart as well.  Jennifer has continued to serve her clients with a full heart since the very beginning but realizes that she has so much more to give. 

In 2011, Jennifer’s schedule had gotten so busy that she had to expand to a physical location in order to eliminate some of the travel time that was causing her to miss out on time to serve more of her clients. She opened the 675 square foot massage clinic that currently houses No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork, Inc.  After a few years in this location, Jennifer started to run out of room in her schedule again.  She started the search for a second massage therapist, to no avail. Instead, she found a phenomenal assistant that soon became the newest member of the No Knots team.  Nicole was not only a great assistant, she was in the process of getting her Reiki Energy Work certification.  She soon became the Reiki Master at the office, as well as Jennifer’s assistant.

After Nicole started in the office, Jennifer realized a new goal…helping new health practitioners find their place in the market and healing themselves in a positive work environment as they helped to heal others.  The more high quality health practitioners that the general public has access to, the more people we can help. That means less pain, less stress and more healthy people living and working in our communities!  Jennifer’s new expansion dream started to grow from there. 

This month another practitioner started to work out of the No Knots space. She is one more person that can make a difference in the lives and health of others.  Jennifer has a vision to house several more health practitioners in the new space adjacent to our current space.  With the extra space in this expansion our team will have the opportunity to grow and to change thousands of lives.

When we raise the funds to complete this expansion, our clients will not only have access to the practitioners that are currently in the office but will have easy access to additional alternative therapies to help them deal with stress, pain, emotional trauma and a wide variety of other health issues. In conjunction with more treatment modalities, we plan to offer a variety of seminars to help educate our clients on many avenues of health and wellness.  As you already read above, it is our passion to serve people.  With our current practitioner team in place, we are now starting to form our team of supporters.

Will you be part of our team?  Will you to help us, help others?


What We Need & What You Get

**UPDATE:  In order to best serve our clients and make the best choices for the business, we are constantly re-assessing where we are with this expansion plan as well as the funding for the expansion.  After a review of our timeline for the expansion, we have decided to scale back the original plan and move forward more slowly than anticipated. This will help us to focus on one section of the expansion at a time and ensure the continued success of each portion of the business. If there is one thing that we have learned over the years, it is that growth is a process of ever changing strategy and decisions must be made and re-assessed often.

Our overall expansion plan is to add an additional 2,700 square feet to our current 675 square foot- two treatment room location (in red box below.)  This will include up to 5 more treatment rooms, a retail space, a bathroom, a small seminar space, a large seminar space, room for storage and a laundry room.  This space would allow us to help educate our clients and others in the community, offer more services to our clients and give us the space to expand our retail store to bring clients the products that they have been asking for.

At this time, we will be moving forward on a portion of that space.  The image below shows the expansion plan in its entirety, however, we will be starting with expanding into the space on the top half of the plan.  This will give us two additional treatment rooms, a large area for a gift shop/product store and two large closets for storage.  We will continue to use the common area (a large open space within our building) for seminars until we expand further.

With the changes to our expansion pace, our monetary goal for this campaign is also changing.  The new goal will be $20,000.  Here is what the $20,000 will cover (Costs are rounded up to the nearest $100 for easier calculation):

  1. Renovation of one of the three adjacent spaces to connect to the current No Knots location. This includes removal of a portion of two walls, painting, electrical, heating and air, the addition of ceilings, flooring and current wall repairs. Cost: $11,000

  2. The purchase of seminar equipment such as folding tables, chairs, projectors, screens and sound equipment.  Cost: $3,000

  3. Retail displays. Cost: $3,000

  4. Initial funds for retail products. Cost: $3,000

  5. If renovations are completed under budget or we raise more than the $20,000, we will develop a larger scale advertising plan to help ensure our success over the next few years.

There are multiple ways that you can support us in this venture;

  1. Purchase a T-shirt for $35 (Mens and womens sizing available).

  2. Purchase a leaf shaped plaque to be displayed on the Tree of Support in the seminar area- $25, $50 or $100. 


3.  VIP Event Passes for the Grand Opening Celebration on November 7th, 2015.

(Event date subject to change due to practitioner schedules or expansion building delays)


The Impact

For the past 14 years, our goal is to help change the lives of thousands of people for the better by giving them access to compassionate health practitioners that are educated on the human body and how it works and use this knowledge to teach our clients one on one how to care for their body.  We can make a larger impact by adding health and wellness seminars/classes to teach in a larger setting as well as more practitioners that can help them heal.  Many of our current clients come to us with pain, stress, anxiety and fear about the health decisions that they are making.  Our practitioners utilize their knowledge to help clear their mind, release their stress and assist their body back in to balance so that it can heal itself.  We want to be able to do this for more people.  Our practitioners are professionals that are passionate about helping people and love to do this “job”.  We want to help these clients thrive in the lives. 

As you may have read earlier, our owner (Jennifer), has a passion for volunteer service and is very active in her community.  As part of the expansion, Jennifer has committed to donating the use of the seminar space (for a select number of events per month) to non-profits that fit in with the No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork, Inc. mission.  These non-profits will be selected based on an application that shows the activities that are done in the local community to raise awareness about health and wellness topics, the number of people served, their commitment to their own mission as well as the availability of the space for their selected events. 

Our goal is to help change the lives of thousands of people for the better by giving them access to health and wellness seminars/classes and practitioners that can help them heal.  Many of our current clients come to us with pain, stress, anxiety and fear about the health decisions that they are making.  Our practitioners utilize their knowledge to help clear their mind, release their stress and assist their body back in to balance so that it can heal itself.  We want to be able to do this for more people.  Our practitioners are professionals that are passionate about helping people and love to do this “job”.  We want to help these clients thrive in the lives. 


Risks & Challenges

Increasing our space from 675 square feet to 2,700 square feet is going to alleviate many of our current challenges but will, undoubtedly, bring on a few other challenges. With the slow down in our expansion, we will now have to contend with any lease agreement for the additional space in the building if our landlord rents it to another tenant before we decide to mo

As part of our goal, we are looking to increase the number of practitioners that we have working in the office as independent contractors. We want to give other practitioners a safe and healing environment to grow and expand their business while teaming up with like-minded individuals to help our clients and the community members.  The challenge is finding practitioners that work well together, have similar goals and are strong enough in their own business to rent space at our clinic.  We are confident that we can do this because our current practitioners all have connections in the communities surrounding our office and are all involved with business networking groups that bolster relationships with like-minded individuals.  With the contacts that we make through other organizations, we often find practitioners that are a good fit for our team.

Our second challenge is getting the word out to our client base and the community about the expansion as well as the upcoming classes and seminars. We want to provide individuals and families with high quality educational content and in order to do that, we need to have people in the seats at our seminars.  We will be using social media, email newsletters, word of mouth marketing and local newspaper advertising options to draw more individuals and families in to our seminars and classes.  We will be polling our current client base on what content that they would like to see offered.  Per our original clinic design, we also have the advantage of being a storefront location.  Signage will be prominently displayed on our building so that new customers/clients and community members can clearly see what we offer. 

Our main risk on this adventure is committing to a lease without having a full time practitioner base to start with and a full schedule for classes. Again, we are confident that we will succeed due to our strong network of supporters, clients, colleagues, friends and families.  We are currently working on a list of classes/seminars and will be posting them as soon as we have final commitment from our instructors. We are continually looking for practitioners that can work with us to accomplish the goals that we have set and that have goals that we can help them accomplish.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that some of our biggest supporters will be individuals that don’t have the funds to contribute to our campaign.  That is okay!  We still love you for showing your support! 

    If you cannot contribute financially, we ask that you contribute your time.  Take some time to share our campaign with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tool (or just tell everyone you know to go to www.HelpNoKnotsGrow.com!)  The more people that see our campaign, the more support we will receive and the faster we will reach our goal of helping to change the lives of thousands for the better!

    There is one more way that you can support us.  When we opened our current location, we knew that it was important for us to fill our space from the inside-out with positive blessings and kind words.  We asked our family, friends and acquaintances to fill out blessing cards for us to hang inside the walls of our space. These blessings offered support, “May the practitioners working in this space have the strength and knowledge to help each person they touch” or words of intention, “Let each person who steps foot in this room be filled with love, light and positive energy” or a blessing for healing “May all that enter this space be blessed with good health and healing.”  We had a lot of people participate and had blessing cards from each one to hang. Before the sheetrock went up in the space, we hung all of the cards and set the intention of filling our space with love, compassion and positive healing energy. We believe that it has worked, so we would love to do this in our expanded space as well. 

    If you would like to create a blessing card for us, please send a hand written or typed card (no larger than a 3 x 5 notecard) to:

    No Knots Massage

    445 Broadway Avenue #100

    St.Paul Park, MN 55071


    We appreciate you supporting us and sincerely hope that one day we will get the chance to thank you in person.  (For now, THANK YOU!)
story_txt:
Short Summary 


(right to left) Jennifer Bierma CMT (Owner) & Nicole Haapala (Reiki Master) 
No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork, Inc. has, for
years, had big ideas on how we can expand to help more people meet their health
and wellness goals. For those of you that know our owner, Jennifer, you know
that her heart is always focused on her clients and how she can serve one more
person and eventually save the world. (Insert laughter here) While
saving the world may be her end goal, we need to start a little
smaller…increasing the number of people and ways that we can serve clients
through No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork, Inc. 
That is the reason that we have decided that we are going to
run a Crowd-funding campaign to help us raise the capital needed to expand our
business. We understand that a certain percentage of people will think that
using Crowd-funding is a tacky way to help us expand, and to those people, we
are sorry that you feel that way.  As a
small business that does not sell a lot of retail (yet) and relies on our
massage therapists’ time (and ability to continue working) to make money, it is
hard to expand. Unfortunately, it is not as easy to get a loan for expansion
when your business relies solely on the time of a few people. However, that
just means that we have to get creative! 

Watch our video to hear more about what this expansion means to our owner, Jennifer.  In the meantime, let us tell you a bit about ourselves, as well as our
expansion goal, so that you can see where we are coming from and how we are
going to move forward when we have the funds.
At the age of 19, Jennifer started No Knots Professional
Massage & Bodywork by providing in-home massage services to clients 6 days per week.  Shortly after she started she was approached
by an amazing woman who was the
sole caregiver for her adult daughter who was disabled from Multiple
Sclerosis. Jennifer quickly found that connecting with
people and providing them with safe, loving touch, not only gave benefit to clients
but filled her heart as well.  Jennifer
has continued to serve her clients with a full heart since the very beginning but realizes that she has
so much more to give.  
In 2011, Jennifer’s schedule had gotten so busy that she had
to expand to a physical location in order to eliminate some of the travel time that was causing her to miss out on time to serve more of her clients. She opened the 675 square foot massage
clinic that currently houses No Knots Professional Massage & Bodywork,
Inc.  After a few years in this location, Jennifer started
to run out of room in her schedule again. 
She started the search for a second massage therapist, to no avail.
Instead, she found a phenomenal assistant that soon became the newest member of
the No Knots team.  Nicole was not only a
great assistant, she was in the process of getting her Reiki Energy Work
certification.  She soon became the Reiki
Master at the office, as well as Jennifer’s assistant. 
After Nicole started in the office, Jennifer realized a new goal…helping
new health practitioners find their place in the market and healing themselves in
a positive work environment as they helped to heal others.  The more high quality health practitioners
that the general public has access to, the more people we can help. That means
less pain, less stress and more healthy people living and working in our
communities!  Jennifer’s new expansion
dream started to grow from there.  

This month another practitioner started to work out of the No Knots space. She is one more person that can make a difference in the lives and
health of others.  Jennifer has a vision
to house several more health practitioners in the new space adjacent to our
current space.  With the extra space in this expansion our team will have the opportunity to grow and to change thousands of lives. 
When we raise the funds to complete this expansion, our
clients will not only have access to the practitioners that are currently in
the office but will have easy access to additional alternative therapies to
help them deal with stress, pain, emotional trauma and a wide variety of other
health issues. In conjunction with more
treatment modalities, we plan to offer a variety of seminars to help educate our clients on many avenues of health and wellness.  As you already read
above, it is our passion to serve people.  With our current practitioner team in place, we are now starting to form our team of supporters. 
Will you be part of our team?  Will you to help us, help
others? 
 
  What We Need & What You Get 
**UPDATE:  In order to best serve our clients and make the best 
choices for the business, we are constantly re-assessing where we are 
with this expansion plan as well as the funding for the expansion.  
After a review of our timeline for the expansion, we have decided to 
scale back the original plan and move forward more slowly than anticipated. This will help us to
 focus on one section of the expansion at a time and ensure the 
continued success of each portion of the business. If there is one thing
 that we have learned over the years, it is that growth is a process of 
ever changing strategy and decisions must be made and re-assessed 
often. Our overall expansion plan is to add an additional 2,700 square feet to
our current 675 square foot- two treatment room location (in red box below.)  This will include
up to 5 more treatment rooms, a retail space, a bathroom, a small seminar
space, a large seminar space, room for storage and a laundry room.  This space would allow us to help educate our
clients and others in the community, offer more services to our clients and
give us the space to expand our retail store to bring clients the products that
they have been asking for. At this time, we will be moving forward on a portion of that space.  The image below shows the expansion plan in its entirety, however, we will be starting with expanding into the space on the top half of the plan.  This will give us two additional treatment rooms, a large area for a gift shop/product store and two large closets for storage.  We will continue to use the common area (a large open space within our building) for seminars until we expand further. 
With the changes to our expansion pace, our monetary goal for this campaign is also changing.  The new goal will be $20,000.  Here is what the $20,000 will
cover (Costs are rounded up to the nearest $100 for easier calculation): 

Renovation of one of the three adjacent spaces to connect
to the current No Knots location. This includes removal of a portion of two walls, painting, electrical, heating and air, the addition of
ceilings, flooring and current wall repairs. Cost: $11,000
The purchase of seminar equipment such as
folding tables, chairs, projectors, screens and sound equipment.  Cost: $3,000
Retail displays. Cost: $3,000
Initial funds for retail products. Cost: $3,000
If renovations are completed under budget
or we raise more than the $20,000, we will develop a larger scale advertising
plan to help ensure our success over the next few years. 

There are multiple ways that you can support us in this venture; 
Purchase a T-shirt for $35 (Mens and womens sizing available).  

Purchase a leaf shaped plaque to be displayed on the Tree of Support in the seminar area- $25, $50 or $100.  


3.  VIP Event Passes for the Grand Opening Celebration on November 7th, 2015. (Event date subject to change due to practitioner schedules or expansion building delays)    The Impact

of thousands of people for the better by giving them access to compassionate

lives.

committed to donating the use of the seminar space (for a select number of
events per month) to non-profits that fit in with the No Knots Professional Massage

non-profits will be selected based on an application that shows the activities that are done in the local
community to raise awareness about health and wellness topics, the number of
people served, their commitment to their own mission as well as the
availability of the space for their selected events.

for the better by giving them access to health and wellness seminars/classes
and practitioners that can help them heal. 
Many of our current clients come to us with pain, stress, anxiety and
fear about the health decisions that they are making.  Our practitioners utilize their knowledge to
help clear their mind, release their stress and assist their body back in to

story:
Let’s talk about dreams. Even better, let’s talk about dreams coming true.

All of us have this wish that someday, we will live somewhere in a place we’ve always dreamed of. Away from the bustling city and the smog, preferably in the mountains or in an island. It can be different for everyone, but for the two of us, we found it in Siargao Island.

We are two girls (Camille, 28 and Dominique, 32) originally from Manila with the biggest dreams in the world. Camille is a traveling journalist, while Dominique works as a marketing specialist and a hostel manager. Since we have the innate yearning for the sea, traveling, and pursuing our dreams, we did not pass off an opportunity when one of us saw a lot in General Luna, Siargao with a hut in it. And we thought, “this is our home. We will grow old here.”

As we write this, materials for construction have been bought and repairs are being done in the house. The original hut used to be a shop, and we want to make it as cozy as possible so that it can become a comfortable nesting place for like-minded and free-spirited individuals. It is now being built into a two-storey house with an attic. The house is too big for the two of us and we are planning to transform the remaining space into a homestay or an AirBnb-rented inn with 5 hammocks, some beds, and a space to pitch tents for budget travelers and surfers visiting this beautiful little island. There will also be a "hangout" area with trippy lights, mats, pillows, bean bags to serve as the common area where we can all chill. We are two women starting small, and we are noticing that the repairs are becoming quite costly.

We are asking for donations in kind, anything you would be willing to let go off. We can take music instruments (guitars, djembres, ukuleles, anything!), fixtures, curtains, books, utensils, hammocks, trippy works of art, posters, surfboards, mats (banig), yoga mats or any small furniture that you don’t use anymore. We are set on a bohemian chic, native theme for the house, and we will accept just about anything that captures that vibe. We also accept monetary donations to further cover construction costs or to buy certain things that our budget (for now) cannot afford. If you are having trouble sending donations through this Indiegogo page, you can send it through our PayPal accounts, our individual bank accounts (BPI), or Western Union (send us a message for details).

We will be honest and just put it out here: financial donations will mean the most to us, since it is the least difficult to send (and most helpful) compared to items that our place needs. Since this is a huge, unexpected, sudden leap of faith for the both of us and everything is happening so quickly, we have decided to put all of our savings into making this happen, and your help will get us a long way. Also, we can always acquire the things that our place needs with the donations that you guys will send, if you choose to do so. Any amount will help and it will go a long, long way in the building process that is happening at the moment. 

We are located 3 minutes away from the nearest white sand beach with a bar, and two kilometers away from the world-famous Cloud 9 surfing spot. We have unofficially decided to call our place “The Hangout,” since it’s basically what everyone will be doing there, aside from having the best time in Siargao Island. We intend to open our doors by early September, just in time for the swell and for the international competitions to happen! Just look at this wave caught by our neighbor and friend, Bryan, who also owns a clothing company based in the island called Waverider. Pretty awesome, right? 


We will appreciate each and every donation with the deepest sense of gratitude, as you will ALWAYS be welcome in our home anytime you visit the island. Just think of this: anything you give us will be a part of our home, so you will ALWAYS be a part of our home. Everyday when we wake up realizing that we have made our dreams come true, we will think of each and everyone of you. We will even put your names on the things you give us so when we have guests and if they ask about it, we can tell the amazing stories on how we met you or the relationships we have. It’s our little way of making this a one big connecting island experience for all of us.

As we charge accommodation for our homestay, 5 percent of each bill will go to Nature Kids of Siargao, a non-profit organization started by our friend, Sanne Sevig that acts as a community hub for less fortunate families in Siargao. Nature Kids of Siargao is involved in improving General Luna’s only orphanage called “A Thousand Smiles.” Sanne also owns Paglaom Hostel, the coolest hostel in Siargao Island with her partner Cocoy,  and they are active in building the orphanage through volunteer programs that their guests (and hopefully our guests too) can join in. Not only do we have loads of fun, but the children are lovely and enthusiastic, which makes us want to get more people involved so they can experience the warmth and sunshine that these children have in their hearts.

The organization is also active in arranging beach clean ups, play time for the children, painting the orphanage, donating clothes and school supplies, and giving school and art lessons. 

There is no fixed group of beneficiaries as the organization aims to help out as many families as possible. We will provide updates on donations for these organizations, and for the repairs of the house to anyone who has given us financial aid. Even if you choose not to make a donation, just spreading word about Nature Kids of Siargao or A Thousand Smiles would really make our day!

Aside from fulfilling our dreams, arranging a cozy space for travelers, and being involved in the organization, we want to pursue this project to provide a decent livelihood for the original landowners. One of them Tiyo Mimi  (the man in the photo), is disabled, and his wife had her first birthday cake at the age of 71 (care of Dominique). One of the first goals of our inn is to provide medical support for Tiyo Mimi. They are kind-hearted and more than happy to have a home built on their land. If our homestay sustains, it means that they will also have a steady income, allowing them to live their lives in a more comfortable way.

As that crazy-genius legend Hunter S. Thompson puts it:

“Look for a way of life. Decide how you want to live and then see what you can do to make a living WITHIN that way of life. But you say, “I don’t know where to look; I don’t know what to look for.”

And there’s the crux. Is it worth giving up what I have to look for something better? I don’t know — is it? Who can make that decision but you? But even by DECIDING TO LOOK, you go a long way toward making the choice.”


This has been our dream and we have found a way to make a living out of it. It was purely a work of destiny that the two of us had the same flight going to Siargao last June, met and became close in the island, and share the same dream. We truly hope you can all be a part of this journey. There is nothing like seeing your dreams come to life at such a fast pace—so fast that we feel that we have to do everything we can to keep it going and make it a permanent reality.

And oh, the gorgeous islands you see in this post? These are our "neighbor islands." Once you visit us, we can take you there anytime you want and live the island life the best way possible.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and may your day be filled with light and good energy. And may all your dreams come true, just like how ours is taking shape.


Sending warm and sunny vibes from the island,


Camille Banzon and Dominique Francisco

The Hangout, Siargao Island


Here are some of the accounts you can send your donations to:

Dom's PayPal
maridominique@gmail.com

Bank of the Philippine Islands (BPI) Savings Account
Account name: Mari Dominique Francisco

Account number: 4309017698

Cash and Carry Branch


LBC

Mari Dominique Francisco

Dapa branch, Siargao, Surigao Del Norte

families in Siargao. Nature Kids of Siargao is involved in improving General Luna’s only orphanage called “A Thousand Smiles.” Sanne also owns Paglaom Hostel, the coolest hostel in Siargao Island with her partner Cocoy,  and they are active in building the orphanage through volunteer programs that their guests (and hopefully our guests too) can join in. Not only do we have loads of fun, but the children are lovely and enthusiastic, which makes us want to get more people involved so they can experience the warmth and sunshine that these children have in their hearts.



The organization
is also active in arranging beach clean ups, play time for the children, painting the orphanage, donating clothes and school supplies, and giving school and art lessons. 



There
is no fixed group of beneficiaries as the organization aims to help out as many
families as possible. We will provide updates on donations for these
organizations, and for the repairs of the house to anyone who has given us
financial aid. Even if you choose not to make a donation, just spreading word about Nature Kids of Siargao or A Thousand Smiles would really make our day!


Aside from fulfilling our dreams, arranging a cozy space for
travelers, and being involved in the organization, we want to pursue this
project to provide a decent livelihood for the original landowners. One of them Tiyo Mimi  (the man in the photo), is disabled, and his wife had her first birthday cake at the age of 71 (care of
Dominique). One of the first goals of our inn is to provide medical support for Tiyo Mimi. They are kind-hearted and more than happy to have a home built on
their land. If our homestay sustains, it means that they will also have a
steady income, allowing them to live their lives in a more comfortable way.
As that crazy-genius legend Hunter S. Thompson puts it:
“Look for a way of life. Decide how you want to live and then see
what you can do to make a living WITHIN that way of life. But you say, “I don’t
know where to look; I don’t know what to look for.”
And there’s the crux. Is it worth giving up what I have to look
for something better? I don’t know — is it? Who can make that decision but you?
But even by DECIDING TO LOOK, you go a long way toward making the choice.” 



This has been our dream and we have found a way to make a
living out of it. It was purely a work of destiny that the two of us had the
same flight going to Siargao last June, met and became close in the island, and
share the same dream. We truly hope you can all be a part of this journey. There
is nothing like seeing your dreams come to life at such a fast pace—so fast
that we feel that we have to do everything we can to keep it going and make it
a permanent reality. 
And oh, the gorgeous islands you see in this post? These are our "neighbor islands." Once you visit us, we can take you there anytime you want and live the island life the best way possible.
Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and may
your day be filled with light and good energy. And may all your dreams come
true, just like how ours is taking shape.

Sending warm and sunny vibes from the island,



Camille Banzon and Dominique Francisco
The Hangout, Siargao Island


Here are some of the accounts you can send your donations to:

Dom's PayPalmaridominique@gmail.com
Bank of the Philippine Islands (BPI) Savings Account

Account name: Mari Dominique Francisco

Account number: 4309017698
Cash and Carry Branch

LBC
Mari Dominique Francisco
Dapa branch, Siargao, Surigao Del Norte

story:
Who We Are

My name is Christine and I founded Mo'Pweeze Bakery as a way to provide safe treats for my son and other kids to enjoy. As an allergy sufferer and head of a household of allergy sufferers including three kids, my youngest son suffers from 35 different allergies and was the inspiration for developing desserts that are Top '8' allergen free.

 

The eight foods identified by the FDA are:

  1. Milk
  2. Eggs
  3. Fish (e.g., bass, flounder, cod)
  4. Crustacean shellfish (e.g. crab, lobster, shrimp)
  5. Tree nuts (e.g., almonds, walnuts, pecans)
  6. Peanuts
  7. Wheat
  8. Soybeans

Our mission here at Mo'Pweeze is to take the worries from parents, caregivers and allergy sufferers who are looking for safe, delicious treats. We use the finest, freshest ingredients, free from all common allergens and look to provide a menu that is filled with safe, scrumptious foods.

Mo'Pweeze Bakery is an online bakery based in the Northern NJ area. Recently Voted 'Best bakery in Bergen' for 2016 by Bergen magazine, Mo'Pweeze has recently relocated to  a gluten-free, nut-free kitchen in Denville, NJ and has a growing fan base of customers who we reach through our website at www.mopweezebakery.com as well as a number of Farmers markets in the Northern NJ area. Mo'Pweeze also attends a number of special events and expos focused on Vegan, Specialty Food, and Allergen markets.

And as for our name, it was inspired by our son Maddox words after tasting his first yummy allergy free treat - Mo'Pweeze (More please).

 

 

 

Why we need Funding

Just as we began Mo'Pweeze as a way to provide treats to our own son who suffers from multiple allergies, we know that there are many individuals, families and kids who are not able to enjoy foods that most of us take for granted. We live for feedback from our customers describing how we were their or their children's first store bought cupcake or cake EVER.  We seek to create one of NJ's only all Allergen-free and Vegan retail bakeries to give customers a little haven, and where we can be more accessible to customers in need of our products in a family friendly atmosphere. 

Along with being able to provide a wider variety of baked goods for retail, A space like this would allow us to:

·  Provide kids decorating classes.
.  Provide an allergen-free party room
·  Partner with local food artisans to showcase new allergy friendly products.

Along with finishing the storefront space, your funding will help us with additional equipment purchasing and fit outs, and to get us stocked up for a grand opening.

We seek 25K through the IndieGogo campaign in order to fit out our storefront.  If we exceed this goal the additional funds will go towards purchasing equipment and stocking up on initial inventory. Alternatively, additional funding will be sought through business loans and equipment financing. 
 
Your contributions will allow us to bring smiles to more faces of allergy sufferers, celiacs, vegans, and gluten free adherents who have a hard time finding safe and delicious treats
.
What we Hope to Bring to you

Mo'Pweeze Bakery sells a wide range of gourmet cupcakes, sweet breads, cookies, and custom cakes. Each item is made from scratch using all natural and verified allergen free sources sourced through largely local suppliers or distributors. It is important that our products not only taste delicious but that they also look appealing and attractive to the eye. 

Customers may purchase pre-made or made-to-order products. We also have the ability to customize special orders for our customers in order to eliminate additional allergens without loss of taste. This attention to the health needs of our customers as well as taste profile has gained us much positive good will and positive reviews.

We have only just begun in creating a line of allergen treats. A retail storefront will give everyone an accessible spot to pick up or see the smile on their kids faces when they can choose whatever store treat of their choosing. A storefront will also allow us to expand our line to include additional goods such as donuts, sandwich breads, brownies, as well as accessory items that would provide for a more thorough cafe experience such as specialty teas, and coffees using non dairy milks and creamers. 

 

 

The Impact

With your help we hope to bring safe and delicious foods to kids and families in NY/NJ. 

 

The following are just a selection of reviews form our past customers.

'I have been searching for years for an allergy friendly cake for my son for his birthday. I finally found a baker that specializes in allergen-free cakes that ACTUALLY tastes like a real cake. For the first time in 10 years, my son was able to eat cake for his birthday. He had never been able to have baked goods before as everything had at least one ingredient he was allergic to. I drove 1.5 hours to pick up the cake which was ordered at the last minute. I would have driven 3 hours to get this cake. He absolutely loved every single bite of it. His face beamed with delight as he ate every piece he was given. Other family members had a slice and commented that it actually tasted like a regular cake. I plan on purchasing all of his baked goods from Mo Pweeze. Worth every penny I paid.'

'MoPweeze bakery has changed our little girl's life! For two years we have searched for a bakery who could cater to our daughter's array of allergies without any luck. Finally we found MoPweeze! Chris was incredibly empathetic and helpful. She created a custom cupcake that was safe for our daughter to eat. Now instead of bringing ice pops to birthday parties and school events, our daughter can join in with her peers and chow down on a cupcake. And the best part is- they are delicious! Our personal favorite is the sani bani vanilla strawberry. We are so thankful to have found Chris and or so is our daughter's belly! Her icing-covered smile said it all! MoPweeze is the best!With Gratitude,The Reff Family'

'A bakery cupcake that my son with multiple food allergies could eat? Unbelievable! With peanut, treenut, dairy, soy, wheat, egg, pea and black bean allergies, my child NEVER gets to eat anything that is not made by me. Enter Mo'Pweeze bakery! After Ensuring the cupcakes would be safe with my boy's allergies, we headed out to the Westfield Farmer's Market to give them a shot! My son had his first cupcake for breakfast right there on the spot! These cupcakes are not only delicious, but they are safe for my son! I cry tears of joy every time I watch him enjoy a cupcake! Thank you from the bottom of my heart for making a safe and special treat for my baby!'

'i don't suffer from allergies but have many loved ones who do and these cupcakes are amazing. tried my first carrot mango from the mendham market yesterday and am addicted!! keep up the great work- you have a new family of fans in mendham and now we can provide desserts for everyone at our events!'

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have much time or money, your support really means a lot to me. Also you can:

  • Give a token donation to help keep our campaign buzz going
  • Please help get the word out! Share on Facebook, tell your friends, 
  • It's easy to share my campaign, just use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • If this project inspires you and you have ideas, please share them with us!

story:
Our business:

Hello, my name is Etienne Desnoyers and I am the owner of the Dumoine Valley Guides lodge  and I am here today seeking help in expanding my small business.  The Dumoine Valley Guides is what we call an outfitter; we provide lodging, meals, cottages, equipment and guiding services for people that wish to enjoy nature in our region.  We can help you with just about anything you want to do in our great wilderness.  Where are we located?  Our lodge is located on the island of Rapides des Joachims, in the province of Québec, Canada.  We are easily accessible as we less than 10 minutes from the Trans Canadian highway (2 hours from the city of Ottawa).  I live on location with my wife Kieran and my young baby boy,  Seth. 

This business was founded by my parents back in 1982 and has been operated by my father since.  Sadly in 2012 my father passed away and left the lodge to my sister and I.  I have since decided to take over the business; I left my job as an aircraft maintenance technician to work here full time in the village where I grew up. After three years I do not see myself do anything else now and I will continue to be here and take care of what my father has left me.  It’s a therapeutic place for me and helps me in my grief.  As for my sister she is a member of the Canadian forces and has for now established a life in Nova Scotia.

I am launching this campaign in the hopes that I can raise enough money to help develop my business.  Our lodge and cottages are constructed on an 8 acres property on the shores of the Ottawa River. This property has potential to become a fantastic place for people to vacation with their family and friends, our problem is that this property is cut in half by a steep hill and a dense forest that greatly limit access to the waterfront.

The project:

This money will be used for a few different things. Firstly, hire landscapers to excavate the hill in order to build a small road down to the river, the estimated price of this phase is $15 000.  The second stage will be to purchase and install a quality eco-friendly plastic dock system in our bay; this will allow our customer to take full advantage of the water access with rental fishing boats that people can take when they want, the cost of this dock system is $6 500. The last major step will be to make some space at the bottom of the hill (removal of some of the trees) to give space for people to play, camp or whatever they feel like doing. Hiring a professional logger and his equipment will account for the remaining $3 500.

Once a proper access is made we can then start developing, with nice areas for people to relax and play.  Our goal is not to pack our property with customer like sardines but to give people some room to move, creating a space that people can be themselves with their family and friends at an affordable price.

Why not get a bank loan?  This is a simple and obvious question, as a touristic business we do have a down season (fall and spring) where we do not see much in the way of customers and therefore income.  A bank loan can greatly reduce our chance of survival as payments have to be made even when you might not be able to afford it.  As the economy gets hard for some of us, vacations are the first thing people might sacrifice.  It can be a tough situation for business like me as debt is the number 1 killer for business like ours.

Our strategy:

Our strategy is a simple one: allow people to invest in our business giving them discounts worth many times their initial investment.  This will serve two goals; finance our projects without getting into heavy loans and create a customer base that will have a big incentive to return multiple times.

If we do not meet our goal we will finance other smaller projects that will need to be accomplished (updating our fishing boat fleet, renovations, etc.).  In the event that we are close to our goal, we will then try to find other source of funding (banks, government loans) to cover the difference.  On the other hand if we exceed this hefty goal we will perform the landscaping and the construction of the dock and do renovations of our installations and equipment.

All promised perks will stay the same (or get better) and be honoured.

The perks: 

The first perk is for the people that donate $10; we understand that some people might live too far to have a chance to visit us so this one is simply if you feel like giving us a hand.  So a nice shout out on our Facebook page will let everyone know that you’re pretty cool.

Second perk, $20 dollars will get the mentioned above FB shout out plus a nice homemade postal card with pictures of the local wildlife we have taken with our camera.

$50 is where things get interesting; this one will get you all of the above plus a 15% discount for all of our services.  So imagine you are looking at renting a cottage, maybe do some fishing, or some canoeing this coupon can potentially save you hundreds of dollars when you pay us a visit.

$150, you get a 10% life time discount card.  We will send you a nice plastic card that will allow you to get a 10% discount every time you visit us for life.

$200 gets you a 15% life time discount card when you visit us and enjoy what you helped us build.

Now for the big one; $500 gets you the Facebook thanks, the post card and a 25% lifetime discount (plastic card). This one is for the people that really love spending some time in nature.  With all of the great stuff to do on our beautiful island you will always have a place to stay at the most discounted price, with a potential to save you thousands of dollar for your entire lifetime.

The challenge:

This project has a few challenges.  We make a living by bringing people close to nature.  Without nature I don’t have much to offer my customers, this is why we have to be very careful with what we do with our environment.  We can’t just put an excavator on the property and tear it up; we have strict regulations to follow when it comes to tree removals and the type of plants we introduce. Soil retention is also very important, our cottages are on top of a very steep hill and if we do not approach the landscaping of that hill with care we could end up with the cottages at the bottom of the hill.  Local plant species will be used to preserve the soil.

We will not remove any trees near the shore to prevent erosion and follow local regulations.

I do know that this campaign is mostly directed to people that live within a certain distance from us as it might be hard for people from around the world to pay us a visit and take advantage of the bigger perks, the target audience can be quite small making this goal difficult to reach but with enough people sharing this campaign I guess you really don’t know what could happen.

Please check our website and see what we have to currently offer and do not hesitate to give us a call of send us an email if you have any questions about our business and this campaign.  Sharing this campaign is another way to help us in a big way.

Thank you.

-Etienne


P.S.

Once this campaign is complete we will be giving updates to our Facebook page and indiegogo page to show the progress of this project.

Once again, thank you.

story:
Save the Mansion!

@SyracuseHistory on Instagram is partnering with the George & Rebecca Barnes Foundation at 930 James Street in Syracuse, NY to help fund the foundations mission to preserve the Barnes-Hiscock Mansion.  George and Rebecca Barnes built this home in 1853.  Their home was a center of civic-minded activity in our community.  In honor of their leadership and commitment to the people of Central New York, the Foundation has been established in their names.

George and Rebecca Barnes were dedicated abolitionists and often placed themselves in danger to help a slave flee to safety.  The mansion played a key role in the abolitionist movement in Syracuse, and has been recongized as one of the stops along the Underground Railroad, Freedom Trail.  George and Rebecca held many meetings in the house and oral history supports that they hid slaves during their long journey north, often having them hide in the basement and carriage house until safe passage could be found.

_____________________________________________________________________________

A building of this size and of this age needs significant upkeep and last December, New York State granted the foundation a $300,000 grant from the state's Regional Economic Development Council initiative.  

The money will be used to completely restore the roof system and decorative elements of the Barnes Hiscock Mansion to allow for further interior and exterior restoration.

But first, the foundation must raise $100,000 in the next year and a half, in order to receive the grant.  This is where you come in!  The George and Rebecca Barnes Foundation along with the support of the Syracuse community must prove their commitment to preserving the historical home.  A donation of any kind, even time, can help.  So Syracuse, will you help save the mansion?

_____________________________________________________________________________

The Board of Directors at the Foundation has tirelessly shown their dedication to this home.  Even more, in August 2014, they demonstrated their continued commitment when they hired their first ever Executive Director, Kristin Earle, to help spearhead efforts to preserve the mansion, with hopes of one day opening it to the public as a museum.  Linked below is just some of their recent work that has received media attention.  We hope that you too will help #savethemansion with a donation today.

Gourmelt Cafe opening in 2015.
Dancing With Our Star's Benefit
Your Hometown
Flag Display
Lizzie Borden
Magical Christmas
Weddings

_____________________________________________________________________________

If you have any questions or want to learn more visit www.grbarnes.org, email info@grbarnes.org or call 315-422-2445.  Thank you for your support!

story:
WHO WE ARE

The idea of Nii Juinti came from shaman Roger Daniel Lopez Ramos with the purpose of serving and helping his community and people. It was born when the right team of people came together to help him realize his vision by creating a school.

Nii Juinti is a Non-Governmental, non-profit Organization, founded with the purpose of working with the Shipibo people to help develop and preserve their traditions for the coming generations in the Ucayali region, Perú.

The mission of the school “Nii Juinti” is to pass on the Shipibo ancestral culture to the new generations of Shipibo children in order to protect and deepen the old, precious ancestral knowledge of the Shipibo people. In this school, the children will live with their community's elders and shamans, from whom they will directly receive the ancient teachings of their culture.

Today Shipibo traditional knowledge is under threat as a result of the pressures of globalization and obstacles which restrict Shipibo children from accessing the valuable teachings of their elders. Nii Juinti  intends to offer support and alternatives that reduce the gradual loss of the valuable wisdom of Shipibo ancestral knowledge.


OUR GOAL

The objective of the school “Nii Juinti” is to provide a space for 20 Shipibo children to acquire the ancestral knowledge of the plants, with a focus on the conservation and use of medicinal plants. Nii Juinti will thus provide the cognitive and practical tools to train the future curanderos or shamans.

The activities of Nii Juinti are directed towards children with scarce resources, whose families are not able to fulfil their primary needs. Nii Juinti will provide housing, nourishment, clothing and education. In this way, children who live in difficult conditions and with very few possibilities to develop their potential, will have the opportunity to live in a protected environment in proximity to their families and to follow a path of personal and community growth.


SOME BACKGROUND INFO

The Shipibo people are an ancient indigenous people from the Amazon rainforest whose lands are located on the banks of the river Ucayali, in today's Peru. Their physical existence and culture is based on their harmonious interaction with nature. From the construction of houses, to the conservation of wildlife and biodiversity, the craft of embroidery and the healing properties of medicinal plants - their culture has flourished thanks to the traditional knowledge passed on from generation to generation.

The Nii Juinti initiative arises from the need to give more relevance to the rural context in which the descendants of the Shipibo people have their roots. Every year, and with increasing frequency, many young people choose to leave their traditions behind and migrate towards bigger cities such as the capital Lima, thereby endangering the precious traditions, knowledge and wisdom of their Shipibo culture. This phenomenon of loss and migration feeds the process of urbanization and undermines the formation of “grassroots” development.

The conservation of the cultural heritage of the Shipibo people is important not only to their identity, but also to the world at large. More and more people around the Western world are interested in alternative healing methods and in undertaking a path of inner healing through the use of the so-called “master plants”. Nii Juinti will thus also provide a bridge to connect Shipibo culture, including the use of medicinal plants, with the broader Western world. Nii Juinti will serve to enhance human consciousness regarding spiritual balance and environmental stewardship by preserving and deepening Shipibo culture.


THE SCHOOL

 

 


The project is in San Francisco de Yarinacocha, in the Ucayali region, in the central Peruvian forest, inhabited by a community of the Shipibo people.

The school complex is situated on 4 hectares of land. The school complex has two dormitories at its disposal, one for boys and one for girls, that can accommodate up to forty children, three living quarters for the teachers, a common room where lessons will be conducted and a dining hall.

Core teachings:

The core of the teaching program will concern the cultivation and use of medicinal and master plants. The ancient methods of plant medicine preparation and their use in its various applications will be passed on to the children. Furthermore, the relationship with the shaman will help the children to reconnect with nature and with the spirit of the plants, letting them participate in the sacred ceremonies and teaching them the sacred chants (icaros).

Secondary teachings:

- The Art of Embroidery

- The Construction of Canoes and Oars

- The Craftsmanship of Wood

- The Craftsmanship of Traditional Clothes for Ceremonies

- Traditional Cooking

- Traditional Festive Songs

- Cultivation and Growing techniques (the teaching of the techniques of plant cultivation and their use, also includes the reforestation and the safeguard of vegetable species at risk of extinction).

- Traditional Hunting and Fishing practice.

The Nii Juinti project is not intended to replace public schooling. As the lessons will take place in the afternoon, the children will continue to go to the public school in the morning and follow the standard Peruvian teaching programs.


Please find more info about us on:

To find out more please visit our website and Facebook page:

www.niijuinti.org.

https://www.facebook.com/niijuinti

It is possible to see the project and the realization of the school by visiting these links:

http://niijuinti.org/nuestracasa/

https://www.flickr.com/photos/114516347@N06/


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

This fundraising will allow us to start the school's activity August 2015. In 2016/2017 we will continue fundraising by developing new partnerships both with private donors and businesses and governmental agencies.

The building of the school was completed in San Francisco de Yarinacocha in January 2015. We are now raising much needed funds to provide food, clothing, study materials, and other expenses including shamans and teachers salaries and the maintenance of the school itself.


WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL BE USED FOR

Thanks to the generous donations we have received, so far we've gathered $49.000 USD and in order to accomodate 10 children for one school year and allow the school to get up and running we need to raise a further $45.000 USD. 

However it is our dream to not just open the school scraping by with the minimum funds and children that are needed, but we hope to meet our original vision of being able to house and educate 20 children. This means raising $75.000 USD.

To double the intake of children in the first year, we only need to increase our annual costs by 32%.

Financial projections for 10 children:

Financial projections for 20 children:

Exchange Rate : $1 USD = 3 Peruvian Soles  

*Consider 3 daily meals for 10/25 people. Cost per meal of  $3,3 USD aprox. 

** Electric energy used to light the facilities of the school at night, fuel for generators, gas for the kitchen, etc.  

***General Expenses: clothes and toiletries for the children, etc.  

****Kitchen Expenses: detergents, ice for refrigeration, ordinary kitchen supplies.

***** Costs related to our administration office in Pucallpa: accountants’ salaries, telephone bills and internet, etc.    

                                   

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Help us spread the word:

·  Share the campaign on your Facebook/Tweeter/Instagram profile and invite your friends to support.

· Share the Nii Juinti trailer video with your friends on any social network.(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4tKyAHHs3SE&spfreload=10)

· Share the photo below as your Facebook cover photo:

·  Send your friends an email making them aware of the campaign.

·  Embed the link of the campaign on your website or blog.

·  Follow us here and on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/niijuinti

·  Visit http://niijuinti.org/como-ayudar/ and become a collaborator or sponsor of a child.

· Many of our friends and supporters organise little fundraising events all over the world. All these events will be posted on our Facebook page and Indiegogo profile so that everyone sees that we really put all our efforts into this campaign. 


PERKS

5$: Nihue - Wind Energy 

Thank you! You'll receive a message from the shaman Roger Lopez.

10$: Oshe - Moon

Thank you message + digital Postcard of the children of Nii Juinti.

25$: Jene - Water

Thank you message + digital postcard + audio files of Icaros (sacred Shipibo chants) sung by the shaman.

50$: Bari - Sun

Thank you message + postcard + audio files + Shipibo patch hand embroidered by the Shipibo women of San Francisco de Yarinacocha.

        

Shipibo embroidery handmade by the women of San Francisco de Yarinacocha.

100$: Chi - Fire

Thank you message + postcard + audio files + Shipibo patch hand embroidered by the Shipibo women of San Francisco de Yarinacocha + trimestral report.

300$: Wishtin - Star

Thank you message + audio files + trimestral report + hand embroidered Shipibo bag.


Donations from $600 USD upwards, will include discounts or free accommodation at Ani Nii Shobo Natural Reserve and Lodge Resort which is beside the Nii Juinti School. 

By coming here the donors will have the chance to get to know the children, the shamans and the Shipibo community through direct interaction.

The Nii Juinti School is supported by Ani Nii Shobo Natural Reserve and Lodge Resort founded by Roger Lopez (president of Nii Juinti ) Andres Selamè (Nii Juinti founder) and Santiago Correa Pereira (Nii Juinti founder). For the past 6 years, thanks to the collaboration with the nearby Shipibo community of San Francisco de Yarinacocha, Ani Nii Shobo (Great House of the Forest in Shipibo) has been working with medical plants developing a profound knowledge of their use and preserving endangered and ancient flora through its cultivation. Here it is possible to go through a deep and personal healing journey through the use some of these plants and the participation in ritual ceremonies.

To know more about Ani Nii Shobo visit www.aniniishobo.org or www.facebook.com/AniNiiShobo or watch the video below:



600$: Mai - Earth

Audio files + trimestral report + medium hand embroidered Shipibo decorative cloth + 10% off at Ani Nii Shobo Lodge Resort.

1000$: Noma - Woman

Audio files + trimestral report  + large hand embroidered Shipibo decorative cloth.

1000$: Bake - Child

Audio files + trimestral report  + medium hand embroidered Shipibo decorative cloth + 25% off at Ani Nii Shobo Lodge Resort.

2500$: Otorongo - Jaguar of the Jungle

Audio files + trimestral report + large hand embroidered Shipibo decorative cloth + 50% off at Ani Nii Shobo Lodge Resort.

5000$: Suipino - Hummingbird of the Forest

Audio files + trimestral report + large hand embroidered Shipibo decorative cloth + 15 days free accommodation at Ani Nii Shobo Lodge Resort for one person (1500$ value).

10000$: Ronin - Anaconda of the Life Force

Audio files + trimestral report + large hand embroidered Shipibo decorative cloth + 15 days free accommodation at Ani Nii Shobo Lodge Resort for two people (3000$ value).


Thank you for your support!

story:
My name is Adriano. I live and work in Rome, the Eternal City. After a few years as a student and researcher in humanities, I entered the hospitality industry where I have worked for 15 years. I started as a receptionist and gradually worked my way up professionally, until I became the manager of an average-sized hotel. Throughout the years I developed a great passion for this role and decided to make it my life's work. I really like taking care of my guests and allowing them to enjoy the extraordinary beauty of my city.

Mi chiamo Adriano e vivo e lavoro a Roma, la città eterna. Dopo alcuni anni spesi come studente e ricercatore in materie umanistiche, sono entrato a far parte nell’industria alberghiera, nella quale ho lavorato per 15 anni. Ho iniziato come addetto al ricevimento e, gradualmente, sono cresciuto professionalmente, fino a diventare il direttore di un albergo di medie dimensioni. Lungo gli anni ho sviluppato una grande passione per questo lavoro e ho deciso di farne il lavoro della mia vita. Amo davvero prendermi cura dei miei ospiti e permettere loro di  godere  la straordinaria bellezza della mia città.



Three years ago, my beloved wife and I were blessed with the birth of our only son, Alberto. Unfortunately, a few months before his birth, we discovered that our son would be affected by an extremely rare genetic disease known as Phelan-McDermid Syndrome.  Phelan-McDermid Syndrome (PMS) is typically caused by deletion, or loss, of the terminal segment of the long arm of chromosome 22.  

Tre anni fa, mia moglie ed io siamo stati benedetti dalla nascita del nostro unico figlio, Alberto. Sfortunatamente, alcuni mesi prima della sua nascita, abbiamo scoperto che questi sarebbe stato affetto da una malattia genetica estremamente rara nota con il nome di Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid (SPM). Questa sindrome è generalmente causata dalla perdita o delezione della parte terminale del braccio lungo del cromosoma 22.



There is a wide range of severity of symptoms observed in people with Phelan-McDermid Syndrome. Like other autism-related syndromes, PMS is associated with intellectual disabilities, sleep disorders and seizures. Most children with PMS have moderate to severe delays and often do not develop functional language. Infants with medium to large chromosomal deletions may have very low muscle tone, poor motor control, and problems with eating and sleeping. Other symptoms may include poor thermoregulation and dysplastic finger nails or toenails. Behavioural issues may stem from autism (e.g., repetitive behaviors), from poor communications skills, or unknown origin.

For more information about Phelan-McDermid Syndrome, you can click here.


C’è un’ampia gamma di sintomi osservati dalle persone affette dalla Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid. Come nelle altre sindromi a carattere autistico, la SPM è associata a disabilità intellettive, disturbi del sonno e convulsioni. Molti bambini con SPM hanno un ritardo nello sviluppo del linguaggio spesso con la totale assenza del medesimo. I bambini caratterizzati da una delezione cromosomica media o grande possono soffrire di ipotonia muscolare, scarso controllo motorio e problemi legati alla nutrizione ed al sonno. Tra gli altri sintomi si annoverano una scarsa termoregolazione e la displassia delle unghie delle mani e dei piedi.

Per maggiori informazioni sulla Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid, potete cliccare qui.


Our son would be affected by severe intellectual disabilities and a wide range of physical problems. I knew that we would need all diligence and all our time in order to help our son fight against his disabilities. Specialists said that Alberto would need more than 4 hours per day of rehabilitative treatment. At that time, as a hotel manager, I used to work ten hours per day, seven days per week. I could not keep that kind of job and give our son the attention he needed.

I decided to resign, take out a bank loan and open a little B&B, so that I could continue to work in the industry I love, but with more flexibility, and use all my spare time to care for my son. Business got off to a good start and it continues to thrive. My B&B is in the Testaccio area, almost in the very centre of Rome. This area offers the best transport links in the city and has the largest concentration of restaurants, cafés, pubs and nightclubs.


Nostro figlio sarebbe stato affetto da gravi disabilità intellettive e da un’ampia gamma di problemi fisici. Sapevo che avremmo avuto bisogno di tutto il nostro impegno e di tutto il nostro tempo al fine di poter aiutare nostro figlio a combattere contro le sue disabilità. Gli specialisti ci informarono che Alberto avrebbe avuto bisogno di più di 4 ore al giorno di attività riabilitativa. Al quel tempo, come direttore di un hotel, lavoravo dieci ore al giorno, sette giorni su sette. Non potevo continuare a svolgere quel tipo di occupazione e dedicare a mio figlio le attenzioni di cui necessitava.

Decisi quindi di rassegnare le dimissioni, prendere un prestito in banca e aprire un piccolo B&B, così da poter continuare svolgere il lavoro che amo, ma con una maggiore flessibilità, e usare il tempo libero per prendermi cura di mio figlio. Gli affari ebbero un ottimo avvio e continuano ad andare bene. Il mio B&B si trova nella zona di Testaccio, praticamente al centro della città. Quest’area offre le migliori connessioni con il resto della città e la maggiore concentrazione di ristoranti, bar, pub e discoteche.


However the fact remains, due to the recession that continues in Italy and the ever- increasing medical expenses for Alberto's treatment, at the moment what I earn from the B&B does not suffice to cover all my expenses and the installments of my loan.

The only way to avoid bankruptcy is to expand my business, so that I may increase my profits and be able to cover all my expenses.  But I am already too indebted with the banks and have no guarantees to offer against another loan. This is why I have decided to launch this campaign. I need $ 35,000.00 in order to complete my project, keep my business up and running and offer my son the best assistance. 


Nonostante questo, in ragione della perdurante crisi economica in Italia e le sempre più elevate spese mediche di Alberto, al momento quello che guadagno grazie al B&B non basta a coprire tutte le mie spese e le rate del mio finanziamento.

L’unico modo che ho di evitare la bancarotta è espandere la mia attività, in modo da poter incrementare i miei profitti ed essere in grado di coprire tutte le mie spese. Ma sono già fin troppo indebitato con le banche e non ho nessuna garanzia da offrire per un nuovo prestito. Ecco la ragione per cui ho deciso di lanciare questa campagna. Ho bisogno di $ 35.000,00 al fine di portare a termine il mio progetto, rimanere in affari ed offrire a mio figlio la migliore assistenza.


If I achieve my goal, I will donate 10% of the collected net amount to AISPHEM (Associazione Italiana Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid), and I will also give them 15% of the profit from my extended B&B every year, starting from next year.

If I collect less than $ 20,000.00, I will use that amount to repay part of my existing loan, in order to reduce my monthly expenses and keep my B&B up and running. In any case, I will be able to reward you with all the perks on offer on this campaign. 

If I overachieve my goal, I will donate 20% of the surplus to Aisphem.


Qualora dovessi raggiungere il mio obiettivo, verserei il 10% di quanto da me raccolto all’AISPHEM (Associazione Italiana Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid), e verserei a favore della medesima, ogni anno, il 15% dei profitti della mia attività, a partire dal prossimo anno.

Qualora dovessi raccogliere meno di $ 20.000,00, userei quanto ottenuto per ripagare una parte del mio prestito, in modo da ridurre le mie spese mensili e cercare di tenere in piedi il mio B&B. In ogni caso, sarò comunque in grado di ricompensare coloro che avranno contribuito con gli incentivi offerti in questa campagna.

Qualora dovessi superare il mio obbiettivo, donerei il 20% del surplus ad Aisphem.


And now on to the perks:

If you donate $ 10.00, I will send you a personalized thank-you e-mail.

If you donate $ 30.00, you will receive a copy of my booklet Adriano’s quick guide to Rome, a 60-page guide to what to see & do and where to eat in the Eternal City, written by someone who knows what you really need and what you should look for as a visitor to Rome.

If you donate $ 60.00, you will receive a voucher valid for one night in a double room, breakfast included, that you will be able to use (upon reservation) within 12 months of the end of this campaign. 

If you donate $ 280.00, you will receive a voucher valid for four nights (upon reservation) in a double room, breakfast included, plus free transfers to and from the Airport/Train Station, that you will be able to use within 12 months of the end of this campaign. 

If you donate $ 450.00, you will receive a voucher valid for four nights (upon reservation) in a double room, breakfast included, plus free transfers to and from the Airport/Train Station and four dinners (beverages excluded) for two people in four traditional restaurants in the Testaccio area. You will be able to use this voucher within 12 months of the end of this campaign.

If you donate $ 650.00, you will receive a voucher valid for five nights (upon reservation) in a double room, breakfast included, free transfers to and from the Airport/Train Station, five dinners (beverages excluded) for two people in five traditional restaurants in theTestaccio area and a city tour for two people. You will be able to use this voucher within 12 months of the end of this campaign.


Ed ora veniamo ai suddetti incentivi:

Donando $ 10,00, potrete ricevere un’e-mail di ringraziamento personalizzata.

Donando $ 30,00, potrete ricevere una copia della mia Guida facile a Roma, una guida di 60 pagine a cosa vedere, cosa fare e dove mangiare nella Città Eterna, scritta da una persona che cosa realmente ha bisogno chi visita Roma.

Donando $ 60,00, riceverete un voucher valido per una notte in camera doppia, colazione inclusa, che potreste utilizzare (previa prenotazione) entro 12 mesi dalla fine di questa campagna.

Donando $ 280,00, riceverete un voucher valido per quattro notti (previa prenotazione) in camera doppia, colazione inclusa, più trasferimento per e da Stazione/Aeroporto, che potreste utilizzare entro 12 mesi dalla fine di questa campagna.

Donando $ 450,00, riceverete un voucher valido per quattro notti (previa prenotazione) in camera doppia, colazione inclusa, più trasferimento per e da Stazione/Aeroporto, e quattro cene (bevande escluse) per due persone in quattro ristoranti tradizionali nella zona di Testaccio, che potreste utilizzare entro 12 mesi dalla fine di questa campagna.

Donando $ 650,00, riceverete un voucher valido per cinque notti (previa prenotazione) in camera doppia, colazione inclusa, più trasferimento per e da Stazione/Aeroporto, cinque cene (bevande escluse) per due persone in quattro ristoranti tradizionali nella zona di Testaccio ed un tour della città per due persone, che potreste utilizzare entro 12 mesi dalla fine di questa campagna.



If you cannot contribute, please share this campaign.
