My name is Adriano. I live and work in Rome, the Eternal City. After a few years as a student and researcher in humanities, I entered the hospitality industry where I have worked for 15 years. I started as a receptionist and gradually worked my way up professionally, until I became the manager of an average-sized hotel. Throughout the years I developed a great passion for this role and decided to make it my life's work. I really like taking care of my guests and allowing them to enjoy the extraordinary beauty of my city.Mi chiamo Adriano e vivo e lavoro a Roma, la città eterna.
Dopo alcuni anni spesi come studente e ricercatore in materie umanistiche, sono
entrato a far parte nell’industria alberghiera, nella quale ho lavorato per 15
anni. Ho iniziato come addetto al ricevimento e, gradualmente, sono cresciuto
professionalmente, fino a diventare il direttore di un albergo di medie
dimensioni. Lungo gli anni ho sviluppato una grande passione per questo lavoro
e ho deciso di farne il lavoro della mia vita. Amo davvero prendermi cura dei
miei ospiti e permettere loro di 
godere  la straordinaria bellezza
della mia città.

Three years ago, my beloved wife and I were blessed with the birth of our only son, Alberto. Unfortunately, a few months before his birth, we discovered that our son would be affected by an extremely rare genetic disease known as Phelan-McDermid Syndrome.  Phelan-McDermid Syndrome (PMS) is typically caused by deletion, or loss, of the terminal segment of the long arm of chromosome 22.  Tre anni fa, mia moglie ed io siamo stati benedetti dalla
nascita del nostro unico figlio, Alberto. Sfortunatamente, alcuni mesi prima
della sua nascita, abbiamo scoperto che questi sarebbe stato affetto da una
malattia genetica estremamente rara nota con il nome di Sindrome di
Phelan-McDermid (SPM). Questa sindrome è generalmente causata dalla perdita o
delezione della parte terminale del braccio lungo del cromosoma 22.There is a wide range of severity of symptoms observed in people with Phelan-McDermid Syndrome. Like other autism-related syndromes, PMS is associated with intellectual disabilities, sleep disorders and seizures. Most children with PMS have moderate to severe delays and often do not develop functional language. Infants with medium to large chromosomal deletions may have very low muscle tone, poor motor control, and problems with eating and sleeping. Other symptoms may include poor thermoregulation and dysplastic finger nails or toenails. Behavioural issues may stem from autism (e.g., repetitive behaviors), from poor communications skills, or unknown origin.For more information about Phelan-McDermid Syndrome, you can click here.C’è un’ampia gamma di sintomi osservati dalle persone
affette dalla Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid. Come nelle altre sindromi a
carattere autistico, la SPM è associata a disabilità intellettive, disturbi del
sonno e convulsioni. Molti bambini con SPM hanno un ritardo nello sviluppo del
linguaggio spesso con la totale assenza del medesimo. I bambini caratterizzati
da una delezione cromosomica media o grande possono soffrire di ipotonia
muscolare, scarso controllo motorio e problemi legati alla nutrizione ed al
sonno. Tra gli altri sintomi si annoverano una scarsa termoregolazione e la
displassia delle unghie delle mani e dei piedi.
Per maggiori informazioni sulla Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid,
potete cliccare qui.Our son would be affected by severe intellectual disabilities and a wide range of physical problems. I knew that we would need all diligence and all our time in order to help our son fight against his disabilities. Specialists said that Alberto would need more than 4 hours per day of rehabilitative treatment. At that time, as a hotel manager, I used to work ten hours per day, seven days per week. I could not keep that kind of job and give our son the attention he needed.I decided to resign, take out a bank loan and open a little B&B, so that I could continue to work in the industry I love, but with more flexibility, and use all my spare time to care for my son. Business got off to a good start and it continues to thrive. My B&B is in the Testaccio area, almost in the very centre of Rome. This area offers the best transport links in the city and has the largest concentration of restaurants, cafés, pubs and nightclubs.Nostro figlio sarebbe stato affetto da gravi disabilità
intellettive e da un’ampia gamma di problemi fisici. Sapevo che avremmo avuto
bisogno di tutto il nostro impegno e di tutto il nostro tempo al fine di poter
aiutare nostro figlio a combattere contro le sue disabilità. Gli specialisti ci
informarono che Alberto avrebbe avuto bisogno di più di 4 ore al giorno di
attività riabilitativa. Al quel tempo, come direttore di un hotel, lavoravo
dieci ore al giorno, sette giorni su sette. Non potevo continuare a svolgere
quel tipo di occupazione e dedicare a mio figlio le attenzioni di cui necessitava.
Decisi quindi di rassegnare le dimissioni, prendere un
prestito in banca e aprire un piccolo B&B, così da poter continuare
svolgere il lavoro che amo, ma con una maggiore flessibilità, e usare il tempo
libero per prendermi cura di mio figlio. Gli affari ebbero un ottimo avvio e
continuano ad andare bene. Il mio B&B si trova nella zona di Testaccio,
praticamente al centro della città. Quest’area offre le migliori connessioni
con il resto della città e la maggiore concentrazione di ristoranti, bar, pub e
discoteche.However the fact remains, due to the recession that continues in Italy and the ever- increasing medical expenses for Alberto's treatment, at the moment what I earn from the B&B does not suffice to cover all my expenses and the installments of my loan.The only way to avoid bankruptcy is to expand my business, so that I may increase my profits and be able to cover all my expenses.  But I am already too indebted with the banks and have no guarantees to offer against another loan. This is why I have decided to launch this campaign. I need $ 35,000.00 in order to complete my project, keep my business up and running and offer my son the best assistance. Nonostante questo, in ragione della perdurante crisi
economica in Italia e le sempre più elevate spese mediche di Alberto, al
momento quello che guadagno grazie al B&B non basta a coprire tutte le mie
spese e le rate del mio finanziamento.
L’unico modo che ho di evitare la bancarotta è espandere la
mia attività, in modo da poter incrementare i miei profitti ed essere in grado
di coprire tutte le mie spese. Ma sono già fin troppo indebitato con le banche
e non ho nessuna garanzia da offrire per un nuovo prestito. Ecco la ragione per
cui ho deciso di lanciare questa campagna. Ho bisogno di $ 35.000,00 al fine
di portare a termine il mio progetto, rimanere in affari ed offrire a mio
figlio la migliore assistenza.If I achieve my goal, I will donate 10% of the collected net amount to AISPHEM (Associazione Italiana Sindrome di Phelan-McDermid), and I will also give them 15% of the profit from my extended B&B every year, starting from next year.If I collect less than $ 20,000.00, I will use that amount to repay part of my existing loan, in order to reduce my monthly expenses and keep my B&B up and running. In any case, I will be able to reward you with all the perks on offer on this campaign. If I overachieve my goal, I will donate 20% of the surplus to Aisphem.Qualora dovessi raggiungere il mio obiettivo, verserei il

Phelan-McDermid), e verserei a favore della medesima, ogni anno, il 15% dei
profitti della mia attività, a partire dal prossimo anno.
Qualora dovessi raccogliere meno di $ 20.000,00, userei
quanto ottenuto per ripagare una parte del mio prestito, in modo da ridurre le
mie spese mensili e cercare di tenere in piedi il mio B&B. In ogni caso,
sarò comunque in grado di ricompensare coloro che avranno contribuito con gli
incentivi offerti in questa campagna.Qualora dovessi superare il mio obbiettivo, donerei il 20% del surplus ad Aisphem.And now on to the perks:If you donate $ 10.00, I will send you a personalized thank-you e-mail.If you donate $ 30.00, you will receive a copy of my booklet Adriano’s quick guide to Rome, a 60-page guide to what to see & do and where to eat in the Eternal City, written by someone who knows what you really need and what you should look for as a visitor to Rome.If you donate $ 60.00, you will receive a voucher valid for one night in a double room, breakfast included, that you will be able to use (upon reservation) within 12 months of the end of this campaign. If you donate $ 280.00, you will receive a voucher valid for four nights (upon reservation) in a double room, breakfast included, plus free transfers to and from the Airport/Train Station, that you will be able to use within 12 months of the end of this campaign. If you donate $ 450.00, you will receive a voucher valid for four nights (upon reservation) in a double room, breakfast included, plus free transfers to and from the Airport/Train Station and four dinners (beverages excluded) for two people in four traditional restaurants in the Testaccio area. You will be able to use this voucher within 12 months of the end of this campaign.If you donate $ 650.00, you will receive a voucher valid for five nights (upon reservation) in a double room, breakfast included, free transfers to and from the Airport/Train Station, five dinners (beverages excluded) for two people in five traditional restaurants in theTestaccio area and a city tour for two people. You will be able to use this voucher within 12 months of the end of this campaign.Ed ora veniamo ai suddetti incentivi:

story:
Our Story

Aurora Rise is a 501(c)(3) non-profit founded to provide direct support to those people affected by the Dark Knight Rises Aurora theater shooting on July 20, 2012 and to ensure that those we lost will never be forgotten.  

Aurora Rise has seen the power of superheroes up close as we have worked with comic creators, publishers, writers, artists, and cosplayers to bring the Aurora community together. In the immediate aftermath of the shooting, many people in the comic book industry reached out to local comic book store, All C's Collectibles, to see how they could help. Aurora Rise's first fundraiser in August of 2012 brought together comic book artists for a signing event and a live auction with thousands of donations, many from the comic book industry. 

We have continued to use superheroes to inspire the community through our fundraisers and events. We have worked with dozens of artists who donate comic book sketch covers for us to compile into compilations sketch books, the profits from which go to support our mission.

With your help, Aurora Rise is looking to expand with our next project. We want to work with artists to create a compilation coffee table style art and scrap book that tells the story of Aurora Rise and the people we have been working with, while compiling amazing superhero art work. We will use the funds raised from selling the book and excess funding to expand our own programming to include memorial scholarships and more.

What We Need & What You'll Get

Aurora Rise is looking to raise $10,000 in order to compile, publish, and print a hardcover coffee table art book. Aurora Rise will sell the art book in order to raise funds to continue providing direct support to those people affected by the Aurora theater shooting who still need it and to help start our memorial scholarship program. For this fundraiser, we have set up some special perks for donors and checkpoints of what we will do with any funds raised in excess to our fundraising goal.

  • Funding Checkpoints:

    $10,000 - Print Hardcover Sketch Book
    -At $10,000 we will be able to compile and publish a full length color coffee table art book that will tell the story of Aurora Rise and some of the people we have worked with. The book will be a compilation of stories, a scrapbook of our early photos from events, and the majority of the book will be dedicated to superhero artwork donated to Aurora Rise. The funds raised from selling the book will go to help start the first Aurora Rise memorial scholarship and help the victims of the Aurora theater shooting.

    $15,000 - Commission Sketches for Book
    -At $15,000 we will be able to compile and publish the full length coffee table book and have funds to commission a few really big name comic artists. While most of the Aurora Rise sketches are donated, the extra funding would allow us to work with some professional artists to do a quality piece instead of a rushed free sketch.

    $35,000 - Purchase a handicap van for Aurora Rise
    -Aurora Rise works directly with some victims who were disabled in the theater shooting. We try to bring these people out for events, such as Comic Con. However, we have no reliable way of transporting them and using accessible cab services hasn't always worked. We would use the extra funding to purchase a handicap accessible van to provide a stable source of transportation for the people we help who need it most.

    $45,000 - Establish 2nd Memorial Scholarship
    -One of our main missions is to ensure that those people we lost in the theater will never be forgotten. Aurora Rise will establish our first memorial scholarship this year. If we can raise this much money, it will allow Aurora Rise to establish a second memorial scholarship and ensure that we can continue that scholarship for at least five years.

    $50,000 - Bring Artists/Writers to Annual Auction
    -If we raise up to the $50,000 dollar mark, we would like to use some of it to help bring out some of the bigger writers and artists who have worked with us to our annual auction. Having artists and writers doing signings at our auctions in the past has help vastly improve the turnout and ensure more money is raised at the auction overall.

    $60,000 - Establish 3rd Memorial Scholarship
    -One of our main missions is to ensure that those people we lost in the theater will never be forgotten. Aurora Rise will establish our first memorial scholarship this year. If we can raise this much money, it will allow Aurora Rise to establish a third memorial scholarship and ensure that we can continue that scholarship for at least five years.

    $75,000 - Establish Aurora Rise Community Memorial
    - This is one of our most ambitious checkpoints. If we can raise the extra funding, Aurora Rise would like to establish a permanent community memorial honoring the people we lost in the theater. However, Aurora Rise would like to commission an artist to sculpt a superhero themed memorial to be put up somewhere near the theater to show that their are heroes looking after our community and watching over our fallen.

    $85,000 - Establish 4th Memorial Scholarship
    -One of our main missions is to ensure that those people we lost in the theater will never be forgotten. Aurora Rise will establish our first memorial scholarship this year. If we can raise this much money, it will allow Aurora Rise to establish a fourth memorial scholarship and ensure that we can continue that scholarship for at least five years.

    $100,000 - Sustain AR Scholarships for Five Years
    -This is the big one! If we can raise $100,000 we will have enough to sustain the Aurora Rise scholarship programs with five memorial scholarships (maybe more) for at least five years. This would allow Aurora Rise to expand our operations and allow us the most capability to help our applicants.

  • Perks - for each donor level, Aurora Rise has some special perks to thank you for supporting our fundraiser.

    $5 - Recieve an Email Thank You card expressing our deepest gratitude for helping with this project.

    $10 - Recieve an Email Thank You and have your name posted on our donor list that will be posted on our website.

    $20 - Thank you and we will ship you an Aurora Rise support bracelet.

    $30 - Thank you and we will ship you one of our Aurora Rise Sketch Books and a Aurora Rise support bracelet.

    $40 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book, eBook/PDF edition. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet.

    $50 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book, a $70 (or more) value. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet.

    $75 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and an Aurora Rise shirt. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet. 

    $100 - (LIMIT: 100) You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book, with a handful of artist signatures. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet. (Note - We don't know what artists we will get to sign the book, yet.)

    $150 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and an exclusive poster print made just for this event. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, shirt, and bracelet. 

    $200 - (LIMIT: 25) You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and one of the original sketch book covers donated to Aurora Rise. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, shirt, poster, and bracelet. (Original cover will be a cover either featured in this book or one of our past sketch books.) 

    $250 - (LIMIT: 10) You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and a commissioned drawing from an artist in the book. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, shirt, poster, and bracelet. (There is no selecting what artist does the commission. We will take commission details and work with what artists are available at the time.)

    $500 - You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. Also, receive an Aurora Rise gift basket, including: physical Thank You card, a shirt, bracelet, a poster, a copy of each of our sketch books, a bumper sticker, a key chain, and other goodies.

    $750 - Artist Sponsor - You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. You will also work with the Aurora Rise team to choose an artist sketch you want to see featured in the book. Your name will appear under that sketch cover with a "Artist Sponsor" credit. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.

    $1,000 - (LIMIT: 10) You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. Aurora Rise will work with as many artists as we can to get the book signed by as close to all of them as possible. We can't promise everyone will sign it, but we will try. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket. (Note: This version of the book will take longer to ship as we have to collect signatures.)

    $1,500 - (LIMIT: 20) You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. Work with the Aurora Rise team to commission one of the sketch covers that will be featured in the book; we will then send you the original sketch cover. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.

    $3,000 - You will receive a special memorial edition of the book and have your name listed in the book. The memorial edition will have a different cover and a special introductory. Aurora Rise will work with as many artists as we can to get the book signed by as close to all of them as possible. We can't promise everyone will sign it, but we will try. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket. (Note: This version of the book will take longer to ship as we have to collect signatures.)

    $5,000 -  You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book.  Aurora Rise will also fly you out and get your a hotel room and tickets for Rocky Mountain Con, a convention in Denver, CO founded to help support Aurora Rise. You will also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.

    $7,500 - You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book.  Aurora Rise will also fly you out and get your a hotel room and tickets for Denver Comic Con (2016), one of the nations biggest and best Comic Cons. You will also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.

    $10,000 - You will receive a copy of the memorial edition of the book and have your name listed in the book and receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket. However, for your extraordinary donation Aurora Rise will give you the naming rights to one of our scholarships, within reason.

  • If Aurora Rise does not reach our fundraising goal of $10,000 for the book, we will use the funds raised to continue supporting our mission of directly helping those people affected by the Aurora theater shooting.

The Impact

Aurora Rise works directly with the victims, survivors, and people affected by the Aurora theater shooting. With the trial now going on, many people are finding themselves once again in need of support. We have helped our applicants in many ways. For example, many people took off work or lost their jobs due to the shooting. After a year or two living on savings, these families are now left without jobs and at risk of losing their homes, all because they never got things back on track from the shooting. We work with people in these types of situations to help them make bills, help with transportation so they can get back to work, and in general doing anything we can to make their lives a little better. Many people are taking time off for the trial and finding it much hard to cope with the proceedings than they expected. Aurora Rise is ready to help everyone we can through this tough time every step of the way.

The other part of the Aurora Rise mission is to support the Aurora Community and make sure those lives lost in the theater will never be forgotten. To this end, we have established the Aurora Rise Scholarship Program which will offer scholarships to local students.

From the beginning, Aurora Rise has been supported by the comic book industry. We were all very shaken to see such a tragic event happen during a Batman movie. The comic community immediately sought to help anyway that they could. With their help, we have been able to keep Aurora Rise going for three years. Aurora Rise believe that superheroes are an important factor in how we work with the community; we do everything from our sketch books to movie showings and working with local cosplayers. Aurora Rise wants everyone in the community of Aurora, the comic community, and everyone who has supported us that you are our heroes.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can volunteer to help Aurora Rise on our website at AuroraRise.org/volunteer.

Artists, if you would like to donate a sketch book cover or piece of artwork to Aurora Rise, contact us via our website volunteer form.
story_txt:
Our Story Aurora Rise is a 501(c)(3) non-profit founded to provide direct support to those people affected by the Dark Knight Rises Aurora theater shooting on July 20, 2012 and to ensure that those we lost will never be forgotten.  
Aurora Rise has seen the power of superheroes up close as we have worked with comic creators, publishers, writers, artists, and cosplayers to bring the Aurora community together. In the immediate aftermath of the shooting, many people in the comic book industry reached out to local comic book store, All C's Collectibles, to see how they could help. Aurora Rise's first fundraiser in August of 2012 brought together comic book artists for a signing event and a live auction with thousands of donations, many from the comic book industry. 
We have continued to use superheroes to inspire the community through our fundraisers and events. We have worked with dozens of artists who donate comic book sketch covers for us to compile into compilations sketch books, the profits from which go to support our mission.
With your help, Aurora Rise is looking to expand with our next project. We want to work with artists to create a compilation coffee table style art and scrap book that tells the story of Aurora Rise and the people we have been working with, while compiling amazing superhero art work. We will use the funds raised from selling the book and excess funding to expand our own programming to include memorial scholarships and more.   What We Need & What You'll Get Aurora Rise is looking to raise $10,000 in order to compile, publish, and print a hardcover coffee table art book. Aurora Rise will sell the art book in order to raise funds to continue providing direct support to those people affected by the Aurora theater shooting who still need it and to help start our memorial scholarship program. For this fundraiser, we have set up some special perks for donors and checkpoints of what we will do with any funds raised in excess to our fundraising goal.  Funding Checkpoints:$10,000 - Print Hardcover Sketch Book-At $10,000 we will be able to compile and publish a full length color coffee table art book that will tell the story of Aurora Rise and some of the people we have worked with. The book will be a compilation of stories, a scrapbook of our early photos from events, and the majority of the book will be dedicated to superhero artwork donated to Aurora Rise. The funds raised from selling the book will go to help start the first Aurora Rise memorial scholarship and help the victims of the Aurora theater shooting.
$15,000 - Commission Sketches for Book-At $15,000 we will be able to compile and publish the full length coffee table book and have funds to commission a few really big name comic artists. While most of the Aurora Rise sketches are donated, the extra funding would allow us to work with some professional artists to do a quality piece instead of a rushed free sketch.
$35,000 - Purchase a handicap van for Aurora Rise-Aurora Rise works directly with some victims who were disabled in the theater shooting. We try to bring these people out for events, such as Comic Con. However, we have no reliable way of transporting them and using accessible cab services hasn't always worked. We would use the extra funding to purchase a handicap accessible van to provide a stable source of transportation for the people we help who need it most.
$45,000 - Establish 2nd Memorial Scholarship-One of our main missions is to ensure that those people we lost in the theater will never be forgotten. Aurora Rise will establish our first memorial scholarship this year. If we can raise this much money, it will allow Aurora Rise to establish a second memorial scholarship and ensure that we can continue that scholarship for at least five years.
$50,000 - Bring Artists/Writers to Annual Auction-If we raise up to the $50,000 dollar mark, we would like to use some of it to help bring out some of the bigger writers and artists who have worked with us to our annual auction. Having artists and writers doing signings at our auctions in the past has help vastly improve the turnout and ensure more money is raised at the auction overall.
$60,000 - Establish 3rd Memorial Scholarship-One of our main missions is to ensure that those people we lost in the theater will never be forgotten. Aurora Rise will establish our first memorial scholarship this year. If we can raise this much money, it will allow Aurora Rise to establish a third memorial scholarship and ensure that we can continue that scholarship for at least five years.
$75,000 - Establish Aurora Rise Community Memorial- This is one of our most ambitious checkpoints. If we can raise the extra funding, Aurora Rise would like to establish a permanent community memorial honoring the people we lost in the theater. However, Aurora Rise would like to commission an artist to sculpt a superhero themed memorial to be put up somewhere near the theater to show that their are heroes looking after our community and watching over our fallen.
$85,000 - Establish 4th Memorial Scholarship-One of our main missions is to ensure that those people we lost in the theater will never be forgotten. Aurora Rise will establish our first memorial scholarship this year. If we can raise this much money, it will allow Aurora Rise to establish a fourth memorial scholarship and ensure that we can continue that scholarship for at least five years.
$100,000 - Sustain AR Scholarships for Five Years-This is the big one! If we can raise $100,000 we will have enough to sustain the Aurora Rise scholarship programs with five memorial scholarships (maybe more) for at least five years. This would allow Aurora Rise to expand our operations and allow us the most capability to help our applicants.
 Perks - for each donor level, Aurora Rise has some special perks to thank you for supporting our fundraiser.$5 - Recieve an Email Thank You card expressing our deepest gratitude for helping with this project.
$10 - Recieve an Email Thank You and have your name posted on our donor list that will be posted on our website.
$20 - Thank you and we will ship you an Aurora Rise support bracelet.
$30 - Thank you and we will ship you one of our Aurora Rise Sketch Books and a Aurora Rise support bracelet.
$40 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book, eBook/PDF edition. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet.
$50 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book, a $70 (or more) value. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet.
$75 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and an Aurora Rise shirt. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet. 
$100 - (LIMIT: 100) You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book, with a handful of artist signatures. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, and bracelet. (Note - We don't know what artists we will get to sign the book, yet.)
$150 - You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and an exclusive poster print made just for this event. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, shirt, and bracelet. 
$200 - (LIMIT: 25) You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and one of the original sketch book covers donated to Aurora Rise. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, shirt, poster, and bracelet. (Original cover will be a cover either featured in this book or one of our past sketch books.) 
$250 - (LIMIT: 10) You will receive a copy of the Aurora Rise Coffee Table Art Book and a commissioned drawing from an artist in the book. Also, receive the above thank you, sketch book, shirt, poster, and bracelet. (There is no selecting what artist does the commission. We will take commission details and work with what artists are available at the time.)
$500 - You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. Also, receive an Aurora Rise gift basket, including: physical Thank You card, a shirt, bracelet, a poster, a copy of each of our sketch books, a bumper sticker, a key chain, and other goodies.
$750 - Artist Sponsor - You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. You will also work with the Aurora Rise team to choose an artist sketch you want to see featured in the book. Your name will appear under that sketch cover with a "Artist Sponsor" credit. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.
$1,000 - (LIMIT: 10) You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. Aurora Rise will work with as many artists as we can to get the book signed by as close to all of them as possible. We can't promise everyone will sign it, but we will try. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket. (Note: This version of the book will take longer to ship as we have to collect signatures.)
$1,500 - (LIMIT: 20) You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book. Work with the Aurora Rise team to commission one of the sketch covers that will be featured in the book; we will then send you the original sketch cover. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.
$3,000 - You will receive a special memorial edition of the book and have your name listed in the book. The memorial edition will have a different cover and a special introductory. Aurora Rise will work with as many artists as we can to get the book signed by as close to all of them as possible. We can't promise everyone will sign it, but we will try. Also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket. (Note: This version of the book will take longer to ship as we have to collect signatures.)
$5,000 -  You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book.  Aurora Rise will also fly you out and get your a hotel room and tickets for Rocky Mountain Con, a convention in Denver, CO founded to help support Aurora Rise. You will also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.
$7,500 - You will receive a copy of the book and have your name listed in the book.  Aurora Rise will also fly you out and get your a hotel room and tickets for Denver Comic Con (2016), one of the nations biggest and best Comic Cons. You will also, receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket.$10,000 - You will receive a copy of the memorial edition of the book and have your name listed in the book and receive the above Aurora Rise gift basket. However, for your extraordinary donation Aurora Rise will give you the naming rights to one of our scholarships, within reason.
 If Aurora Rise does not reach our fundraising goal of $10,000 for the book, we will use the funds raised to continue supporting our mission of directly helping those people affected by the Aurora theater shooting.    The Impact Aurora Rise works directly with the victims, survivors, and people affected by the Aurora theater shooting. With the trial now going on, many people are finding themselves once again in need of support. We have helped our applicants in many ways. For example, many people took off work or lost their jobs due to the shooting. After a year or two living on savings, these families are now left without jobs and at risk of losing their homes, all because they never got things back on track from the shooting. We work with people in these types of situations to help them make bills, help with transportation so they can get back to work, and in general doing anything we can to make their lives a little better. Many people are taking time off for the trial and finding it much hard to cope with the proceedings than they expected. Aurora Rise is ready to help everyone we can through this tough time every step of the way.
The other part of the Aurora Rise mission is to support the Aurora Community and make sure those lives lost in the theater will never be forgotten. To this end, we have established the Aurora Rise Scholarship Program which will offer scholarships to local students.
From the beginning, Aurora Rise has been supported by the comic book industry. We were all very shaken to see such a tragic event happen during a Batman movie. The comic community immediately sought to help anyway that they could. With their help, we have been able to keep Aurora Rise going for three years. Aurora Rise believe that superheroes are an important factor in how we work with the community; we do everything from our sketch books to movie showings and working with local cosplayers. Aurora Rise wants everyone in the community of Aurora, the comic community, and everyone who has supported us that you are our heroes.
    
Other Ways You Can Help

 You can volunteer to help Aurora Rise on our website at AuroraRise.org/volunteer.
Artists, if you would like to donate a sketch book cover or piece of artwork to Aurora Rise, contact us via our website volunteer form.

story:
Welcome to the crowdfunding page for SugarBot Sweet Shop’s brick-and-mortar storefront, a soon-to-be full service, 100% from scratch, American-style bakery at 433 Jackson Street in the heart of St. Charles, MO. We’ll be specializing in childhood favorites even better than you remember them - with offerings including: layer cakes, cupcakes, muffins, scones, cheesecakes, pies, cookies (classic and decorated iced sugar), ice cream, craft sodas, and other confectionary delights. We’ll have options that cater to the general public, as well as items that are safe choices for special diets, such as low glycemic, gluten/wheat free, peanut free, and dairy free.

SugarBot's Background

That's me at age 4. From childhood, I’ve always loved baking. At 14, my first real job was at a bakery. As I got older, I began working at corporate jobs to get more experience in my field of graphic design/marketing. Even while working full time and going to school full time, I always managed to find time to bake. After earning my degree, I settled into a full time desk job, but the baking started to fill more and more of my time.

  

Slowly, my coworkers began to know me more for my treats than the work I was being paid to do at my job. I started receiving orders from coworkers asking if I could bring in scratch made cakes or cookies or ice creams for their celebrations. Eventually it became clear to me that it was possible to pursue a career I had real passion for: baking.

  

In 2009, I took the leap and started full time pastry school in the evenings, while maintaining my day job. I sacrificed free time and started working weekends at a local bakery to get my feet back into the retail baking. After completing my first semester of school, I said goodbye to the corporate world and hello to a full time bakery job.

  

  

I worked at 4am five days a week, while still going to school 5 evenings a week. I maintained this pace for the next year, while helping open two new bakeries in the area. Before the start of my final semester, I left retail baking to build a pastry program from the ground up at Ces & Judy's, the premiere catering company in St. Louis. In May 2014, I graduated with my associates in applied science with an emphasis in Baking & Pastry, and became a Certified Pastry Culinarian through the American Culinary Federation.

  

  

Last September, after a full year of catering parties both large and small, it was clear to me that I was ready to make my biggest jump yet - to leave the stability of full time employment and start doing my own thing: SugarBot Sweet Shop.

  

While getting SugarBot off the ground, I worked a few overnight shifts a week helping my good friend and St. Louis' very own doughnut savant, Vincent Marsden of Vincent Van Doughnut, make doughnuts. By day, I met with clients and vendors, baked and perfected recipes, wrote business plans, and scouted locations for our shop’s future home.

     After months of potential site visits, and a roller coaster of hopes rising and falling, we found a building in an excellent location with a lot of potential. After looking over the demographics for the area, the traffic studies for the intersection, and the other businesses nearby, we decided it was just what we’d been looking for. However, it needed a lot of work. And so the planning process began.

In January of this year, while looking for equipment to purchase for the future storefront, we found an existing cookie company that was selling their wholesale accounts and equipment along with the remainder of the lease on their storefront in Webster Groves. The opportunity came perfectly timed, and we decided to buy The Very Best Cookies and add to our momentum with a well-known St. Louis brand.

  

In February, we took over the day to day operations of The Very Best Cookies and received approval for an SBA loan that would allow us to buy our building and make the majority of the improvements it needs.

Between February and May, we closed the Webster storefront, put the majority of our equipment and fixtures into storage, moved into a shared commercial kitchen to maintain our wholesale accounts and custom orders, and worked with an architect to have building plans drawn up.  After the plans were approved by the historic board and the city, we purchased our new building and started demolition. Now that the paperwork is out of the way, we’re well on our way to opening our doors.

  

    

This Is Where You Guys Come In

We need your generous support to make sure our bakery is a success from the day we open.

By backing us, you’ll help jumpstart our business when we need it the most. We’d love to start filling orders and making tons of fun and unique sweet treats for all of you from day one.

Our Current Standing

Building Plans: Our building plans have already been drawn up by our architect and approved by the city of St. Charles, as well as the historic board.

Building & Financing: Our Small Business Association Loan through St. John’s Bank has been granted, and we used a portion to purchase our building in mid-May.

Permits & Licenses: There are a several permits and licenses needed to open a bakery, and with each one comes application, registration, and processing fees.

Renovations: When we closed on the building, it was set up as a retail shop without a kitchen, commercial or otherwise. In order to pass inspections, we’ll need to make a few renovations - separation of the living space and workspace, adding grease traps, installing easy to clean flooring and wall coverings, landscaping, updating the sidewalk and walkways to be safe and easily accessible for all of our customers, and about one hundred other tasks before we can open. As of June 1st, the demolition process is nearly complete and we’re getting contractors lined up and ready to start construction in the next few weeks.

Equipment: Because we purchased The Very Best Cookies, LLC, we have much of what we need to run a bakery.  However, we still need a few basics, such as stainless tables for work stations, bins and shelves for ingredients, small cooking utensils, plates, cups, mugs, silverware, paper towel dispensers, soap dispensers, tables and chairs… even the small things add up to be big costs to prepare for opening day.
Risks & Challenges
Opening a storefront bakery isn't all sprinkles and disco dust - there's a lot of hard work involved too.

Cost: As shown in the previous section, starting a bakery is not an inexpensive task. Many costs are accrued and due before the doors can open, and this campaign will help bring in the income to balance those costs.

Getting Started: Countless studies show that it’s typical for a small business to not show any profits for the first year (or more!) of their opening day. Because of this, I’ve taken all the steps I can to make sure that my foundation is a sturdy one, and I’m prepared for this to happen. I’ve budgeted for the worst case scenarios, but am hoping for the best. Your backing will help me eliminate a portion of the unknowns by fulfilling your orders when our bakery case is stocked full of amazing treats with you in mind.

Timing: There are a lot of steps involved in getting off the ground, and many of them have to happen at the same time. Scheduling and time management are key here, and even with the best of schedules, there can be delays. I’ll be keeping all my backers up to date every step of the way with what we’re accomplishing and our timeline to open.

Other Ways To Help

Whether or not you are in a position to pre-order goods from our campaign, there are lots of other things you can do to help!

Spreading the word is one of many ways we can let people know we're opening and find new fans. We'd be over the moon if you could be so kind as to use the IndieGoGo sharing tools to help us reach as many people as we can by sharing our page on Facebook, Twitter, via e-mail, verbally telling a friend, or any other way you'd like!

Follow us on Instagram!

Like us on Facebook!

Come see us at the shop when we open later this year!

story:
IsraelShield has temaed up with one of the biggest organizations in Israel that offers support to IDF soldiers on the front lines. Standing Together has been supplying IDF soldiers with everything from winter gear, holiday cards, treats and blessings to unit BBQs and tactical gear. 

Here is what Standing Together does, all year round! 


WHAT WE CAN GIVE IDF SOLDIERS!
We want to show our greatest appreciation to the IDF and support the soldiers who are putting their lives on the line to protect Israel.As an active IDF reserves soldier, I know first hand what soldiers can use to make an operation more efficient and together with you, we will make their summer safer and more effective in defending Israel. 

OPERATIONAL WATER PACKS
Believe it or not, the IDF is still using plastic canteens. Each one carries approximately a half a liter and they often leak and smell like some kind of moldy plastic. Soldiers have to stop, pull the canteen out of their vests and only then can they get a drink. This is both uncomfortible as well as puts soldiers at risk as they are unable to keep their eyes on their surroundings while drinking.
These new Waterback carriers are easily stored in the back pouch of any IDF infantry vest and can be drank from without stopping.  The water bags are insulated which keeps the water cold and leaves no after taste.

Each one of these 3 liter water carriers cost $27 and our goal is to reach 250 soldiers. Each platoon consists of 100-120 soldiers so if you would like to sponsor an entire platoon, let us know and we will give you an exclusive LIVE Skype experience with the unit you will be sponsoring! 

What You Get!

Besides becoming part of the IDF and supporting the brave men and women who are protecting Israel, we wanted to give you something for supporting Israel! 

Givati Unit Beret                          Golani Unit Beret
5 WaterBack  Packs ($135)     10 WaterBack packs ($270)              

   


Airforce / Iron Dome Beret              IDF Paratroopers Beret
15 WaterBack Packs ($405)            20WaterBack Packs ($540)

   

 LET'S DO THIS! 
 LET US KNOW HOW MANY SOLDIERS YOU WANT TO SUPPORT!

Please help get the word out and SHARE this IDF summer gear and waterpack campaign with friends and family and let's show the heroes of the IDF we care!

story:
Résumé

Nous sommes une petite entreprise qui s'est spécialisée dans l'extraction du seul pigment naturel pouvant donner du bleu sur le continent européen : Le Pastel des Teinturiers. Nous avons donné pour but de le valoriser en industrie pour remplacer progressivement les colorant chimiques par des colorant et pigment naturels.
"amener l'Histoire vers le Futur".
Parce que nous sommes tributaire d'une plante et que depuis, deux ans nous avons eu des soucis de climat qui ne nous a pas permis d'obtenir suffisamment de pigment pour la demande nationale, européenne et internationale,  nous passons par un moment critique où nous devons essayer de continuer notre petite entreprise pour vendre, faire connaître le Pastel et développer de nouvelles applications.

L'impact

Cette plante est non seulement tinctoriale, mais aussi médicinale. Les développements sont nombreux et fascinantes. C'est une crucifère qui se cultive facilement et qui demande peu. Plante industrielle et non alimentaire, elle est intéressante pour une culture de substitution.
Le but aussi de l'entreprise est de faire connaître Le Pastel et son histoire liée à la France. Pour cela nous ouvrons nos portes au public avec visite et démonstration de teinture. Nous sommes connus dans le monde entier et solliciter par la presse écrite et télévisée.
Nous voulons amener les industriels à utiliser des colorants et pigments naturels intelligents, non polluants et qui vont devenir l'avenir des couleurs, non seulement dans les textiles, mais dans les peintures naturelles, papiers, encres, etc.
En contrepartie de votre aide, nous pouvons vous offrir notre service de teinture façon dans notre atelier, stages de teinture, communiquer à la presse, etc.

Risques et défis

Nous avons une expérience de beaucoup d'années, car nous sommes les seuls à avoir sorti cette couleur de son oubli.
Les demandes affluent rapidement depuis quelques années. Nous n'avions pas été prêts à cette intérêt, car nous avions été trop visionnaire au début et il a fallut le temps, patience et passion pour faire connaître, convaincre et changer les mentalités sur les couleurs naturelles.
Maintenant, nous mettons en route plus de cultures, travaillons à un meilleur rendement du pigment, avons créer une filière Pastel en Midi Pyrénées pour satisfaire cette demande. De 600 kg par ans, nous devons passer à 2 tonnes de pigments.
Ce passage difficile, faute de pigment et de trésorerie, risque de pénaliser l'entreprise et de l'amener à fermer. Nous avons reçu le label EPV (Entreprise du Patrimoine Vivant et de l'Excellence du savoir-faire français) et il serait vraiment dommage, à un moment où les commandes affluent de ne pas pouvoir passer ce cap compliqué.

D'autres façons d'aider

Vous pouvez nous aider de beaucoup de manière, en faisant passer le message et de partager notre demande auprès amis, investisseurs ou autres instances.

story:
Our Story

Spirit Lake Idaho is a small town in the panhandle of north Idaho. A beautiful mountainous area that attracts thousands of visitors every year. The attractions are plentiful year around. The town is walking distance from one of the most beautiful lakes in the world, only seven miles from two fabulous 18 hole golf courses. We enjoy ATV trails in every direction, horse trails, hiking trails and feature many miles of bicycle trails. The bike trails offer every level of riding in and throughout the scenic mountains surrounding the area. Wonderful country wide views and plenty of wildlife to see on every ride. There are three large destination ski mountains with-in 30 miles of our town and a huge theme park only eight miles away. Hunting, fishing and camping are a way of life.

View of Spirit Lake from one of our many miles of trails  •  Main Street

The only thing missing in our historic small town is enough rooms to put our visitors up overnight. We have some camp sights and some small local rooms available but there are no new, clean motel rooms within 20 miles of our town. However, if you would like to visit us before our motel is completed there is a 100+ year old historic hotel with rooms available downtown. Our Indiegogo campaign is an attempt to help fund the building of a new motel in our over 100 year old town.

The land has been purchase, the architectural work is complete and ground should break in a few weeks. Much of the project is already funded. We are using this crowdfunding tactic for two reasons. To help you and to help us. If we can raise some of the needed money to help reduce our interest and bank payments, we can keep our cost down. This will translate into lower rates to our guest. Secondarily but more important we can offer reduced price perks to our campaign contributors. These rooms will average about $90.00 per night depending on time of the week and time of the year. As an incentive we can offer an overnight use of the facilities for every $50.00 contributed to this campaign. (More in perks).

Why Now?

Our town is growing; the chamber of commerce along with some local visionaries has recognized our area as what is quickly becoming a destination bike riding area. Many miles of single track technical riding trails are being added every month. Bike riders will be coming from many parts of the world to experience the true beauty of this area. Bike trail heads are being added daily. A new parking area and bike trail head downtown sets the stage for bike riders of all ages and abilities. We just need a place for them to stay while they are enjoying our friendly fun loving town and area.

  

Spirit Lake in the distance from the top of Mt. Spokane

Some of our small town assets

Our motel will be located on Maine Street downtown. It is a short (two block) walk to a grocery store, convenience store, liquor store, gift shop, city hall, hardware store, book store, bank, post office, full service salon, two parks, three restaurants (kids welcome), one beer and wine bar, one cocktail lounge, one lounge/restaurants and one lounge / restaurant/ sports bar/party bar. We also have a new lakeside park featuring 300 feet of beach with kayak and bicycle rentals. Our guest could conceivably park at the motel with their bike, or rent a bike, and not have to drive for their entire stay.

Kayaking is very popular on our beautiful 1500 acre lake.

Perks

As pointed out earlier in our story one of our favorite advantages to crowdfunding this project is what we can give back. Our average room rent will be about $90 per night to our non-contributing guest. This rate will vary due to season, weekends and premium scheduling. We are offering our contributors as many $50.00 per night room as you desire. If you selected to contribute $1,000.00 to our campaign you would then be eligible to stay with us for 20 nights (no additional charge). $5,000.00 would get you 100 nights. Obviously $50.00 would get you one night stay in our new motel. Any contribution in $50.00 increments will be appreciated and apply to your stays with us.

Your $50.00 nights are not available Friday or Saturday unless booked for at least Thursday through Sunday. This is a 22 unit motel. Only half the rooms will be available for contributors during peak season. Premium nights may be available for an additional fee.

Perk 2

These nights that you accumulate are transferable. Contribute enough for 20 nights and bring guest to use 4 rooms for 5 nights all together. Or, you can send your son in Seattle a three night package for his next birthday present. Use your imagination. Pick up extra $50.00 per night stay vouchers now for your vacation to the Pacific Northwest in 2020. Fully transferable and will not expire. Use for your own pleasure or gifts to friends and family.

Please join us:

If you are looking at this campaign you are probably aware of the surge of e-bike manufactures involved in crowdfunding projects. You may even be involved in some of these campaigns, as I am. The extra perk from joining our campaign is to have a place to travel where like minds will be enjoying all of the advantages of a bike riding destination area.

Do Some Homework: 

Check out our Spirit Lake Idaho Chamber of Commerce web page, things to do and bike trails. Also check Silverwood Theme Park (8 miles), Mt Spokane Ski area (20 miles) Schweitzer Mt. Ski area (25 miles), Silver Mt ski and year around waterpark ( 30 miles). Spirit Lake events. One of the largest lawn mower drag races in the U.S. (Father’s Day). Labor Day at the park. Bike rides, Car Show, tons of fun. City wide swap meet and Blue Grass in the park. (first Sat. in Aug.). Winter wonderland. We often get plenty of snow for all outdoor winter fun. Cross country, snow shoeing and snowmobiles included.

Time frame; as previously mentioned the property has been purchased and is free and clear. The architecture and business plan are both complete. The city is behind the project and all permit requirements have been fulfilled. As soon as the financing portion of the project is determined the building will begin. This motel should be open for your enjoyment in early 2016. With your help, even earlier.

Your Perk Verification; when the campaign is complete each contributor will be issued verification vouchers. The vouchers will be individualized with your specific accounting of days/nights available for your use, and Id. passwords. Remember, the vouchers will never expire and they are transferable. We will require identification when you redeem your voucher. If transferring your voucher we will need you to verify your password so we can transfer the voucher. We will recommend you start making your reservation ASAP to increase your chances of getting your most desired dates.

Priority will be given the earliest the highest contributions. As the opening date is determined the first and the highest contributors will be notified. At this point priority dates can be reserved. This will allow for large contributors to reserve bundles of rooms. For instance, if someone contributed $10,000.00 they could then bundle 20 rooms @ $50.00 per night for 10 days. This could allow someone to book the entire motel for a large wedding party, corporation retreat, etc.

Financial needs; the finished motel is projected at $880,000.00. The land and initial architectural work have already been secured. The process is started and we have nearly $100,000.00 invested to date. Another $140,000.00 is in a bank ready to be used for the down payment. We would like to fund 5% ($44,000.00) of the total cost using crowdfunding. This number allows us to get the best rates at the bank and it does not exceed the quantity of rooms available for reservations by our contributors. If we reach and exceed the crowdfunding figures the money will be used to reduce bank financing and pass the savings on to our guest.

Key Personnel;

Doug Freeland, motel property owner, motivator, investor and dreamer. I live on Sprit Lake only one mile from the future motel site. My family has been a part of the town and local area for nearly 85 years. Both of my grandfathers worked for the lumber mill which was responsible for the towns founding in 1907. It was a dream of my family to help this small town survive and flourish in a way that would only improve and benefit the town and surrounding area. My parents and grandparents have all passed now with their dream still active in my hopes for the future. This small town has survived its share of setbacks, including the huge fire of 1939 which burnt over 3,000,000 board feet of the mills stockpile. It is the general consciences of our town that a motel will give us the chance to find some economic balance between negative growth and overwhelming growth. This project will help me fulfill some of my family’s hopes for the future of our town.

Management and Development team;

Tony Villelli and Villelli Enterprises, Inc. (VE) have three generations and over 65 years of commercial hospitality development and management experience in California, Colorado, Idaho, Montana and Washington.  VE has successfully developed and managed motels, RV parks and resorts in north Idaho starting in the late 1970’s.  In 2010 Tony was contracted for the revitalization of Sedlmayers Resort in Spirit Lake, and VE currently manages the resort for its owner.  Tony was also the driving force behind the recent purchase of several hundred acres of lake front and secondary lake front real estate that is the site of the newest residential development in Spirit Lake.  As the only professional management company in town, VE understands the local tourism market and the essential role it plays in the vitality of Spirit Lake.  

With the help of their construction partner Jeramie Terzulli, President of InsideOut Construction (IOC), VE has already begun consulting with the architect, engineer, city council, and the planning department.  VE and IOC are eager to help bring the first motel to Spirit Lake, Idaho.

Marketing Team;

Cathy Kirk, owns two other business in town. She has been a North Idaho resident for 24 years. Cathy has extensive background in the hospitality industry. She has owned or managed restaurants and lounges for over 40 years. Her knowledge of the industry and background in public relations will greatly enhance the motel team performance.

Marc Kroetch, Property owner and local business owner. Marc owns and operates Trademarc displays. This company primarily does signs and marketing displays for every requirement or application. He also is the president of the Chamber of Commerce and is the primary motivation behind the miles of bicycle trails emerging in our area.

Dave Krise, Resident and local business owner, Dave is an award winning Photographer and Graphic Designer with over 40 years of professional design and marketing experience.  Other areas of expertise are web design and video production.  He also owns and operates Global Blue Solutions maker of Frog Spit Anti-Fog.  Dave is an avid mountian biker and has worked closely with the Spirit Lake Trail Alliance in the development of an extensive new hiking and biking trail system in Spirit Lake.

Evielynne Sanchez, of Bubble Boy Boutique is not just a local store owner in Spirit Lake, Idaho but also a social media manager for a number of business owners with my biggest client being, Spirit Lake Area Chamber of Commerce.  I have and believe in a strong communication and collaboration skills. I have ten years of experience in marketing, and I have spent the last five of those years as a social media manager. I know what it takes to manage an effective online marketing campaign. I have expanded and/or developed social media presences for over one dozen organizations including my business. I do everything from online setup, to custom audits and profiles, my hours are endless because I am passionate about building up presence for my clients. I use old and new social media outlets to expand traffic drive for my clients. As the online social media grows so do I. 208-627-3095

You can help; we certainly understand this sort of investment may not be in every ones interest. You can help in another very effective way. Please pass this information on. Tell your friends and family about this campaign. You will probably give someone this information who will be very interested in pre- paying for some discounted motel rooms in Spirit Lake Idaho.

The Spirit Lake Motel (Moose Inn) appreciates your interest in this project and we are looking forward to seeing all of you in the future.

story:
Short Summary

I started Devine Organic because there are a lot of natural product lines popping up and that have been around but most of them are not affordable if you're a student or on a strict budget and everyone deserves quality products for their body. I also make it easy to love the brand because everything can be custom made just for you.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $2500 to help with the vendor fees, travel, and making sure I can have enough product for the weekend. Everything is handmade by me and I only use organic butters and oils to create everything. This is the largest event I've ever had to prepare for and I don't have enough in stock as of right now.
  • We need at least 50 pounds of organic, unrefined, raw Shea and Mango butter, 20 pounds of aloe vera gel, signs for our space, POS kit to provide physical receipts and to take cash payments safely and securely, and transportation.
  • Anyone that donates will immediately become eligible for different products and discounts that are outlined in the perks. No donation is too low.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal I will use the amount raised to purchase jars, shea butter, mango butter, and carrier oils.

The Impact

  • It's important to make sure everyone has access to quality products and I want to be the one to bring them. It is important for your skin and hair to be properly treated and moisturized. It is important that there is a brand you can trust and you have a hand in creating the perfect product for you.

Risks & Challenges

  • As a small business owner and the only employee of my company it has been extremely challenging to run this business successfully. I prepare, package, and ship everything myself and it has been a challenge to get everything out in a timely manner but I am hoping after this event I can hire at least one person full time to assist with packaging and shipping.
  • Also while there I am looking to hire 3-4 people to assist me during the festival. I need people to help with packing, loading, and unloading everything that was made for the festival. I need assistance with setting up the display, taking orders, and assisting anyone that stops by the booth.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate money please donate your voice and share my campaign with your friends and family. Feel free to take a look at the market at squareup.com/market/DevineOrganic to see the products we currently sell.

I also make it easy to love the brand because everything can be custom made just for you.   What We Need & What You Get  I need $2500 to help with the vendor fees, travel, and making sure I can have enough product for the weekend. Everything is handmade by me and I only use organic butters and oils to create everything. This is the largest event I've ever had to prepare for and I don't have enough in stock as of right now.
We need at least 50 pounds of organic, unrefined, raw Shea and Mango butter, 20 pounds of aloe vera gel, signs for our space, POS kit to provide physical receipts and to take cash payments safely and securely, and transportation. Anyone that donates will immediately become eligible for different products and discounts that are outlined in the perks. No donation is too low. If I don't reach my entire goal I will use the amount raised to purchase jars, shea butter, mango butter, and carrier oils.    The Impact  It's important to make sure everyone has access to quality products and I want to be the one to bring them. It is important for your skin and hair to be properly treated and moisturized. It is important that there is a brand you can trust and you have a hand in creating the perfect product for you.    Risks & Challenges


As a small business owner and the only employee of my company it has been extremely challenging to run this business successfully. I prepare, package, and ship everything myself and it has been a challenge to get everything out in a timely manner but I am hoping after this event I can hire at least one person full time to assist with packaging and shipping.
Also while there I am looking to hire 3-4 people to assist me during the festival. I need people to help with packing, loading, and unloading everything that was made for the festival. I need assistance with setting up the display, taking orders, and assisting anyone that stops by the booth.

   Other Ways You Can Help  If you can't donate money please donate your voice and share my campaign with your friends and family. Feel free to take a look at the market at squareup.com/market/DevineOrganic to see the products we currently sell.

story:
Short Summary

     Rooted Emerging is a small nonprofit in Bellingham, Washington. We offer Coming of Age Programs and mentoring to youth ages 11-15. Since 2010, we have been giving a powerful rite of passage experience to youth and families, without any outside funding. We are at capacity now for what we can create, with two six-month programs and a monthly return involvement group for girls. In 2014, the organization's 20 members logged 2,065 volunteer hours. The Director position (25-30 hours/week) is still unpaid. We are in transition now to become an independent 501(c)(3) nonprofit - and we need your help to make it happen!
   By contributing now, donors can be part of a movement to bring a celebratory, community-wide experience to youth at sexual maturity. Our ancestors knew a deep sense of place by coming together to mark life transitions, and claim their new role within their villages. We believe there is something valuable to be reclaimed of personal and community health by bringing this practice current. Contributing now ensures that this model of modern rites of passage can continue to joyfully rise up.

What We Need & What You Get

   We need to reach $6720 this summer to successfully move into our next phase. Programs start in the fall and we are already preparing for our start of year events in September. The allocation of funds will look like this:

 Scholarships - we consistently have requests for financial assistance, and have had to turn people away who could not afford $350 for our six month program. Below are listed full (families pay only a $50 deposit) and partial scholarship amounts.

     Girls Program                 Boys Program

         300                                     300
         200                                     200 
          150                                      150
          150                                      150
     __________________________________
                                                                1300

 
 Director - a stipend for 25-30 hours/week, coordinating Mentors, Interns, Board Meetings, Girls Return Involvement group & general administration. A minimum allowance until independent nonprofit status is achieved.

    ___________________________________
                                                                1000


 Mentors & Teachers - we have 5 adults mentoring in each Coming of Age program. Mentor, Co-Mentor, Visiting Teacher (2-3 workshops + Culmination Weekend), Visiting Teacher (one workshop + Culmination) and Visiting Teacher (one workshop). Minimum stipends will greatly enhance our programs by giving incentive for wonderful people to stay on year after year.

     Girls Program                  Boys Program

 Mentor         500               Mentor            500       
Co-Mentor   425                Co-Mentor      425
Teacher       200                Teacher          200
Teacher       100                 Teacher          100
 Teacher        50                  Teacher            50

________________________________________
                                                                       2550


  Nonprofit application fee - to apply with the IRS for independent 501(c)(3) status, we must include a fee. We are already a nonprofit subordinate, with our own EIN. This step gives us the freedom and benefits of being our own organization, making future funding more accessible.

 ________________________________________
Nonprofit application fee                          400


  Events & Operating - all the little costs (that rapidly add up) to make our community celebrations happen. 

 We start the year with three events. "The Council of the Animals" at Fairhaven Park welcomes young people in grades 5-8 to a story/riddle challenge and lets them experience our organization to see if they are a fit. The Director holds a Q & A session for parents in the Upper Shelter to learn about our philosophy and practices. "A Masquerade Eve" is our annual, all-ages Halloween celebration, a chance for the Director to announce and honor the Mentors who have signed on to serve in the upcoming year's programs. Lastly, we have a Roundtable Discussion event for professionals, with a Keynote Speaker, bringing education and resources to parents, teachers, counselors, healthcare workers and others who serve youth.

  Space use Fairhaven Park                         120
  Space use Fairhaven Middle School       150
  Printing for flyers, event programs           60
  Business cards                                              50
  Guest lecturer & Space use                     200
  Materials & Decorations                              40
  Food & Beverages                                         50

_________________________________________
                                                                          670


 Archery Equipment - to enhance our experience of the Challenge, two Mentors have been trained as Certified Archery Instructors through 4-H. Now, we just need a few bow & arrow sets to bring this much sought-after activity to our programs.

 ________________________________________
  3 sets of recurve bow & 5 arrows           450


  Video Production - wouldn't you know, we found this amazing lady to bring her talents to making the video, on the faith that we would reimburse for her time and service after we launch? We have always been so fortunate...

__________________________________________
 Videographer/Editor pay                           350

____________________________________________________
                                                                         6720 Total 

   If we fall short of 6720, we will offer smaller scholarships and stipends, and continue to tap our collective resourcefulness. With more...? We would set aside funds for scholarships for future years. We would offer more compensation to the people who serve as Mentors, and those who keep us going. We would even pay for the p.o. box and web hosting, and create a transportation fund. We would offer a more solid program, that's for sure.


  Be sure to check out our fun "Perks" to see the ways we will honor you at our Council of the Animals event on September 27!  This is a new event - with giant puppet animals overseeing four natural stages throughout Fairhaven Park. A guided story/riddle challenge for youth in grades 5-8, with activities for younger kids around the playground, and a question & answer session with the Director in the Upper Shelter.  We hope to see you there!


    The Impact

      How are we impacting young people and our community? Here are a few things people have said, "I think every boy and girl in Whatcom County should take this class. You see this magic in their eye, and there is no pressure to be anything other than who they are." And, "This is really part of healing the feminine in our culture, how every generation of women can give their daughters a little bit more...". Every time a parent calls, with a sense of excitement and even relief to know that kind of support exists, we are giving hope.

      Here are a few outcomes our Interns are preparing to measure:  healthy body image for young people at puberty - fewer teen pregnancies - an understanding of boundaries & negotiating romantic relationships - a deep sense of inner worth - resilience - lowering overall stress levels for families - lowering rates of teen depression - lowering rates of self-harm - less suicidal ideation - less risk-taking behaviors - increased confidence - willingness to speak up for oneself - positive recognition - sense of place - connection.


      Risks & Challenges

        This age group can be hard to reach. If the idea comes from parents, it is sometimes met with resistance. Fortunately, when the suggestion comes from past participants the kids can really identify and get excited about it. Our return involvement program, the Girls Advisory Board, is working right now to extend outreach into the local middle schools through presentations - and involvement in our upcoming events.  
         Another challenge has been finding people with that ideal combination of gainfully employed, settled in the area, and with enough freedom to donate time to our programs. We have been remarkably fortunate already. But, every year, excellent people fall away to pursue paid work, out of necessity. With minimum stipends, folks could count on compensation, and bring a higher level of commitment to their role as Mentor or Teacher. All of us are trained annually as 4-H Leaders and Rooted Emerging Mentors, with screening and insurance through 4-H.
          The strongest asset we have now is past participants who are excited to stay connected and support Rooted Emerging. Last year, past participants hosted booths at our "Masquerade Eve" celebration, rising to leadership roles after being honored. Next year, return involvement girls will be adorning and escorting girls walking through their own rite of passage ceremony. We brought on a Teen Outreach & Event Coordinator last month to go into schools, and recruit high school drama students to perform stories & riddles at our Council of the Animals event in September. We are creating peer mentors even as we grow a network of adult Mentors.
         Every year, people from more sectors in the community come to us with interest in being involved: adolescent counselors, school nurses, prevention specialists, health educators. With such a robust and diverse Board, word is spreading about what we do, and how it is impacting kids and their families.
         Can you imagine growing up with this loving group of Mentors in the community, whose soul purpose was to support your healthy transition into adolescence?  We can!

        Other Ways You Can Help

           
            If money isn't plentiful now, you can help by spreading the word through your circles. Our supporters come from far and wide, and you probably know some of them!  If you are local to Bellingham, yes, we will find a way for you to be involved. The Director brings in about 4 people a year as Interns & volunteers from those brave souls who reached out to say, "I discovered your organization and would love to be involved...".   We welcome you.  This is a vision with a place for every kind of contribution.  We gratefully embrace you!
