story:
THE DREAM...

Jug Creek Distillery was founded in 2015 by Heath Frazier & Kyle Luttrell. As close as brothers, the two have shared a great love of high quality spirits for many years. In 2009, great state of Tennessee made Heath & Kyle's dream of owning their own distillery a real possibility with the legalization of craft distilleries. Since then, a few distilleries have paved the way, but overall demand for local craft spirits largely outweighs the supply. So while you still can’t make your own Moonshine & Bourbon at home, the good news is we are prepared to make it for you! 

    

In the nature of transparency, we admit that our first love and the bread and butter of Jug Creek Distillery is our Bourbon. However, as we all know, it takes time to age a good Bourbon to perfection- at least two years to be exact (the older the better). So while we will be steadily barreling our bourbon for a rainy day 2 years down the road, we will keep the doors open by starting with Moonshine. Who knows, there may even be the occasional limited supply of Rum, Brandy, or Vodka available! Have no fear though, we are dedicated to making our Moonshine some of the best to pass through your lips for many years to come. While Moonshine has traditionally been more of a “hillbilly” spirit, we want to make a high quality tasting alcohol with combinations of flavors unique to us.

In addition to providing you with premium quality spirits, we also want Jug Creek Distillery be an outdoors event venue that can serve as a scenic location for many events and occasions. Although the partaking of our fine spirits is reserved for adults, we want Jug Creek to be a family friendly environment (bring the kids!) where you can tour our facility, then enjoy a lunch on our picnic tables while taking in the scenic beauty of the rolling hills. Our goal is to become a destination people want to visit for family and social events as well as a venue for live music and various entertainment that will help bring tourism to Wilson County. 

The original plan was a goal of distilling by January 2017 and opening to the public by March, 2017. However, we have made some pretty great connections with people so that date may be accelerated by many months! We can't promise anything sooner just yet, but promise to keep you guys in the loop as we check things off of our list.

                        

WHAT WE NEED...

As it turns out, opening a distillery can be pretty expensive! While we fully anticipate to sign away at least one of our children to a bank for loans, there are still plenty of expenses that we need your help for. Here is a quick rundown of the major categories of expenses required to make this dream a reality:

  • Equipment necessary to make, bottle & distribute that fine Bourbon and Moonshine: approximately $150,000
  • Permitting with the federal, state, & local authorities to make it all legal and lawyer fees: $15,000 (optimistically)
  • Property and building construction: $250,000 (give or take $50K or so)

As you can see, we don’t think your hard earned money will go to waste, and we clearly are not too proud to beg! We set a modest goal $20,000 but would love to raise in the range of $60,000 
With $20,000 we could...
  • Attend a swanky distilling university so we have this biz down to an art 
  • Pay for permitting through the federal, state, and local regulatory agencies 
  • Pay lawyer fees associated with local red tape and business formation matters
With $60,000 we could...
  • Pay for construction of the building 
  • Hire a landscape architect to design the ultimate distillery location and everything necessary to make that a reality 
  • Improve our product branding/logo design and website

THE PERKS (WHAT YOU GET)...

So now you ask yourself, "Well, of course I want to contribute, but what do I get in return?" We wouldn’t think to ask you to give without also giving back! We have put together some pretty great rewards that we think you’ll really like as a way to say thanks for believing in us.  Some of these will be redeemable sooner than others, but all will be awesome. 

Official "Juggite" Membership 

We are inviting you to be a part of something special by becoming an official “Juggite”. Now you may be wondering, what in the world is a Juggite? Well, simply put, Juggites are our followers who are helping to make this dream a reality! You are friends, family, and even strangers to us. You appreciate quality craft spirits and want to help keep the “spirit” alive! Because you hold such a special place in our hearts, we want to reward you for your faithfulness. Every membership will enroll you in our newsletter that will keep you updated on our progress, as well as bring you information on specials and events to come. More perks will be offered after we open, and the initial membership will be good for one year after opening to the public. Take a look at our three levels of membership we offer and decide which one is right for you! 

**Contingencies: Due to the nature of our awesome memberships, we do have to require that you be 21 in order to choose a membership option that includes a liquor voucher. All vouchers must be redeemed on distillery premises and no alcohol will be shipped. Naturally, vouchers will only be redeemable once all permitting through the regulatory agencies have given us the go ahead to distill. It would be a little hard to make our dream a reality if we were in federal prison for illegally distilling without the proper taxation and permits!

Silver:  For the dedicated Juggite that is sure to need more than a sip or two, this membership includes a voucher for one 750mL bottle of our fine TN Moonshine of your choosing.

        OR For out of town supporters or non-drinkers, you can opt for a                                       premium Jug Creek Distillery logo hat (ship or pickup)

Platinum: For the truly dedicated Juggite, not unlike ourselves, this membership includes a voucher redeemable for 1 of the first 100 bottles of Moonshine available to the public! Your bottle will be numbered and will come with a certificate of authenticity.  We’ll also commemorate your special level of faithfulness with your picture on our wall of fame in our tasting room!

        OR For out of town supporters, you can opt for a swag package that includes a           Jug Creek Distillery t-shirt, hat, and engraved flask (ship or pickup)

VIP- The name says it all, you pretty much become family to us! This membership includes a voucher redeemable for a case of our premium Moonshine of your choosing, a private dinner party served at the distillery for you and 10 of your best friends, design a new Moonshine, distiller for a day, 4 grand opening tickets, your pretty face on our wall of fame, and JCD T-shirt, hat, and flask. You can also pretty much guarantee your name on the guest list for many events to come!

The Grand Opening

Because we are still in the planning phase, we will want you to be part of deciding what should be included in our Grand Opening celebration! While we aren’t allowed to "serve"alcohol on the premises, you are more than welcome to throw back a tasting (after showing ID, of course) and purchase your own bottle! We have many things in mind and are confident that this will be one party you don’t want to miss. Anyone that knows us knows that one thing we know how to do is to throw a good party! Food, entertainment, and good company are sure to be included in this. You never know if someone famous might even show up. After all, we are located right outside of Music City, otherwise known as Nash-Vegas, home to many celebrities. This will be a ticketed or guest list only event, so make sure you are included! We cannot guarantee that more tickets will be available after the close of our campaign so don't miss out. 

Some of our other Perks...

Newsletter- everyone who contributes to our campaign will be enrolled in our upcoming newsletter. This is the easiest way to keep track of our progress, as well as find out about any specials or events we will have along the way.

Merchandise- who doesn't love a cool hat, T-shirt, or shot glasses with your favorite distillery's logo on it?! It's cool swag for you and free advertising for us!

          

      You know you want one!  

We realize that the good state of TN is missing an "E" on our shirts, it's simply a printing error on a test batch of shirts, don't worry, we'll make sure they have it right for yours!

Private tours of "behind the distilling process" for you and your friends- find out how we make it, you'll appreciate all the work that goes into it. 

Distill a batch with us- have you always wanted to get your hands dirty and make your own Moonshine or Bourbon? Come on in and be part of the team for a day.

Help design a flavor- think you have what it takes to design and name a new flavor? We will work with you to make your ideas come to light, if it goes to production you could get some additional perks ;)

The Impact

Without your support, our dream won't be possible! We want to do more than just bring you fine hand crafted spirits though. To support other local small businesses and farmers, our goal is to use local Tennessee producers and suppliers for everything possible. We plan to participate in supporting other distilleries and helping to guide legislation in Tennessee by joining the Tennessee Distiller's Guild and the Tennessee Whiskey Trail. 

As our success grows, we want to give back. We plan to contribute a portion of our profits to raise awareness and support families of Congenital Heart Disease (CHD). CHD affects about 1 in 100, and is the number one cause of birth defect related deaths in infants under one year. This cause is near and dear to our own hearts as the Frazier's youngest daughter, Addyson, is living with CHD. 

                                                  

Risks & Challenges

As with any start up, we have hurdles to jump over! Our most significant include getting through the local zoning red tape and securing the funding necessary to make this happen. Because TN only recently changed their laws, the number of craft distilleries in this great state is still relatively few. This just means our county government might need a little more convincing to approve our zoning requests. We are confident that with the connections we are making we think we can assist them in seeing the light! The biggest risk to your contribution would be if we ultimately did not succeed in our goal to open our distillery....but we just don't think this is going to happen! The support of many people, combined with our headstrong determination, is what is going to help make this a reality. We have reached out and partnered with many people in the alcohol industry, business, and finance that have helped mentor us in what it takes to be successful. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just don't have a dollar to spare, and we understand that completely. If you can't contribute, you can still provide valuable support to us through word of mouth or by sharing it across the web. Make some noise for us across social media, we appreciate every share & like!

"We're Not Actors"- Blooper Reel

Our video is so smooth I'm sure you thought we got it all right on the first take, right?! Well.... maybe not quite... take a look at some of our outtakes that let up to the finished product... we promise we'll never be anything but who we are with you good folks!
story_txt:
THE DREAM...

Jug Creek Distillery was founded in 2015 by Heath Frazier
& Kyle Luttrell. As close as brothers, the two have shared a
great love of high quality spirits for many years. In 2009, great
state of Tennessee made Heath & Kyle's dream of owning their own distillery a real
possibility with the legalization of craft distilleries. Since then, a few distilleries have paved the way, but overall demand for local craft spirits largely outweighs the supply. So while you still
can’t make your own Moonshine & Bourbon at home, the good news is we are
prepared to make it for you! 

    
In the nature of transparency, we admit that our first love
and the bread and butter of Jug Creek Distillery is our Bourbon. However,
as we all know, it takes time to age a good Bourbon to perfection- at least two
years to be exact (the older the better). So while we will be steadily
barreling our bourbon for a rainy day 2 years down the road, we will keep the doors open by starting with Moonshine. Who knows, there may even be the
occasional limited supply of Rum, Brandy, or Vodka available! Have no fear though, we are dedicated to making our Moonshine some of the best to pass through your lips for many years to come. While Moonshine has
traditionally been more of a “hillbilly” spirit, we want to make a high quality tasting alcohol with combinations of flavors unique to
us.
In addition to providing you with premium quality spirits, we also want Jug Creek Distillery be an outdoors event venue that can serve as a scenic location for many events and occasions. Although the partaking of our fine spirits is reserved for adults, we want Jug Creek to be a family friendly environment (bring the kids!) where you can tour our facility, then enjoy a lunch on our picnic tables while taking in the scenic beauty of the rolling hills. Our goal is to become a destination people want to visit for family and social events as well as a venue for live music and various entertainment that will help bring tourism to Wilson County. 
The original plan was a goal of distilling by January 2017 and opening to the public by March, 2017. However, we have made some pretty great connections with people so that date may be accelerated by many months! We can't promise anything sooner just yet, but promise to keep you guys in the loop as we check things off of our list.

                        


WHAT WE NEED...

 
As it turns out, opening a distillery can be pretty
expensive! While we fully anticipate to sign away at least one of our children
to a bank for loans, there are still plenty of expenses that we need your help
for. Here is a quick rundown of the major categories of expenses required to make this
dream a reality:



Equipment necessary to make, bottle & distribute that fine Bourbon and Moonshine: approximately $150,000


Permitting with the federal, state, & local authorities
to make it all legal and lawyer fees: $15,000 (optimistically)


Property and building construction: $250,000 (give or take
$50K or so)








As you can see, we don’t think your hard earned money will go to waste, and we clearly are not too proud to beg! We set a modest goal $20,000 but would love to raise in the range of $60,000 With $20,000 we could...


Attend a swanky distilling university so we have this biz down to an art 

Pay for permitting through the federal, state, and local regulatory agencies 
Pay lawyer fees associated with local red tape and business formation matters

With $60,000 we could...

Pay for construction of the building 
Hire a landscape architect to design the ultimate distillery location and everything necessary to make that a reality 
Improve our product branding/logo design and website


THE PERKS (WHAT YOU GET)...
So now you ask yourself, "Well, of course I want to contribute, but what do I get in return?" We wouldn’t think to ask you to give without also giving back! We
have put together some pretty great rewards that we think you’ll really like as a way
to say thanks for believing in us.  Some
of these will be redeemable sooner than others, but all will be awesome. 
Official "Juggite" Membership 

We are inviting you to be a part of something special by
becoming an official “Juggite”. Now you may be wondering, what in the world is
a Juggite? Well, simply put, Juggites are our followers who are helping to
make this dream a reality! You are friends, family, and even strangers to us.
You appreciate quality craft spirits and want to help keep the “spirit” alive!
Because you hold such a special place in our hearts, we want to reward you for
your faithfulness. Every membership will enroll you in our newsletter that will
keep you updated on our progress, as well as bring you information on specials
and events to come. More perks will be offered after we open, and the initial membership will be good for one year after opening to the public. Take a
look at our three levels of membership we offer and decide which one is right
for you! 
**Contingencies: Due to the nature of our awesome memberships, we do have to require
that you be 21 in order to choose a membership option that includes a liquor voucher. All vouchers must be redeemed on distillery premises and no alcohol will be shipped. Naturally, vouchers will only be
redeemable once all permitting through the regulatory agencies have given us
the go ahead to distill. It would be a little hard to make our dream a reality
if we were in federal prison for illegally distilling without the proper taxation and permits!
Silver:  For the
dedicated Juggite that is sure to need more than a sip or two, this membership includes a voucher for one 750mL bottle of our fine TN Moonshine of your
choosing.
        OR For out of town supporters or non-drinkers, you can opt for a                                       premium Jug Creek
Distillery logo hat (ship or pickup)
Platinum: For the truly dedicated Juggite, not unlike
ourselves, this membership includes a voucher redeemable for 1 of the first 100 bottles of Moonshine available
to the public! Your bottle will be numbered and will come with a certificate of
authenticity.  We’ll also commemorate your special level of faithfulness with your picture on our
wall of fame in our tasting room!
        OR For out of town supporters, you can opt for a swag package that
includes a           Jug Creek Distillery t-shirt, hat, and engraved flask (ship or pickup)
VIP- The name says it all, you pretty much become family to us! This membership includes a voucher redeemable for a case of our premium Moonshine of your choosing, a private dinner party served at the distillery for you and 10 of your best friends, design a new Moonshine, distiller for a day, 4 grand opening tickets, your pretty face on our wall of fame, and JCD T-shirt, hat, and flask. You can also pretty much guarantee your name on the guest list for many events to come!
The Grand Opening
Because we are still in the planning phase, we will want you
to be part of deciding what should be included in our Grand Opening
celebration! While we aren’t allowed to "serve"alcohol on the premises, you are
more than welcome to throw back a tasting (after showing ID, of course) and
purchase your own bottle! We have many things in mind and
are confident that this will be one party you don’t want to miss. Anyone that
knows us knows that one thing we know how to do is to throw a good party! Food,
entertainment, and good company are sure to be included in this. You never know
if someone famous might even show up. After all, we are located right outside
of Music City, otherwise known as Nash-Vegas, home to many celebrities. This will be a ticketed or guest list only event, so make sure you are included! We cannot guarantee that more tickets will be available after the close of our campaign so don't miss out. 
Some of our other Perks...

Newsletter- everyone who contributes to our campaign will be enrolled in our upcoming newsletter. This is the easiest way to keep track of our progress, as well as find out about any specials or events we will have along the way.
Merchandise- who doesn't love a cool hat, T-shirt, or shot glasses with your favorite distillery's logo on it?! It's cool swag for you and free advertising for us!
          
      You know you want one!  
We realize that the good state of TN is missing an "E" on our shirts, it's simply a printing error on a test batch of shirts, don't worry, we'll make sure they have it right for yours!
Private tours of "behind the distilling process" for you and your friends- find out how we make it, you'll appreciate all the work that goes into it. 
Distill a batch with us- have you always wanted to get your hands dirty and make your own Moonshine or Bourbon? Come on in and be part of the team for a day.
Help design a flavor- think you have what it takes to design and name a new flavor? We will work with you to make your ideas come to light, if it goes to production you could get some additional perks ;)
    The Impact Without your support, our dream won't be possible! We want to do more than just bring you fine hand crafted spirits though. To support other local small businesses and farmers, our goal is to use local Tennessee producers and suppliers for everything possible. We plan to participate in supporting other distilleries and helping to guide legislation in Tennessee by joining the Tennessee Distiller's Guild and the Tennessee Whiskey Trail. 
As our success grows, we want to give back. We plan to contribute a portion of our profits to raise awareness and support families of Congenital Heart Disease (CHD). CHD affects about 1 in 100, and is the number one cause of birth defect related deaths in infants under one year. This cause is near and dear to our own hearts as the Frazier's youngest daughter, Addyson, is living with CHD. 

                                                  
Risks & Challenges
 As with any start up, we have hurdles to jump over! Our most significant include getting through the local zoning red tape and securing the funding necessary to make this happen. Because TN only recently changed their laws, the number of craft distilleries in this great state is still relatively few. This just means our county government might need a little more convincing to approve our zoning requests. We are confident that with the connections we are making we think we can assist them in seeing the light! The biggest risk to your contribution would be if we ultimately did not succeed in our goal to open our distillery....but we just don't think this is going to happen! The support of many people, combined with our headstrong determination, is what is going to help make this a reality. We have reached out and partnered with many people in the alcohol industry, business, and finance that have helped mentor us in what it takes to be successful. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Sometimes you just don't have a dollar to spare, and we understand that completely. If you can't contribute, you can still provide valuable support to us through word of mouth or by sharing it across the web. Make some noise for us across social media, we appreciate every share & like!
"We're Not Actors"- Blooper Reel
Our video is so smooth I'm sure you thought we got it all right on the first take, right?! Well.... maybe not quite... take a look at some of our outtakes that let up to the finished product... we promise we'll never be anything but who we are with you good folks!

story:
As Americans, my wife and I created this company to make a difference not only in our community - but in the United States. We believe in our country, our countrymen, and the people who put their lives on the line day in and day out to serve our great nation. We manufacture hard-use Kydex gear for military, federal and local law enforcement agencies, private security companies, and private citizens who legally carry firearms.

Our goal is to be the most successful grassroots business in the country, but we know just how much dedication and hard work it takes to accomplish the goals set forth. With only a thousand dollars in my hand, one year ago I taught myself how to create holsters for firearms from scratch. It started out as many ideas do, as a hobby, but after what seemed like days upon weeks - I was confident enough in myself to offer these holsters to private citizens in our community. I was faced with a tough decision to quit my day job and start my own business. As any entrepreneur knows, this is the hardest decision to make when faced with opportunity and adversity.

From that point, my wife and I have worked nonstop to create a small garage based business that puts out some of the best Kydex gear on the market today. Through dedication and perseverance we will scale our small business to be able to accommodate the large orders we are now facing.

With your pledge, we will be one step closer to our next goal of purchasing equipment that will boost our ability to create top notch gear at a much faster rate. When all is said and done, we will have used the funds you have helped raise to purchase a CNC router, a laser cutter/engraver, and build a better workshop infrastructure.

 We are limited to 200 holsters per month because my hands can not produce quality gear at any faster rate. We have many pending orders that we just can not fill in a timely manner. When we reach our campaign goal, we will be able to produce 300-400 holsters per month. This will give us enough capital to scale our business to the next level.

With that ability, we will be able to produce such a high quality product, 100% made in the USA, that our mission as small business owners will be realized by a tidal wave of gear being used by people who serve our great nation.

Our company is based on a concept that takes only one person to make a lasting difference in many people's lives.

"The concept of Zero 2 Hero has a role in each and every one of us as human beings. It’s the fact that a single sole’s action can be the difference between life and death for many. It’s the mindset that lives within all of us that will not take defeat for an answer. It’s the courage that is innate in all of us. It’s the ability to overcome fear, direct focus, and conquer all adversity that presents itself. It’s the reality that at any given moment good can turn to bad, and bad can turn to worse. It’s the realization that “evil” does exist in society, but it’s the understanding that “Good” does prevail. "

Risks and challenges

As small business owners, my wife and I understand and accept that adversity will always be one of the biggest factors in our path to creating a life saving product and a successful business.

The time is takes to create such a high quality handmade product has produced a huge amount of challenges that we have overcome by hard work and dedication, but we know there are an astronomical number of even bigger challenges we will face as time rolls on.

That being said, I pledge to you - with my word - that I will do everything in my power to stand by my commitment and oath of creating the best products that I can possibly make within the allotted time we have given ourselves for this Indiegogo project. You will receive the best of what our brand has to offer.

story:
Vous aimez lire. Il vous arrive ne pas savoir quoi lire.

Robert veut lire est le service idéal pour vous. 

Les gens n’ont plus le temps d’aller chez leur libraire préféré, qui pourtant leur donne des conseils judicieux, un moment de qualité que nous connaissons bien.

Il arrive aussi que le libraire ne soit qu'un fonctionnaire d'une grande marque. Ce libraire est devenu un zombie. Il vend des livres comme il vendrait des petits pois. 

RVL répond, à tous ceux qui n’ont pas le temps d’une sortie de qualité, d’une expérience d’achat plus valorisante qu’un Costco, un Walmart ou un Renaud-Bray.






RVL, c’est un service de lecture, par abonnement, soutenu par de la haute technologie ( statistiques avancées, intelligence artificielle ), affiné par des libraires expérimentés, pour mieux comprendre nos abonnés, les guider comme si nous étions à leur côté. Nous avons tous en tête ces suggestions loufoques d’Amazon une fois un livre acheté chez eux. ET bien, RVL en sera l’antithèse. Une bonne vieille méthode de vente avec livraison chez soi, en formule abonnements, une rétroaction constante pour mieux les servir, sans préjugés, sans snobisme. 



Nous aurons là un conseil au client tenant compte d’une multitude de constantes et de variables , ce qui plaît à nos matheux et permet aux libraires des conseils au plus juste.



Le client contrôle la fréquence de ses envois et le budget. Il bénéficie par ailleurs d’une remise de 15% par rapport au prix de vente suggéré. 

Le client pourra aussi élargir son profil, faire des commandes spéciales.

En cas de livre manquant, en réimpression ou épuisé, un appel à des libraires indépendants amis  permettra de voir s’il est encore possible de fournir le titre. 

Nous ne travaillons qu’avec des titres disponibles, en flux-tendu. 


( Note technique) Plus le sytème aura de clients, de données et plus nous pourrons évidement être très précis. Plusieurs de nos  pointures mathématiques qui conseilleront RVL ont déjà travaillé chez Google, Facebook ou Amazon. Ils en ont appris certaines valeurs mathématiques et tous y ont vu les limites. Tous travaillent à présent sur des concepts d’intelligence artificielle.

ROBERT VEUT LIRE est aussi conduit par une équipe marketing compétente, sans préjugés, inventive et dont le port-folio témoigne d’une créativité hors du commun.



Enfin, par des forums, clubs de lecture, réseaux sociaux, nous favoriserons au maximum la matière première de notre métier, l’auteur, son texte ou ses dessins. Nous avons l’équipe technique à la hauteur pour faire de ROBERT VEUT LIRE  non seulement un promoteur culturel fort mais aussi un Goodreads made in Québec, dont les auteurs seront les héros, un Babelio intime où les lecteurs échangeront sur  LE LIVRE qu’ils viennent de lire.

story:
Bow Market sketch 
Photo provided by: Bow Market

Who am I and why maca?

Hello! I'm Tamy, the owner and creator of maca. More likely than not, you've seen me around the greater Boston area chit chatting about my love for macarons.

I grew up in the restaurant business, loving food. From a young age, I learned how to bake everything from the classic chocolate chip cookie to homemade pies (fun fact: raw pie dough is my favorite). While my heart was always in the kitchen, I decided to do the "responsible" thing and went to business school for accounting in 2010. Thus began my trek into the Corporate world.

But in late 2014, I stumbled upon the French macaron during a friendly debate on the pronunciation of macaroon versus macaron (for the record, it’s mah-kerohn). Intrigued by its delicate nature, I challenged myself to make the very finicky confection.

The first batches were taste-tested by friends and coworkers. After bringing in new experimental batches day after day, I was soon known as "the macaron lady". One tester after another encouraged me to turn this into the real deal and, well, the rest is history.

My first market was in June 2016 at the Somerville Flea in the heart of Davis Square. It's safe to say that Somerville has a special place in my heart. After more than a year of pursuing my passion part-time, I'm ready to go all in and open my own brick & mortar store.

I'm confident that this cute, 163 square-foot store at Bow Market in Union Square is going to be your macaron heaven. Imagine walking into the store, smelling of warm almonds and sugar, with notes of strong madagascar vanilla or freshly made chocolate ganache wafting through the air.  A rainbow display of french macarons will sit front and center. Expect a wide range of rotating flavors, as well as the custom characters designs I'm now known for (featured as #10 of the top twelve cutest macarons in the world by Mashable!). 

Sounds good right? Yeah, I think so too! BUT building a store of any size is NO joke - that’s why I need YOUR help in the home stretch!

Important Disclaimer:: * I may use “we” interchangeably with “I”, but I currently am still a one woman show.

What We Need

I am seeking partial funding of $10,000 (stretch goal of $15,000) out of an estimated total cost of $35,000. I plan to self-fund the remainder by tapping into savings and small business loans (shout out to Samuel Adam’s Brewing the American Dream and Accion). 

Total estimated Build Out costs are as follows:

  • Plumbing & Electrical = $12,000
    • Includes things like: 3 basin sink & installation, hand sink & installation, point of use heater & installation, additional electric outlets to plug in equipment, specialty electrical plug for the convection oven (YES I will be baking on site), drop down lighting, main kitchen lighting, etc.
  • Other Construction Costs (i.e. counter, shelving) = $7,000
    • Includes custom pass through counter, window display shelving, shelving on the back wall, shelving in the kitchen, epoxy paint, etc.
  • Equipment = $11,000
    • Includes electric convection oven, refrigerated display case, under counter fridge/freezer combo, workstations, drying racks, coffee station, baking pans, baking racks, silicone mats, storage shelves, etc.
  • Architects = $5,000

All monies, regardless if goal is met will be used towards the above costs!

Here's a sneak peak of the layout!
Photo Cred: Cube Design + Research

And from my vantage point looking out:

What You Get

Check out the contributions/perks section. They’re heavily focused on what you would see in the store. We're giving out free macas, baggus, and exclusive memberships as a thank you for your contribution! Those items, such as baggus and vouchers, will ship as the contributions are received. So whether you back on behalf of yourself or a friend, you can count on including your perk into your gift giving this holiday season if you contribute before December 15th!

Thanks a-maca!

I used to envy those who said they loved their job. And for years, I longed for that feeling, but I didn’t know what could fulfill me in that deep intrinsic way. maca is my dream, and it’s become a dream that I’m living, all thanks to every single one of you reading this and contributing. I thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for helping me live my dream every day. Cheers to building my maca empire <3

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign, tell your friends, encourage them to just try one maca. That’s all it takes.

Intrigued by its delicate nature, I challenged myself to make the very finicky confection.The first batches were taste-tested by friends and coworkers. After bringing in new experimental batches day after day, I was soon known as "the macaron lady". One tester after another encouraged me to turn this into the real deal and, well, the rest is history.My first market was in June 2016 at the Somerville Flea in the heart of Davis Square. It's safe to say that Somerville has a special place in my heart. After more than a year of pursuing my passion part-time, I'm ready to go all in and open my own brick & mortar store.I'm confident that this cute, 163 square-foot store at Bow Market in Union Square is going to be your macaron heaven. Imagine walking into the store, smelling of warm almonds and sugar, with notes of strong madagascar vanilla or freshly made chocolate ganache wafting through the air.  A rainbow display of french macarons will sit front and center. Expect a wide range of rotating flavors, as well as the custom characters designs I'm now known for (featured as #10 of the top twelve cutest macarons in the world by Mashable!). Sounds good right? Yeah, I think so too! BUT building a store of any size is NO joke - that’s why I need YOUR help in the home stretch!Important Disclaimer:: * I may use “we” interchangeably with “I”, but I currently am still a one woman show.What We NeedI am seeking partial funding of $10,000 (stretch goal of $15,000) out of an estimated total cost of $35,000. I plan to self-fund the remainder by tapping into savings and small business loans (shout out to Samuel Adam’s Brewing the American Dream and Accion). Total estimated Build Out costs are as follows:
Plumbing & Electrical = $12,000Includes things like: 3 basin sink & installation, hand sink & installation, point of use heater & installation, additional electric outlets to plug in equipment, specialty electrical plug for the convection oven (YES I will be baking on site), drop down lighting, main kitchen lighting, etc.

Other Construction Costs (i.e. counter, shelving) = $7,000Includes custom pass through counter, window display shelving, shelving on the back wall, shelving in the kitchen, epoxy paint, etc.

Equipment = $11,000Includes electric convection oven, refrigerated display case, under counter fridge/freezer combo, workstations, drying racks, coffee station, baking pans, baking racks, silicone mats, storage shelves, etc.

Architects = $5,000
All monies, regardless if goal is met will be used towards the above costs!Here's a sneak peak of the layout!Photo Cred: Cube Design + ResearchAnd from my vantage point looking out:What You GetCheck out the contributions/perks section. They’re heavily focused on what you would see in the store. We're giving out free macas, baggus, and exclusive memberships as a thank you for your contribution! Those items, such as baggus and vouchers, will ship as the contributions are received. So whether you back on behalf of yourself or a friend, you can count on including your perk into your gift giving this holiday season if you contribute before December 15th!Thanks a-maca!I used to envy those who said they loved their job. And for years, I longed for that feeling, but I didn’t know what could fulfill me in that deep intrinsic way. maca is my dream, and it’s become a dream that I’m living, all thanks to every single one of you reading this and contributing. I thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for helping me live my dream every day. Cheers to building my maca empire <3Other Ways You Can HelpShare the campaign, tell your friends, encourage them to just try one maca. That’s all it takes.

story:
UPDATE:
We have received a private offline donation of $10.000 which does not show up on Indiegogo

 

OUR PURPOSE

We at Elderberries 3Fold Cafe are striving to build healthy, vital individuals and communities.  The last few years of the cafe in Hollywood have seen tremendous personal transformations and a vibrant will to take action. Whether it be fostering sober and safe spaces for reflection and grounding, feeding and empowering the homeless and mentally challenged, or striving to find more beautiful and compassionate ways to engage in social activism, Elderberries 3Fold Cafe is humbly and relentlessly sowing the seeds for a more beautiful future.
 

THE MICHAEL GRAILROAD

We believe that in order for the young people of the world to be able to bring their healing gifts to fruition, we are going to need safe and socially inspired spaces that invite creativity and ask us to be bold.  The vision has always been for there to be 7 cafes across the country, beacons of light , for international collaboration.  We call it the "Michael Grailroad", connecting and empowering the young people across the continent.

 

ELDERBERRIES : THREE FOLD IN NATURE

A CAFE

A co-working environment that is both supportive and intensely challenging, where a strong practice of conscious reflection tills the soil of the soul, developing capacities to create what you want to see in the world.  An urban environment provides the ideal context for both personal and community transformation. 

A HOUSE 
Our home, THE HAVE SEEDS HOUSE, is a space for learning to live in community.  While maintaining a sober and respectful co-living environment, we function as a landing point for travelers on internships, students, people both young and intergenerational from all around the world.
 
A CULTURAL HUB
The renewal of society could not be complete without a space for the arts!  How can we support artists, and the creative spirit in all people?  URBAN FIRST AID: ART IS MEDICINE is a space for conversation,  performances, classes, workshops and all aspects of culture.
 

OUR CAMPAIGN

Our $25,000 goal will provide us with the seeds required to get off the ground in Chicago and will cover:

  • Rent & Deposit
  • Construction / Materials
  • Tableware & Equipment
  • Furniture
  • Permits

Please have a look at our diverse and creative gift perks, each one created by someone from our Los Angeles community.

For those friends that would prefer to make a tax deductible donation, please contact us!

...and please share our campaign!

 

SPECIAL THANK YOU'S

HAZEL ARCHER GINSBERG and the

RUDOLF STEINER BRANCH IN CHICAGO

and friends, for laying down the tracks for the MICHAEL GRAILROAD, to make a beginning here in America, for the future.

story:
Short Summary

I want to create a website,  videos and tutorials about C# and .NET tools and common practices. Think about  verticals( logging, security) that every application needs to have.

It will be a common knowledge base(book, video and website , and mobile application ) about how to use those applications.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to implement the site ,to write the book and to make the mobile application and the videos( already having a part of those at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4aSKgR4yk4OnmJW6PlBuDOXdYk6zTGps )
 We have the main things to be presented - and we want to be a common source of knowledge. We want, after the launch, to be crowd sourcing of tools for programming.

The Impact
We are sure that everyone had problems when they began to think how to do different tasks in the application and what is the best way to do it.
This product will make available to everyone a sure path to find knowledge and tools to work fast and reliable.

Risks & Challenges

Too many existing resources are written by seasoned experts who have trouble relating to the perspective of what the problem is and how it should be addressed . This book will be different. 

My goal is to use my experience of 17 years in programming to make an approachable narrative. 

The risk for the book and  website is that will be not so fashionable - I am not an expert designer. However the information and the examples will be easy to reproduce them in your work.

Also English is not my mother tongue - so the book and the videos and the website must be proof checked.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word by going to github : https://github.com/ignatandrei/toolsForProgrammers 

You can help with the design of the book / website and / or forwording questions .

And, because the ultimate goal is to be crowd sourced with examples, you can contribute also to the book!

story:
TJ's Woodfire Pizza

Has been serving the public for the past 5 years as a Neapolitan wood fire pizza truck and now after many requests, we are finally opening a location so people can fulfil their pizza fix whenever they choose.  We want to be a place for families, foodies, pizza lovers to come and enjoy a fun atmosphere, but most of all outstanding craft pizza and craft beer!  We are doing our best to get the doors open and are almost there. 

There have been many challenges along the way. From getting final approval to do our tenant improvement which has taken months. Now as we are building out the construction, costs and equipment are enormous.

We did not expect to have to use a crowd funding campaign but here we are requesting your help.  Your donations can help make a huge difference. Also, your help spreading the word will be very much appreciated!

Moneys raised is going to help us purchase the final equipment needed to pass inspections by building and the health department to get the doors open. By helping us raise funds we have included some perks to give back for your support. We are hoping to reach our goal and will use every dollar that is donated to help in our effort to open as soon as possible for everyone to enjoy.

Thank you for your support and for getting the word out for us!

Thank you for your support and for getting the word out for us!

story:
Who and What is Dos Palomas?

Dos Palomas, which means two doves, is the shared vision of two globally-centric women with a taste for culture, refinement and adventure. We are Sinoun Kim and Maria Isabel Garcia.  We share a love of history and culture and, in Maria Isabel’s case, simply a desire to bring you one of the oldest traditions of her ancestors. In an industry dominated by competition and a profit-margin ideology, we want to introduce a new and unique experience to the globally informed person willing to experience new cultures and flavors. 

Dos Palomas is hand-crafted, triple distilled, premium tequila. We sought out to create a Blanco that is smooth, palatable and organic. 

It is produced from blue weber agave that is harvested and cultivated in the heart of Jalisco for up to 10 years. The volcanic soil in this area gives the agave plant a unique flavor.

Once ready for production the agave is cut and the heart of the plant is steamed in autoclaves at optimal temperature to ensure the sugars caramelize. After fermentation, it undergoes pot-still distillation THREE times resulting in a pristine and refined product, Dos Palomas Tequila. 

Dos Palomas has been able to create an organic product by partnering with a distillery focused on eco-friendly technology and no harmful chemicals involved in the cultivation. Dos Palomas tequila is limited in glycerin and other preservatives used frequently in the production of our competitors’ tequila. The family owned distillery has more than 20 years of experience.  Their craftsmanship is illustrated in their selective procedures relating to all aspects of production from the agave fields to the actual bottling. Production facilities have been updated to include purification of water supply and the recycling of the agave to produce agave nectar.

The industry is headed towards uniquely crafted spirits and the competition has not been able to supply the demand. There are few organic tequilas on the market today. Dos Palomas is not only organic but we strive to be a lifestyle brand targeted to those who are eco conscious and lead active lives. Dos Palomas Blanco is tequila in its purest form and that is evident when sipped. 

Transparency. Transparency. Transparency....

All of the contributions will go to the production of the bottles and shipping.  We have the TEQUILA!!!  We just need your help to get them bottled and ship to the states!


Label Creative




Box Creative



Bottle


Our long term goal is to grow as an international company that provides ultra-premium quality tequila to the adventurous and the curious, and those who have an appreciation for great product, and who want to relish an experience. Help bring Dos Palomas from our table to yours! And help us spread the word!

Delivery of Rewards:

The process of creating and importing a tequila brand is heavily regulated. There are many federal and state laws we must abide by. Some of which may delay our process longer than expected through no fault of our own. If an unforeseeable issue does arise that may impact the timely delivery of rewards we will be quick to inform you. We will keep you updated throughout this process. 


 THANK YOU!!!


FAQ:

How old must I be to purchase Dos Palomas Tequila?
You must be 21 years of age at time of purchase - THIS IS THE LAW.

How does the Voucher work? 
At the end of the campaign, you will receive a Redeemable Voucher for your Dos Palomas Tequila perks. This voucher will allow you to get your product from our online retailer, this will vary on a state by state basis.  We will put a link up on our website www.2palomas.com for you to redeem the coupon through our online retailer.  Redemption and deliveries are subject to state, local and federal laws.  Shipping cost is not included in the voucher.  

*Disclaimer
Our perks delivery dates may change depending on the process of shipping to the states.  The first shipment of Dos Palomas will not yet be organic tequila.

story:
Short Summary

  • The Chef, was born in California, is of Lebanese origin. After having completed a Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management, she moved to London to obtain the Grand Diploma at Le Cordon Bleu, culinary school. She also has experience in a variety of cuisines. 
  • Organizer and Assistant Chef, Originally Hungarian living in Germany has traveled the world for 10 years, trying many different cuisines-both authentic and traditional. 
  • His Superb social and communication skills attracts customers to try our food. His input in all recipes is what made the menu come together. Putting together many different worlds to showcase single dishes.
  • From the chef: I have always wanted to be a chef and finally now I am ready to start showcasing my talent and my love for food and food art. My idea is to fuse different cuisines with each other which explains the name. Also it is a good way to start a mobile catering truck which explains the word fused but is not limited to it. I want to show people that street food is about being fatty and overdoing the meal with so many flavours but it can also be something new and different with a healthy and organic Food, with gluten free options that is both affordable and accessible.
  • It is difficult to start something without finances to help pursue it. Contributors would help with a starting business that can eventually grow to small restaurants and catering services for large groups of people for special events and occasions.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding will go to buying all necessary equipment and tools as well as beginning inventory ingredients to start with the business as a food stand/mobile catering depending on the total amount we have. The menu is still in the process of being created and is close to being done. It will only include 6 dishes that are fixed on the menu according to the season to have the freshest ingredients at all times. We will also have 2 speciality dishes that change weekly and may be incorporated into the menu according to popularity. All ingredients used will be organic to make sure we have the best sourcing for all ingredients,
  • Contributing to the business will give you something in return depending on the amount you have contributed to help. It can be anything from a discount, to free meals and even a goodie bag.
  • Even if our goal is not reached, the funds will still go to starting the business on a smaller scale in order to raise more money to grow and expand to different countries. Out next step is Germany and Beirut, Lebanon.
  • We are looking to cater in different events and festivals as well as markets to have a wide variety of people try our food. 

The Impact

  • My project will bring out authentic Lebanese food with a twist which is not something that has been done yet. Having a Lebanese chef and having the joint knowledge in this cuisine and others will make it so much more exciting for people to want to try. After testing several of the recipes that are in hand, and having people taste and absolutely loving the flavour combinations really helps in finding the right food for the menu.
  • The phenomenal rise in the street food scene over the last few years has taken London and many other countries by storm, giving people the chance to try something they can't find anywhere else as well as not over spending on food.
  • Our plan is to buy a used food truck of medium size and fix it and clean it up completely and include all the necessary equipment needed to make our food on the menu. We will also need to fill out all legal forms and pay all the fees to have our business registered. All marketing and advertisement will be done through social media and different outlets online and be a part of different catering networks and associations.

Risks & Challenges

  • The risk and challenges would be during winter as people won't be out as much during the season which is why we would find a place suitable in all seasons. There are no food challenges as the menu is always presenting something new and keeping people interested in trying more and not just on a fixed menu.
  • All health and safety requirements must be followed and employee(s) hired will have to take the HACCP courses to make sure they are familiar with all these practices. 
  • There are always risks and challenges in a business, the person responsible has to know how to solve all these obstacles and keep pushing and never giving up.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I would appreciate it if you could post this link on different social media sites not just to receive contributions but also to make our business known to many people worldwide.
  • You can also use any of the Indiegogo share tools.
Thank you for your interest in my business and I hope you can see as much potential as I can into making this happen.

story:
Randy & Mike

- Hi friends, my name is Randy Smith and I'm a proud co-founder of One Are We.  I happen to have Cerebral Palsy, but that doesn’t define me and neither should the wages most companies want to pay me.  I shared my dream with Mike of someday having a job that pays a livable wage so I can support myself 100%. I do not enjoy needing public assistance to survive. I dream of getting my driver’s license, a car, and starting a family. When Mike proposed to start a company together that can help make mine and others dreams come true I said, “When do we start?”

- Hello, I’m Mike Hauser and also a proud co-founder of One Are We.  I was fortunate to meet Randy and the other athletes three years ago while coaching for Special Olympics.  Randy and this dynamic community have been a true inspiration for me. I think you will be equally inspired when you hear their incredible stories and accomplishments.  When Randy shared his dream with me, a dream that many of us take for granted, I knew I wanted to help him, and others in this community, make their dreams come true while benefiting from their positive attitude and inspiration.


What will the money be used for?

Our Indiegogo campaign is seeking $10,000. The net proceeds will provide us with needed seed money and exposure. We will use the net proceeds to develop future products and further develop our marketing campaign. The expanded product line will be marketed to our smaller retail and corporate accounts. This will create more jobs and advocacy capabilities.

Meeting or exceeding our goal will help prove to companies and possible investors that our proof of concept works. 

Please join with us in this social movement. 


Perks

Our Jewelry

Perk 1.  Inspirational Color Bracelet Set

We are all different yet the same. Handmade recycled African bead bracelets.

Let your individual colors and personalities shine by wearing these handmade bracelets.  Locally made using recycled beads from Africa these bracelets emphasize the positive traits in all of us.  Strung using quality clear stretch cord.

 

· Inspirational color bracelets - set of three - $20

Inspiring color combinations:
Red- Courage, love, friendship, strength 
Yellow- Intellect, happiness, hope, joy 
Green– Growth, renewal, compassion, generosity 
Blue– Trust, responsibility, confidence, sensitivity


Perk 2.   Ethiopian Hishi Bead Wrap Bracelet & 

an African Recycled beaded bracelet - Cool

Be distinctive wearing this traditional handmade wrap bracelet with colorful African bracelet.  Pure nickel or brass metal beads strung on quality clear stretch cord will look extraordinary wrapped around your wrist. A conversation piece PLUS you will be supporting third world local artisans who make the beads. 

                                  

Brass Bead Wrap Bracelet                                 Nickel Bead Wrap Bracelet

· Ethiopian Bead Wrap Bracelet - $20 (choice of brass or nickle beads)                


Perk 3.  Ethiopian Nickel or Brass Bead Bracelet

For the discerning man with a social conscious.

This bracelet features an ethnic design with traditional nickel beads and a cow-horn bead closure. All metal beads are handmade in Africa. Small imperfections add to their rustic design.

  Brass Bead Bracelet                                                                   Nickel Bead Bracelet

· Ethiopian Nickel or Brass Bead Bracelet - $25


Perk 4.  T-Shirts

“Differences is beauty”

T-Shirts are 100% combed and ring-spun cotton.  Bella + Canvas, 30 single count.


This quality designer t-shirt celebrates our differences – We are all beautifully unique and that uniqueness is what makes us all special. Wear this  t-shirt to celebrate the joy and inspiration that we contribute to one another. Wear it and pay the message forward.

The disabled are often defined by their disability/differences – not their gift to society.

· T-Shirt WHITE - $25    (sizes: xs, sm, med, large and x-large)

· T-Shirt BLACK - $25   (sizes: sm, med, large, x-large and xx-large)


Perk 5.  Karma Heart Collection - Necklace

From our hearts to yours. All fair-trade, handmade, and 100% sterling silver.

This one-of-a-kind double heart pendant was designed exclusively for our company by Jorge Espinosa, a well-known Mexican jewelry designer who learned the craft from his father 40 years ago. Our silver pieces are handcrafted by expert silversmiths with over 25 years of experience specializing in crafting intricate pieces of jewelry.

Our design inspirations are represented by:
Heart– Love, Empathy and Virtue
Arrows– Love and Karma are intertwined
Interlocking of the hearts–Inseparability of love and positive karma

        

·Sterling Silver Karma Heart pendant on sterling silver chain - $79                              (choice of 16" or 18" chain) EARLY BIRD SPECIAL $70


Perk 6.  Karma Heart Collection - Bracelet

           

  · Sterling Silver Karma Heart charm on sterling silver bracelet - $99                           (available in S/M or Large)        
                
                  



Perk 7.  Karma Cross Collection - Necklace 

For altruism, compassion & sacrifice. Fair-trade, handmade & 100% sterling silver.
Also designed by Jorge Espinosa, the sterling silver is delicately pounded to give it texture and shine through the reflection from light. Beautifully hand-made for you by professional jewelry silver smiths

                                    

           

· Sterling silver Karma Cross necklace - $79   (choice of 16" or 18" chain)                                                                

Perk 8.  Karma Cross Collection - Bracelet

    

· Sterling silver Karma Cross bangle - $99   (available in  S/M or Large)    


Perk 9.  All Star Purchase

2 perks + framed & signed 8x10 + Hall of Fame Membership

Includes one jewelry and one t-shirt of your choice. You will also receive a signed  8x10 framed picture of One Are We's outstanding team members. Plus be part of our Hall of Fame Buyer's.  

-$250  


Perk 10.  Super Hero Pizza Party

2 perks + Pizza Party with our inspiring team.

Includes one jewelry and one t-shirt of your choice. You and a guest are invited to meet all team members at One Are We.  Enjoy pizza, hear inspirational stories, funny jokes and gain an insider's perspective on what it's like to have a developmental disorder and learn ways our members have dealt with their disorders (such as Autism, Asperger's, Cerebral Palsy and Down Syndrome). Sure to be memorable and a great time. Available  in the San Diego County area.  Plus be part of our Hall of Fame Buyer's. 

-$500             

                                                                      

ABOUT OUR FOUNDERS

We will make our mission happen – we have the business experience, corporate contacts, endless passion, and you!

                       

Co-founder Mike has over 15 years experience running a company in the handmade fair-trade wholesale gift industry and has witnessed a strong movement for consumers and companies toward socially conscious products and companies. Over the last 15 years Mike has established many small and large retail contacts that One Are We will be pursuing.  

”We know the consumers will not only respond to our unique products but also to our true social agenda. We not only provide gifts, but a rewarding sense of altruism for the companies and the buyer. We will be a leader in the industry."

Co-founder Randy, who has never let his Cerebral Palsy get him down, will be a great salesman and ambassador for One Are We. The council running the 2015 Special Olympics World Games chose Randy to be a Global World Messenger. Quite an honor. Randy has given numerous public speeches and interviews in addition to being featured in the Huffington Post. He has been employed where he made less than $1.00/hour, and he plans to change that at One Are We. “Never bet against Randy” is something we continuously say.

We are devoted to make all of our employees’ visions a reality.

Our Greater Vision:

We will grow the business so we can make a larger impact on the American population. We have established a support base for our business consisting of social conscious companies, individuals, family members and friends of the disabled who have a big heart and wish to support and/or be involved with us.

We are a company who corporations will want to be affiliated with, inspiring them to follow suit in helping the disabled community.

To the amazing caregivers  - Our campaign would not be complete without giving a big shout out to all of you who have devoted your lives to molding, encouraging, and supporting this dynamic community. You have sacrificed so much – and we believe you are the true superstars!


We need your help to make this a success – 

PLEASE JOIN US

At One Are We we walk the walk.  Join us and become part of our exciting unique philanthropic venture!  Please consider making a purchase, and spread the word to your friends and relatives using E-mail, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.  

An early purchase by you helps build momentum for our campaign – so as Sara says in the video, “What are you waiting for?"

Together we can accomplish the mission to help the disabled's dreams become a reality.
Thank you,

Randy & Mike
story_txt:
Randy & Mike

- Hi friends, my name is Randy Smith and I'm a proud co-founder of One
Are We.  I happen to have Cerebral Palsy, but
that doesn’t define me and neither should the wages most companies want to pay
me. 
I shared my dream with Mike of someday having a job that pays a
livable wage so I can support myself 100%. I do not enjoy needing public
assistance to survive. I dream of getting my driver’s license, a car, and starting a family. When Mike proposed to start a company together that can help make mine and others dreams
come true I said, “When do we start?” - Hello, I’m Mike Hauser and also a proud co-founder of One Are We.  I was fortunate to meet Randy and the other
athletes three years ago while coaching for Special Olympics.  Randy and this
dynamic community have been a true inspiration for me. I think you will be
equally inspired when you hear their incredible stories and accomplishments.  When Randy shared his dream with me, a
dream that many of us take for granted, I knew I wanted to help him, and others in this
community, make their dreams come true while benefiting from their positive
attitude and inspiration.


What will the money be used for?
Our Indiegogo campaign is seeking $10,000. The net proceeds will
provide us with needed seed money and exposure. We will use the net proceeds to

story:
Hello all,
I have been working for in low income. I have a loving wife and a daughter aged 10. I have been trying my best to survive in London in tough economic situation. Recently I have ended up with some personal loan due to support my family. Its not that I took them on holiday or bought them gifts. Its just supporting them with the basic needs. Every month i am behind by couple of hundred pound short to pay off all the bills and rent. now I have got a loan of £3000, And i promised the guy i would pay him off by 20/06/15. Its been 5 days past i could not manage. Last 5 days i felt like i wish i could just hang myself. i never feel this bad. Its hard to survive. But we have been doing it for a while but when i have got a loan. And i can not pay off that's just killing me every moment of my life. please help me to pay £3000 loan. Even £1 pound matter. if you can not donate could you please ask your friends/family if they can help me with even £1. thanks from bottom of my heart.

story:
Hello :). There is is very little opportunity to find a place where art meets ordinary life in the Czech Republic. I want to change it. I would like to open an art café with a music program, author’s readings, later with a gallery and more and more. 


Art is very important. Art develops our mind and brings beauty into our lives. Art is all around us and we don´t perceive it. 

It’s said in the Czech Republic, "Every Czech is a musician", but! In the Czech Republic people are not interested in art because it is expensive or unavailable. Therefore, I would like to open a café, where people will savour a cup of good coffee and listen to anything from classical music to jazz and so on.

I want to help people with perceiving art but I would also like to support, for example conservatory students and emerging artists. In the future, also an amateur photographer whose photos galleries refused.

These funds will cover:

  • Cafes equipment (tables, chairs, food, musical instrument, etc.)                      
  • Rent
  • Remodeling of the interior.
  • Exterior styling
  • Small advertising
  • Savings          

Points of interest:

"I received mugs into my dream café with the logo "Dene Cofee" for Chritmass from my boyfriend. I hope I will not disappoint him" <3 


                                                                                                                                                                   

And why coffee?

Coffee is an amazing drink that is a pleasure, passion and still great potential. I believe that someone who loves my coffee will also love all the songs playing in my café.

So... help me and welcome to Dene coffe bar :).

I hope you're not offended for my English.

With love and big thanks, Jakub

story:
The Charity

In the UK in 2011, nearly 50,000 women were diagnosed with breast cancer. That's more than 130 women a day. Statistically speaking, 1 in 8 for women will face the same news in their lifetime. 

In the same year, over 9,700 women lost their fight with the disease, and passed away.


My name is Luke, and I am asking for £1000 to go to breastcancercare.org.uk, an incredible charity which aims to help every person affected by breast cancer get the treatment, information and support they need. In order to raise the most awareness possible, myself and my girlfriend will be taking a skydive in 30 days, documenting the jump in a video.

The Secret

What makes this jump even more special is the girlfriend in question, Tilda.  The jump, which is scheduled to go ahead on the 10th August, coincides with our 6 month anniversary, and for good reason. Tragically, Tilda's family has had a history of breast cancer, and with this in mind, I thought it would be a perfect surprise to not only go skydiving with her to celebrate 6 months (something she has wanted to do for years), but also, more importantly, to donate to a cause that means so much to her. She has no idea this is going on, but don't worry - I will have a camera ready for when she finds out!

Thank you!

Giving to this cause would mean a so much to not only myself and to Tilda, but also to the hundreds of thousands living with breast cancer as a part of their lives today, and tomorrow. Please give generously, and please email this page to friends and family to spread the message.
Thank you so much.

story:
Poor living in streets

There are many people who lives in the streets and even more that eating from garbage. Most of them in the near past were normal working people but now after loosing their job they must live from garbage. Fortunately there are plenty of us who are willing to help this situation and maybe we can make their lives better. The problem is huge here in Greece so those money will not solve their problem but at least have a better life as we hope thing will get better.

Goal of this Crowdfund

The goals is to reach at least 15.000 $ and even more so as to help those people. I must admit that last year i almost loose my job as well but i was lucky and at the end the company i work for decided to keep me.

Where will the money go?

I am working closely with some people who they have social grocery store for people who doesn't work either have money. Socials grocery stores are almost in every area of Greece. That is why i need your help to give as much as we can to those stores. 

Let help each other

What i must say is : i hope none one will get in this condition as Greek people but if someone needs help i know many of us we are HERE to help each other. Always remember helping each other it is much easier to get through hard time knowing that someone helps you!!!

story:
The Problem:

The house we are currently using is so small that the kids who cannot fit inside are getting rained on and there are no chairs, no tables, etc. We sometime use the two‐room school house but it is not always available and is closed for months at a time during school breaks.

The Cause:
Because they are not being fed the children are forced to work or beg for survival. 
Because they do not have funds for school supplies and uniforms they are unable to enroll in public school. They are growing up uneducated and malnourished and the chain of poverty in their family will never be broken. These avoidable circumstances put the children at risk for exploitation in both labor and sexual abuse.

Current Action:

We are currently feeding nearly 75 children in this community on a daily basis as well as providing them with the mandatory school supplies and uniforms, basic medical care and tutoring. Now new houses are being built by social organizations that will double the population of the community. Now, more than ever, we need additional space to care for all these children.

Solution:

With these funds we will build a center equipped with tables, chairs, plates, etc. to feed the growing number of impoverished children; getting them out of the rain where they can eat, be tutored and cared for medically. It will also provide a "community center" for the parents and other adults who can receive instruction in literacy, hygiene, infant/child care, job training, etc. We have the staff, the food, the uniforms and medicines. What we don't have is the facility.
story_txt:
The Problem:The house we are currently using is so small that the kids who cannot fit inside are getting rained on and there are no chairs, no tables, etc. We sometime use the two‐room school house but it is not always available and is closed for months at a time during school breaks.The Cause:Because they are not being fed the children are forced to work or beg for survival. Because they do not have funds for school supplies and uniforms they are unable to enroll in public school. They are growing up uneducated and malnourished and the chain of poverty in their family will never be broken. These avoidable circumstances put the children at risk for exploitation in both labor and sexual abuse.
Current Action:



We are currently feeding nearly 75 children in this community on a daily basis as well as providing them with the mandatory school supplies and uniforms, basic medical care and tutoring. Now new houses are being built by social organizations that will double the population of the community. Now, more than ever, we need additional space to care for all these children.
Solution:
With these funds we will build a center equipped with tables, chairs, plates, etc. to feed the growing number of impoverished children; getting them out of the rain where they can eat, be tutored and cared for medically. It will also provide a "community center" for the parents and other adults who can receive instruction in literacy, hygiene, infant/child care, job training, etc. We have the staff, the food, the uniforms and medicines. What we don't have is the facility.

story:
About me!

Righto, well I'm a 28-year-old woman, with over 10 years experience in the financial services industry (yawn). I have a brilliant idea for a minimal outlay business that has the means to be quite successful, but I need help, and I need cash to start up.

Currently there are no mobile teeth whitening services in Toowoomba and surrounds, meaning - NO COMPETITION. I can offer a service, at an affordable price ($150 approx, compared to $600-$1000 at the dentist, all in the comfort of your own home!!) Can you tell I'm excited?

I have always had an interest in the beauty industry, so as an add on to teeth whitening, I'll be also offering a mobile tanning business. Again, a market that is not highly saturated in the region. As my clientele expands, and my business improves, I will continue to engage in education and add services.

I'm basically asking for a bit of help to do something I KNOW I'll be good at, and I KNOW that I’ll love. If you can help in any way, it would really mean a lot.

Whether I can raise the money via crowd funding, or I have to fund it myself, this is a venture I am passionate about succeeding in.

What We Need & What You Get

Break down of funds needed:

  • $2500 - All tools needed to run the teeth whitening side of the business (LED light, treatment for 12 clients, signage, training and support).
  • $150 - Spray tanning course.
  • $1500 - All tools and equipment needed to run spray-tanning side of the business (Gun, portable booth, tanning solution).
  • $500 - Initial marketing.
  • $500 - Point of sale products.

Any extra funds raised, will go towards marketing and getting out there!! Every cent raised will go into building the business.

What you get for helping:

  • $20 - Spray tan (Toowoomba and Darling Downs Region)
  • $50 - DIY teeth whitening kit (Nationwide postage)
  • $100 - In home teeth whitening service (Toowoomba and Darling Downs Region) 
  • $150 - 2 in home teeth whitening service. One for you and a partner or friend. (Toowoomba and Darling Downs Region)
  • $500 - In home teeth whitening service PARTY for up to 6 people (Toowoomba, Darling Downs and BRISBANE regions)

If you are not in an area where I am able to offer you incentives to donate, and you would still like to help, that would be AWESOME and KARMA will most definitely jump on your side!!

**You will be issued with a gift certificate that will be valid for 24 months for all incentives.

The Impact

Living in a smaller rural town, work is slim. You will be helping me to build a business doing something I feel really passionate about.

  • I will be able to achieve good profit margins in an industry that has demand, especially in our region (No such business currently exists in this area).
  • You will help me maintain a family/work life balance with flexibility.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is minimal. The market I'm targeting has little to no saturation. The outlay is minimal. I'm passionate. To be as realistic as possible, a risk I can somewhat see is not raising enough to be able to advertise and start strongly.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get known!

  • Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter and all those other fancy social platforms!!!
  • If you're business savvy, and willing to offer any guidance, I'm a sponge. I have been doing my own extensive research and talking to people, but would love to take on board anyone's opinions and suggestions.

Thank you so much!

story:
We'll Let You In On A Little Secret...

It seems like if you talk to local cyclists about what the best routes are in Boulder and the surrounding area, you'll get a lot of the same responses. Flagstaff climb, Magnolia road and Sugarloaf are all staples if you're looking for some elevation gain. Now if you ask me the same question I'll have an entirely different answer. Just over 30 miles from Boulder (and Loveland/Fort Collins), lies a little mountain town with so many great ride secrets and a place that my family and I call home.

Estes Park is located roughly 7500ft in the air and at the east entrance of Rocky Mountain National Park. If climbing is what you're looking for, you can get almost 5000ft of it from the entrance of the park to the top of the RMNP Visitors Center at over 11,500ft. It's riding perfection and only one of so many other great routes in the immediate surrounding area including a ton of mountain bike trails as well.

But aren't there a ton of bike shops in the area? There sure are!...about 30+ miles away. The closest being in Boulder or Fort Collins which is at minimum about 45 minutes away by car. This is both extremely inconvenient for locals and those looking for a mid-ride stop on their way through.

After being laid off right before my birthday in September 2014, I gave a lot of thought to what I wanted to do next. After over 15 years of working as a web/software developer for ad agencies, I decided to finally follow my passion and provide something valuable for my community at the same time.

The vision is to create a small shop with a big purpose: Provide Estes Park residents with a bike shop that they can be proud of. Service, sales, and a place to fuel up before, after or instead of riding. In addition, what we're looking to do is help introduce cycling to a younger generation as well as hundreds of thousands of seasonal tourists that visit this mountain town every year. Did I mention that we're also a cafe too (i.e. COFFEE AND FOOD)?

On a personal note, creating this in Estes Park is to fill the void of not having a shop to call home. I've heard from many of you that you're also feeling a little bit of that void.  So, whether you love bicycles, coffee, Estes Park, or just the idea of a small local-owned & operated business, I'd love to know about it and have your support in one form or another.


What We Need & What You Get

If you're still reading, thank you!  You know as well as I do that without a little up front capital, this project won't work. We have a good amount of our own personal funds invested, and would like to limit the amount we need to borrow, which is where all of your contributions come in.

THE GOOD IS RECIPROCAL!

  • With a gift of any amount, you'll be making a huge impact!
  • Use this as a way for you to pre-purchase from the shop. Gifts can essentially  turn into future in-store credit options (see perk for details).
  • Sweet hand made stuff from our collection of bicycle awesomeness for particular giving levels is another one-of-a-kind thank you.
  • Everyone (OK, most people) LOVE coffee! You'll get some of that as a thank you.

Even if we don't meet our goal of $20,000, every penny will go towards supporting this vision and keeping the project on track. The shop will open regardless of the outcome!

Perks:

PLEASE NOTE: We will contact you after the campaign ends for sizing on any clothing related items.
Branding, concept and design by the supernaturally talented
 Caleb Wills / @calebsemibold

  • VBRC Water Bottle



  • VBRC Cycling Cap
  • "Day One" Cycling Jersey


  • "Day One" Cycling Kit (Cap, Jersey and Bib Shorts)



  • T-Shirt + Musette Bag


Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you like the idea of helping but are a little low on cashola yourself.  What can you do instead of a financial contribution:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter, snail mail, shouting from roof-tops, etc!

** Additional perk details, delivery times and photos will be updated as they become available.

Great big thanks to all of our supporters!

Stefano Tomasello
Via Bicycles & Ride Cafe (VBRC)
