story:
My name is Shonna and I have been in the beauty industry for over 10 years. I absolutely love what I do with such drive and such passion. I not only love my job but the people that made it possible to get to where I am today. These are not just clients or friends or family, they are the heart and soul to my business as a whole. I have always worked hard for what I have and I also give back to those who continue to support me. I would love to give something back to not only my clients but also my community. By getting additional funds I will be able to expand and grow my already successful business. By expanding I will not oonly get to offer additional services that I have not had the funds or space for but provide additional jobs to people in the community looking to be part of a wonderful and amazingly comfortable and profitable business. It has always been dream to run and own my own business and through determination and drive I have done just that. I want my four children to know that if you work hard enough and want it bad enough that anything is possible.

If I achieve the funds I need I intend to expand and relocate to a bigger and more accomadating space. It not only is in a town where I grew up but it is part of my towns history. I would love to offer more services that will make coming into my studio one stop for all your beauty and relaxation needs. I would increase my inventory and get the proper equipment in order to offer the additional services I currently do not.

story:
Meet the Jodi in Jodi Bee Bakes

In 2001, I flew to Barbados, got married, came home, quit my job, moved cross-country and enrolled in culinary arts school. Some people called it my quarter-life crisis; I called it passion.

In 2013, inspired to create delicious baked goods that honored the natural ingredients of the earth I launched Jodi Bee Bakes, an online, ecotarian and vegetarian bakery. Shortly after, I brought Jodi Bee Bakes on the road to various Farmers' Markets and events; this allowed me to meet and really interact with my customer base, convincing me that I wanted this kind of interaction all the time! By expanding my traditional specialities to include vegan and gluten-free items, my food became a common ground - something everyone could agree on regardless of dietary restrictions or preferences. Some people called it my one-third life crisis; I called it ambition. 

Today, in 2015, after developing the best customer base a girl could ask for, I have left my "day-job" and signed a lease for a commercial space in downtown Salem, Massachusetts. I want to bring all of the things that my my customers love about Jodi Bee Bakes into a permanent retail bakery & café, where people can come together and enjoy all their favorites whenever the mood strikes them. Some people are calling it my mid-life crisis; my customers and I are calling it fate!

What I Envision and Need

After looking at numerous potential homes for the bakery, I selected a space that is already fitted with a commercial kitchen rather than having to invest in the very costly build-out associated with a conversion. The new location has plenty of room for both cooking and for our customers. When I first saw it, I immediately had visions of my customers coming in and enjoying our food AND the hospitality that I have been waiting to offer for two years! Here are just a few of my visions:

  • You find yourself with some free time in the morning and decide to stop by for a leisurely breakfast. Perhaps you'll order the morning pastry basket with coffee, or a delicious bowl of chia pudding, or a slice of vegan quiche and relax with us for a spell. 
  • You walk by in the afternoon and notice that the lunch special is Roasted Poblano Soup served with "Cheddar" Jalapeño scones and it's vegan! You immediately decide that there's no place else you'd rather spend your lunch hour!
  • You're headed to a friend's house and know that nothing will make you more popular than bringing a dozen cupcakes from Jodi Bee Bakes. But will you choose the Chocolate Salted Caramel, the Pistachio Rosewater, the simple perfection of the Classic Vanilla Bean? Well, now that we have the bakery, you don't ever have to make that tough decision again because you'll be able to mix and match your dozen. Oh the freedom!
Well, we're already on our way to making those visions a reality! Our first order of business was to remove the fake, potted plants that were hanging from the ceiling!

Big improvement with limited effort and NO money. Score!

But not everything is like fake, potted plants; there are other steps that require a little more effort and money. Here are some things I need your help with:

  • I was lucky enough to find a space that has an enormous, built-in bagel oven - check it out!

    Sadly, the unit hasn't been used in years but if we can get it serviced and bring it back to life, I'm thinking vegan & gluten-free bagels are a necessity! Did I mention that this oven is right in the window to the kitchen, so you can watch as we bake your delicious treats?
  • My goal is to be as efficient as possible with everything, especially energy. For that reason, I also want to acquire at least one but ideally two, standard-size convection ovens for times when I don't need the capacity of the huge, revolving oven.
  • Because my commitment to the environment is central to my business, I intend to purchase compostable and biodegradable packaging made from plants and sold by a local, New England distributor. I'm so excited about the quality and durability of the products I've found but at more than triple the cost of those average products that end up in landfills, it's a bigger investment.
  • Who doesn't love chocolate? My beloved gluten-free & dairy-free coconut macaroons are hand-dipped in it! Because of the ever increasing demand for them, I'd like to invest in a chocolate tempering machine to simplify production and I have the perfect spot for it: right in the window to the kitchen so you can watch us happily dipping away as well as baking.
  • Last, but not least, it is my desire for Jodi Bee Bakes to be a bakery and café where the community (and visitors) can gather in a welcoming and warm atmosphere. Thankfully, I've secured a space large enough to do this but a bigger space requires more paint, chairs, couches, tables and, if finances allow, a rustic, reclaimed-wood table large enough to host the vegan and gluten-free pop-up dinners and high tea services I'd love to offer! 

Why Participate?

Here are some reasons why you should be involved in this campaign:

  1. A vegetarian, a vegan and a gluten-intolerant person walk into a bakery . . .and they all eat great food together. No joke!
  2. Our commitment to the environment inspires you.
  3. You've had our food and want more of it!
  4. You see the value in supporting small, local businesses.
  5. The absolutely amazing perks. Check them out!

Risks & Challenges

I believe that I've positioned myself for success but opening a new business is never without risk. Right now, my biggest challenge is ensuring I stay on schedule; that means not letting perfect get in the way of excellence! I need to continue to find creative ways to bring you the best experience possible while staying on time and on budget. As with everything in life, balance is the key. 

Become a Part of the Jodi Bee Bakes Family

The support and enthusiasm of people like you, my generous donors, and my amazing, loyal customers has been invaluable these past two years and helped keep me going even when the going wasn't easy. Your financial support will go a long way in helping to acquire the important things detailed above and make the Jodi Bee Bakes bakery and café a reality!

But for me, launching this business isn't first about the money, most importantly it's about my passion to make great food for great people. So, if you find yourself wanting to help but not able to donate, please consider a donation of your own passion: spread the word and share a link to this campaign. Do you have insight, time, or supplies to spare? Just let me know! Have you tried my food and loved it? Explain to others why it is important to have a neighborhood bakery and café where you can get a vegan breakfast or a gluten-free lunch or just a really sinful dessert! You are advocating more than just a bakery, you are advocating for a business that has a mission to bring people joy and honor the planet while we do it, and I (and Mother Nature) sincerely thank you for it!

    Become a Part of the Jodi Bee Bakes Family
The support and enthusiasm of people like you, my generous donors, and my amazing, loyal customers has been invaluable these past two years and helped keep me going even when the going wasn't easy. Your financial support will go a long way in helping to acquire the important things detailed above and make the Jodi Bee Bakes bakery and café a reality!But for me, launching this business isn't first about the money, most importantly it's about my passion to make great food for great people. So, if you find yourself wanting to help but not able to donate, please consider a donation of your own passion: spread the word and share a link to this campaign. Do you have insight, time, or supplies to spare? Just let me know! Have you tried my food and loved it? Explain to others why it is important to have a neighborhood bakery and café where you can get a vegan breakfast or a gluten-free lunch or just a really sinful dessert! You are advocating more than just a bakery, you are advocating for a business that has a mission to bring people joy and honor the planet while we do it, and I (and Mother Nature) sincerely thank you for it!

story:
1. Build a community that's 100% self sustaining 

2. Offer it freely to searchers.

3. Change the world through true discipleship  "I do, we do, you do."

Every day I ask people about their dreams, their passions, what they are doing, or what they wish they were doing. Everyone's reason for not doing what they truly love, what they truly care about, is rent. The four walls they sit in costs them 30 years of their life. The car they need to get to wok costs them 6 years, and then they need a new car. What if there was no rent? What if you wanted a house so you built one? What if we wanted a car so we built one? If we need fuel we grow it. If we need food we grow it or raise it, and we know whats in it because we grew it. We'll know whats in everything because we'll make it, and we'll teach other people to do it too. We don't have to submit to a 30-life sentence. It's a choice.  We can either be slaves to the grind, or slaves to our passion. Which road gets us to where we are trying to go? 

In Washington state each person after receiving a $60 permit is allowed up to 12 cords of wood. That is a lot of wood per person. We can also build all the tree houses we want with out permits. I can today buy land, build as many tree houses as I want, and invite you all to come work and party. That's just one idea. There have to be loop holes upon loop holes. Ways to beat the system. Ways we can live together work together and party. That's what this life is about. When we are doing it right, when we follow the Golden Rule it's one huge party. It's a great life to live.

My name is Kyle Wood, and I am fortunate enough to live in the Pacific North West.  There is a saying here amongst friends "Pacific North Blessed." I agree with all my heart.  Despite all of my trying to flee when I was younger God kept bringing me back home. I've been blessed. Not by my own works, but by grace. Last week I got baptized, yesterday I became a certified pastor (you can do it online), today I'm asking you to help me show the world a better way.

Did I mention I'm a tattooer? I provide free space for the artists who work at my shop. There is no rent or percentage, they pay to the shop what they can, and it works. I take care of them, and they take care of me. I don't charge for tattoos either. My clients take care of me, and I take care of them. It's a beautiful way to live and I just did an interview with Inked Magazine about it yesterday. I'm also gathering people together to shoot a documentary about this whole project this summer. What better opportunity to show the world what Christianity really looks like? Quoting another friend "why wouldn't ya?" 

The tattoo shop was just the beginning; I believe God has led me to build a community here in Kingston, a city on a hill, if you will. A beacon of light. A community 100% self-sustaining in the world but not of the world. With the one true God at the forefront, I want to build a community under the Golden Rule: love each other. If anyone is thirsty they will have something to drink. If anyone is hungry they will have something to eat. If anyone needs a roof they will have one. If someone asks me to walk a mile, I'll walk with them two. If we are given generously we will give generously. Do you remember anything you crammed for in school? Nope, neither do I. I remember what I was taught standing next to someone though. We learn one way. I learned it in the Army; "I do, we do, you do.” That’s what true discipleship looks like.  I did it with my tattoo shop, help me do it with this community, then we can show the world: I do, we do, you do. What are we doing? Passion over profit!

You will never find a private jet on this property, you will never see a campaign donation, you'll only see change. Real change. You will find joy, real joy you can taste. The whole point is to have no money at the end of every year. I'm not saving for retirement, I don't believe it's for me. I find joy in working and helping other people get to where they are going, I can't see my personality changing at any age. Whatever I am given is going to go right back to helping other people. 

Through tattooing my community I have met all of the people that we need to start. Architects, engineers, lumberjacks, earth movers, organic farmers, care givers, foster parents, musicians, producers, directors, cinematographers, photographers, designers, screen printers, nurses, carpenters... the list goes on and on. The one thing we don't have is a 22 acre $800,000 lot of land. It has a lake, it has green houses, it has a giant barn (venue, community center) and it has a shop. It has everything we need to get started and it's for sale, right now.



2 Corinthians 9

6 Remember this: Whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously. 7 Each of you should give what you have decided in your heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver. 8 And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work. 9 As it is written:

“They have freely scattered their gifts to the poor;
their righteousness endures forever.”

10 Now he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will also supply and increase your store of seed and will enlarge the harvest of your righteousness. 11 You will be enriched in every way so that you can be generous on every occasion, and through us your generosity will result in thanksgiving to God.

12 This service that you perform is not only supplying the needs of the Lord’s people but is also overflowing in many expressions of thanks to God. 13 Because of the service by which you have proved yourselves, others will praise God for the obedience that accompanies your confession of the gospel of Christ, and for your generosity in sharing with them and with everyone else. 14 And in their prayers for you their hearts will go out to you, because of the surpassing grace God has given you. 15 Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift!

story:
We created a log siding so historically authentic it boggles the eye!  Better yet, it discourages the need to tear down old historic cabins for their reclaimed logs!  

Our Home Started a Nationwide Trend!

Hi Folks, I'm Richard Gunst and this is my wife Chris on the deck of our newly built cabin home in 2005, high above Breckenridge, Colorado. 

After decades of graphic arts and studio set design, I retired the theatrical glitz of Southern California and together we hit the dusty trail for Breckenridge Colorado. 

Our Dream! Build a cabin, hike, bike, ski and visit some great Old Ghost Towns. But, while visiting them we noticed ODD that would change our Lives Forever. 

Sporadic footprints where buildings once stood, were gone! Then we found out why. Reclaimed wood brings BIG dollars, sold into Private Estates never to be seen by the public again!  We started thinking, "If this continues the only thing left to visit will be... Photo Graphics!

Little did we know we were about to change things. 

After completing our Log Cabin Home, the drive by compliments were over the TOP! Most everyone loved our home and wanted to know where we got our logs. The Idea hit us like a Lam Beg Drum, Loud and Clear! 

Pioneer Log Siding was Born!

Pioneer is crafted using the same type of tools our ancestors used plus, a few updated to meet the demand. Our wood is Doug Fir, Kiln Dried from the same types of trees our ancestors used.   

Pioneer Log Siding requires NIL to NO upkeep. The older it becomes the more authentic it appears. Unlike factory milled boards, concrete or plastic,  Pioneer Log Siding is the real frontier McCoy!

LOOK AGAIN! This Log Wall is a SIDING!  


Our Passion: 

"Preserving Historic Cabins Across America!"

Pioneer Log Siding has become a great solution over reclaimed logs. Historic structures like these are being dismantled daily for their logs. Our customers have told us that without Pioneer they would have chosen old historic reclaimed logs. 


If we continue to tare down these old historic structures for                                   their logs, The only thing left for anyone to visit will be Photo Graphics. 

HELP us Save these old Historic Places!

Each time Pioneer Log Siding is used, another cabin is saved. To continue we must relocate to the central part of the United States.

Relocating our business to the Central part of the United States will save our customers on their shipping costs and place us a Building for the first time.

Help is needed BUT, only if we can give BACK! 

We're offering some GREAT PERKS for contributions of any size, especially if you plan to transform your home into a Mountain Retreat!              

               Please contribute to only one Perk.

Funds are for... 

To Relocate: We need to relocate our BUSINESS from Washington State to the Central part of the United States. This would save our Eastern customers on their high shipping costs and place us in a dryer climate.   

A Building: We've always worked outside in the worst kinds of weather. It's always, "Duck for cover, here it comes Again!" We fight extreme winds and thrashing rains for days on end. It's tarps on and tarps off several times a day.

Working inside a BUILDING would be a Blessing! 

This is where we create countless Pioneer projects.  But, most of our efforts are lost struggling with the weather, covering and uncovering then ducking for cover. The building interior belongs to someone else. 

Chris below, between rains at our business site in Coupeville, Washington.    

"Dark days again!" "We're not sniveling here but these 50-80 mph Washington wet winds can sure put a damper on things, sometimes shutting us down for days." 

JOIN us at any level and become a very important part of this Campaign!


Details on funds Needed! 

  • To Lease a 2000 sq. ft. building for a year with some outside space. 
  • Leasing a flatbed truck and U-Haul to transport our business and belongings. 
  • Moving 2  autos, a large truck and an Office Trailer at least 2400 miles.
  • To lease a home and possibly with a large building on the property.
  • Funds to cover business during our shut down time while moving.
  • To purchase a forklift and a portable board stacker once we get there. 

What You'll Get Joining!

Great PERKS on Contributions of any size especially when your purchasing Pioneer Log Siding products.  

  • A colorful Pioneer Log Siding brochure.
  • Personal consultation with Richard on your cabin plans. 
  • Pioneer E-Book "Buyers Guide" "Cabin Transformation."
  • Pioneer Log Siding T-Shirts & Sweat Shirts.
  • Great shipping discounts on medium to larger nationwide orders.
  • Huge discounts when choosing Pioneer Log Siding products.

Risks & Challenges.

Not relocating will be a huge SET BACK for Pioneer Log Siding. 
If we miss this window of opportunity, a new lease will have to be signed causing us to stay in Washington State and many projects will be lost.

Contributions from friends and New Pioneer Log Siding customers can make this happen. We have funds but this relocation is an extreme cost, and could set us back for years. Relocate is just beyond our capabilities at this stage.    

Other Ways You Can Help!

Even if you cannot contribute we thank you anyway. Please feel free to contact us  any time with your ideas.  Maybe you can just make some noise and get the word out about Pioneer Log Siding and what we're trying to do. 

Some Pioneer Log Siding Projects.

Marquette, Michigan  


Jackson Hole Wyoming 

Truro, Indiana

Cle Elum, Washington

Port Orchard, Washington


Seattle, Washington. 


Lake Tahoe, California 


Marquette, Michigan 


                                                                                                                                          Wildwood, Missouri. This Lodge below used 6,000 square feet of log siding on it's interior walls and Pioneer Faux Logs outside to wrap their 2x6" boards.  

Pioneer Log Siding is crafted using new Kiln Dried Doug Fir boards from the same type of trees our ancestors used. We hand-hew, sculpt, hack, distress, sand, then age-stain to it's genuine historic appearance. 

Richard Gunst, "Yes, It can be painstaking but, well worth the pioneer results."


"Preserving Historic Cabins Across America!"

Pioneer Log Siding was started on $120.00 a year for Internet hosting. We needed capital but never asked. Pioneer was built the good old American way,  blood, sweat and a few tears but, no loans from anyone. 

"Pioneer is Nationwide and Growing Strong!"

Your Contributions will not only Grow Pioneer, but will also help us preserve these old Historic Cabins across America. 

We want everyone and future generations to enjoy these old Historical Ghost Towns and Cabin sites before they vanish forever. Pioneer could be your great alternative. 

Please Join us!

Chris & Richard Gunst, Pioneer Log Siding Founders. 

God Bless You and God Bless America!

story:
El Ranchito Economic Development Project

Global Effect is a non-profit mission organization that exists to bring hope, change lives, and transform communities in impoverished areas around the world. One of the ways that Global Effect is able to do these things is through an economic development program that creates jobs for people in the impoverished areas. As part of Global Effect’s community transformation and economic development mission, an agricultural project is being launched. The economic impact this project will have on a very poor community in the central part of the Dominican Republic is astronomical and will exponentially impact the entire community.  The project will create a minimum of fifty (50) new full-time jobs and one hundred (100) new part time jobs for workers directly employed by the agricultural project manager.  Based on minimum salaries being paid to workers in the fields, there will be on average $240,000 pesos (approximately $5,000 US Dollars) going into the community weekly.  In addition to the jobs created directly by the project, a minimum of fifty (50) new jobs will be indirectly created to provide services to the workers in the field including but not limited to:

·  Food preparation and delivery to the site,

·  Vegetable inspectors hired by export companies,

·  Drivers to load and pick up crops from the fields and deliver to exporters and local purchasers, and

·  People to grow plantings from seeds that will then be planted in the fields.

This project consists of purchasing 23 acres of farm land in El Ranchito, Dominican Republic where fruits and vegetable will be grown and then exported.  The amount of income going into the community weekly will also have a huge impact on other local businesses, churches and families in the area.  With the net profit from this project, the agricultural project manager(s) will be paid a weekly salary which will also be income going back into the community.  With a portion of the net profits, benefits will be provided to the workers in the fields (for example, funeral insurance, health insurance, and funds available for emergency needs.)  In addition, Global Effect will also earmark a portion of the net profits to other programs that will have a spiritual, economic, and educational impact:

·  Education programs (e.g., after-school tutoring, scholarship funds, and character leadership high school program),

·  Business development (e.g., micro-lending, job creation activities, and apprenticeship program), and

·  Community Outreach (e.g., partnering with local churches to meet community needs, establishing a food coop, and funding Authentic Manhood programs).

Project Budget

The following budget is based on information gathered from the project manager (Carmelo Vasquez).  Carmelo has been involved in all phases of agriculture in the Dominican Republic for over 20 years.  Carmelo has been serving with Global Effect over the past 4 years in the community of El Ranchito where he grew up and still lives.  Carmelo has demonstrated over the past 4 years his passion and great desire to help the people in his community.  He envisions this project as a way to not only provide jobs for people in the community but a way to minister and demonstrate the love of Christ.  Included in the budget is the salary for a US person to oversee the project with Carmelo and who will live in the area for a minimum of 7-8 months during the start-up phase of the project.  This US person will be accessible daily to Carmelo as well as Global Effect USA to ensure the project is moving forward, communication channels are open and funds are available and being appropriated as planned.

Start-up Budget:

Estimated Land Purchase Price (based on 6,000,000 pesos purchase price)

$136,000

Water Pump & House

$2,100

Arbors to Collect & Clear (3)

$2,400

Initial Tractor Work (Prepare Land)

$6,500

Crops (seeds, plantings, labor, etc.)

$19,000

Vehicle dedicated to Project

$15,000

Total Budget

$181,000

Vegetable Production

On the 23 acres, the following types of vegetables and fruit will be grown:

  • Dominican eggplant,
  • Chinese eggplant,
  • Hindu eggplant,
  • Three different kinds of peppers,
  • Two kinds of cundeamor (Hindu and Chinese),
  • Mosa (a type of okra),
  • Vangana, and
  • Papaya. 

 The vegetables grown on this land will be exported, sold locally, and then some will be distributed to families in the area that cannot afford to buy food.  The following exporters are committed buyers for the fruits and vegetables:  Idalgo Exporters and Martin Lopez, Exporter.  The vegetables have different growing cycles and harvest times.  The Papayas will produce fruit after 7 months and are harvested every two weeks for 5 months.  At the end of a 12-month period the tree is replanted and the cycle begins again.  The vegetables have a 5-month cycle that includes 60 days to grow and then 3 months of harvesting.  At the end of 5 months, the cycle begins again for the majority of vegetables identified in this proposal.

Timing of Project

Based on the fact the property identified in this proposal is currently on the market for sale and there is no good faith deposit by Global Effect to hold the property until the funds can be raised, the urgency to raise funds quickly is critical to the success of this project out-lined above since the property could be sold to another potential buyer at any time.  When enough funds are raised/pledged to make an offer on the land (approximately $136,000 US dollars), the property will be immediately secured with a contract written by an attorney in Santiago.  The remaining costs identified in the start-up budget listed above, will be raised over a period of another 30-60 days.

 How can you help?

There are three ways that you can get involved and have a major impact on the community of El Ranchito. 

  • Pray for the project
  • Give Financially towards the project
  • Spread the word about the project
Thank you in advance for your consideration in supporting this project and please contact us with any questions. 

God Bless,

The Global Effect Team
story_txt:
El Ranchito Economic
Development Project
Global Effect is a non-profit mission organization that exists to bring hope, change lives, and transform communities in impoverished areas around the world. One of the ways that Global Effect is able to do these things is through an economic development program that creates jobs for people in the impoverished areas. As part of Global Effect’s community transformation and economic
development mission, an agricultural project is being launched. The economic impact this
project will have on a very poor community in the central part of the Dominican
Republic is astronomical and will exponentially impact the entire
community.  The project will create a
minimum of fifty (50) new full-time jobs and one hundred (100) new part time
jobs for workers directly employed by the agricultural project manager.  Based on minimum salaries being paid to
workers in the fields, there will be on average $240,000 pesos (approximately
$5,000 US Dollars) going into the community weekly.  In addition to the jobs created directly by
the project, a minimum of fifty (50) new jobs will be indirectly created to
provide services to the workers in the field including but not limited to:
· 
Food preparation and delivery to the site, 
· 
Vegetable inspectors hired by export companies, 
· 
Drivers to load and pick up crops from the
fields and deliver to exporters and local purchasers, and
· 
People to grow plantings from seeds that will
then be planted in the fields.

This project consists of purchasing 23 acres of farm land in El Ranchito, Dominican Republic where fruits and vegetable will be grown and then exported.  The amount of income going into the community
weekly will also have a huge impact on other local businesses, churches and
families in the area.  With the net
profit from this project, the agricultural project manager(s) will be paid a
weekly salary which will also be income going back into the community.  With a portion of the net profits, benefits will
be provided to the workers in the fields (for example, funeral insurance,
health insurance, and funds available for emergency needs.)  In addition, Global Effect will also earmark
a portion of the net profits to other programs that will have a spiritual,
economic, and educational impact:
· 
Education programs (e.g., after-school tutoring,
scholarship funds, and character leadership high school program),
· 
Business development (e.g., micro-lending, job
creation activities, and apprenticeship program), and
· 
Community Outreach (e.g., partnering with local
churches to meet community needs, establishing a food coop, and funding
Authentic Manhood programs).
 


Project Budget
The following budget is based on information gathered from the project
manager (Carmelo Vasquez).  Carmelo has
been involved in all phases of agriculture in the Dominican Republic for over
20 years.  Carmelo has been serving with
Global Effect over the past 4 years in the community of El Ranchito where he
grew up and still lives.  Carmelo has
demonstrated over the past 4 years his passion and great desire to help the
people in his community.  He envisions
this project as a way to not only provide jobs for people in the community but
a way to minister and demonstrate the love of Christ.  Included in the budget is the salary for a US
person to oversee the project with Carmelo and who will live in the area for a
minimum of 7-8 months during the start-up phase of the project.  This US person will be accessible daily to
Carmelo as well as Global Effect USA to ensure the project is moving forward,
communication channels are open and funds are available and being appropriated
as planned.









Start-up Budget:
Estimated Land Purchase Price
  (based on 6,000,000 pesos purchase price)


$136,000




Water Pump & House


$2,100




Arbors to Collect &
  Clear (3)


$2,400




Initial Tractor Work
  (Prepare Land)


$6,500




Crops (seeds, plantings, labor,
  etc.)


$19,000




Vehicle dedicated to
  Project


$15,000




Total Budget


$181,000




 
Vegetable Production
On the 23 acres, the following types of vegetables and fruit will be
grown:



Dominican eggplant,


Chinese eggplant,


Hindu eggplant,


Three different kinds of peppers,


Two kinds of cundeamor (Hindu and Chinese),


Mosa (a type of okra),


Vangana, and


Papaya. 


 The vegetables grown on this land will be exported, sold locally, and then
some will be distributed to families in the area that cannot afford to buy
food.  The following exporters are
committed buyers for the fruits and vegetables: 
Idalgo Exporters and Martin Lopez, Exporter.  The vegetables have different growing cycles
and harvest times.  The Papayas will
produce fruit after 7 months and are harvested every two weeks for 5
months.  At the end of a 12-month period
the tree is replanted and the cycle begins again.  The vegetables have a 5-month cycle that
includes 60 days to grow and then 3 months of harvesting.  At the end of 5 months, the cycle begins
again for the majority of vegetables identified in this proposal.   

Timing of Project
Based on the fact the property identified in this proposal is currently
on the market for sale and there is no good faith deposit by Global Effect to
hold the property until the funds can be raised, the urgency to raise funds
quickly is critical to the success of this project out-lined above since the
property could be sold to another potential buyer at any time.  When enough funds are raised/pledged to make
an offer on the land (approximately $136,000 US dollars), the property will be immediately
secured with a contract written by an attorney in Santiago.  The remaining costs identified in the
start-up budget listed above, will be raised over a period of another 30-60
days.
 How can you help?
There are three ways that you can get involved and have a major impact on the community of El Ranchito. 



Pray for the project

Give Financially towards the project
Spread the word about the project

Thank you in advance for your consideration in supporting this project and please contact us with any questions. 
God Bless,
The Global Effect Team

story:
Short Summary

My name is Madison Knight and I currently reside in Shawnee, Kansas. Growing up, my biggest dream was to finally own a dog of my very own. My sophomore year in college, my dreams came true when I rescued my first puppy at 5 weeks old, a blue heeler-lab mix named Dexter. I knew from the minute I saw him, I was already in love. In December, we celebrated Dexter's first birthday. One thing I have never been able to do however, is leave Dex at a dog boarding center. I can tend to be a little over protective of him, but he is my first puppy, and was solely my responsibility. My boyfriend also had a puppy of his own, a german shepherd mix named Ted. Dexter met Ted when he was only 6 weeks old and since then, they have been absolutely inseparable. Now I had two dogs that I was absolutely in love with, and always wanted the best care possible for them. I have had multiple scenarios, where I was needing to board them, mainly family vacations where dogs were not allowed in the hotels. I had researched every dog boarding center within 50 miles of my home, and only one seemed to satisfied my requirements. Excited, my boyfriend Patrick and I took Dexter for a meet and greet of this facility, and what I saw absolutely horrified me. Chain linked fences surrounded dirty concrete floors where the dogs were kept that were covered in feces and urine. On the website, they boasted their outdoor playground, where the dogs could explore and receive their daily exercise. What they showed me was horrendous. A few broken pieces of old children's playground equipment were scattered across a patch of dirt. After deciding against boarding him, I had researched a few places more, further from my home. I saw a common trend among these places: they did not feel like home. My dog is my world. I felt the safest when I was able to leave him with a family member or a close friend. That is what I want my business to feel exactly like that. It will always feel comfortable to leave your dog in a place where you can trust they are being treated exactly as they should. A dog is one of the most important aspects of a family, so why would you send them to a place where they would not be treated that way? That's when I vowed that I wanted to start a business. My dream was a homey, boarding and daycare center where no owner ever felt skeptical that their dogs were getting less than amazing care. 

What We Need & What You Get

Starting my dream business is definitely not cheap. What sets us aside from most of our competitors is our idea of building our business on a significant amount of land. Also, we are wanting to be within a reasonable distance of our customers. With our current goal of $20,000, we will be able to get a start on purchasing our land and begin the designing and building of our facility. Our very own boarding center included dreams of building on land with at least a couple of fenced in acres. I also want amenities for the dogs to enjoy such as a separate exercise area with equipment for dogs to play with and complete with an indoor area for the dogs to play if the weather is unmanageable, and a dog pool for the pups to cool down in during those warm summer days! For overnight care, I want to be absolutely cage free. Individual rooms for each pup to enjoy while being furnished with their own bed, but still being roomy enough for their owners to bring in their own belongings to make their pup's stay as comfortable as possible. Another aspect is I want owners to be able to stay in contact with their dog, especially during overnight stays. I want to set up a digital stream that is accessible online where owners can watch their pups at play or happily dreaming and everything in between.  I dream of a boarding center that dogs will leave happy and exhausted after a day of play. Owners will be able to pick up their dogs confident that they were provided with the best possible care during their stay. Our current goal is pretty far reaching. But you can feel safe that every single penny that is donated will go towards the business. Even if we are not able to reach our set amount, every contribution helps!

The Impact

In today's day and age, dogs are just as much a part of the family as ever. They receive the best care at home, and there is no reason that they should not receive the best care everywhere else. Our business does one thing that many boarding facilities do not: we cater to the dog. We set out to provide the best experience for your loved one, while also making it easier for owners to leave their pups at a place they can trust. At the end of the day, we want to see happy pups leaving with happy owners.

Risks & Challenges

To set us apart from our competitors, our business has to stand out. I am not willing to take shortcuts in order to become more profitable, especially if it lowers the quality of care. Currently, I am in progress to graduate with my BHS from the University of Missouri next May. Without any prior experience in business, my partner Patrick Daly will be handling the financial standpoint of the business. He currently holds a Business and Finance degree from Central College. Nowadays, many business owners are only in it to get a paycheck. This is the most important factor that I believe will truly set us apart. My true goal in this business is to provide our customers with an excellent service, profit will not be an overwhelming factor on our end. As our business grows, I am hoping to provide our own line of healthy and organic treats and dog accessories, including collars and leashes. In the future, we are hoping to expand to include other services, such as grooming. To ensure that our business is built with all of my ideals in mind, it can cost upwards of $200,000. With other financial obstacles in our way such as insurance, permitting fees and licenses, every contribution helps! You can help us start a new generation of the pet friendly business!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to lend us a hand! As much as we appreciate your financial contributions, there are other ways that are just as valuable. Tell your friends about us and help spread the word! Refer them to our Indiegogo page if they are interested in learning more about who we are and what we have to offer.

story:
An exciting hydrofoiling, carbon neutral catamaran.

Twin Dragons Yachts is a new boat building company that specialises in unique green technology and design for high performance catamarans and small boats.

We’re sailors, and passionately love the ocean. We wanted to build the most exciting boat in the world. One that won’t harm the environment. 

The Dragon TD15 is a noble, powerful craft.

It is a hydro foiling cruising catamaran that is fast in the lightest breeze and can fly along in the teeth of a gale without having a sail blowout. It is yacht without normal sails or fossil fuel engines, and is as easy to sail as it is to drive a car. This boat is a high tech marvel, stable and easy to control even when things get rough.

At 15 metres long (50 ft) and 8,6 metres wide (28ft), it has wave piercing bows, hydrofoils, aerofoils and twin wing masts. Plus a luxurious interior that caters to all the physical comforts you want on a boat. 


It’s an intelligent boat that cooperates with you and takes the hard work out of sailing. Intuitive control systems and sensors constantly maintain stability, position and sail deployment.

Wind and solar energy ensures a constant supply of electricity and power. Innovative technology calculates your course, maintains your track and adjusts the sails and hydrofoils every few seconds. The Dragon almost sails itself. We guarantee that you’ll be swept away by the power and performance of the Dragon.

Wing sails

Wing sails (aero foils) provide extreme power and amazing performance. The Dragon will sail up to 10 degrees into the wind – this angle of attack is unheard-of in monohulls, and impossible for catamarans (the sails start flapping and your boat loses power).

No more tacking

The most exciting thing about the Dragon is that it never tacks – that’s right, no boom to swing, no sails to adjust. No ropes to trip over. The mast and the sails do it all, no matter what direction the wind comes from. Sophisticated control systems ensure that you always have powerful acceleration and performance at your fingertips.

Hydrofoils

The hydrofoils lift the boat out of the water to make it super fast and exceptionally stable. Custom-built controls keep all systems functioning smoothly. Super-effective electric motors ensure zero noise pollution, so you can glide into marine reserves and watch the manta rays and turtles feeding under your boat undisturbed. You’ll drift over magical underwater vistas and not one creature will know that you’re there, a silent spectator that leaves the environment as pristine as you found it.  

Solar panel arrays and electric engines mean that there will be no oil or fuel leaks from the Dragon – ever. No diesel fumes. Even the tender (dinghy) has an electric engine.

The latest carbon fibre and exotic materials make the boat light and fast. All materials that touch the ocean surface are plant based and environmentally friendly. 

Our experts

Innovation always attracts attention, and the Dragon team has been fortunate enough to have experts in the fields of aeronautical engineering, boat building, exotic materials and solar energy advising us and overseeing how we implement these new technologies. 

A Healthy Planet

We aim to raise awareness of the amazing new green products that are being invented now, and actively encourage people to find constructive ways to repair the environment. We’re very aware that our choices can ensure that the children of the future will have clean oceans and a healthy planet.

Progress

We’ve done extensive research and experimentation since starting in August 2014, and the aluminium hulls for the first TD15 were built up to the first chine in November 2014.

We built an experimental single hull kayak in January 2015, and after sea trials in March 2015, established that the composite material has the correct strength for the bigger boat, established that the foil positioning was correct, determined the floatation centre of gravity and qualified that all our design ratios are correct. The investment in the test kayak was successful.

Small Craft

Our small craft follow the radical design of the TD15 hull, and give a sense of excitement and speed to a new class of craft. 

In April 2015, we began building a scaled-down version (7.1m) of the TD15 called the Kymaran, to further test our mast and sail concepts. Work on this prototype is nearing completion, and we’ll have video footage of the first sea trials by the end of May. 

Quality

The personal attention that is lavished on each boat ensures that everything works for the comfort and safety of all sailors on board. 

Visit our website at www.twin-dragons.org for some more information.

We are now entering the next phase of the project to complete the TD15 demonstrating that luxury does not come at the cost of the environment. Being lovers of the environment and the sea, we wish to provide a solution to the yachting world that does not pollute the seas. The principles we are using will be scalable to be usable on large ships. 

Imagine a sea with no more oil spills! You can be a part of this revolution in environmentally friendly innovations.

Videos of the sea trials of the Kymaran will be made available within two weeks, so keep an eye out here!

What We Need & What You Get

We require more funding to achieve our goal of launching the TD15 by December 2015.  

We are seeking £100,000 in to reach the next phase of development. This will be broken down into materials, rent of premises and cost of building, including the salaries of the engineer and workshop staff for the next 6 months. This phase will allow us to complete the first catamaran to a point from which sales will commence. We do not envisage further funding to be necessary after this as sales of the Kymaran and the TD15 will then carry the business from there on.

The funds will be disbursed as follows:

Rent: £15,000

Operating expenses: £15,000

Materials: £70,000

We will begin production of the Kymaran in June 2015 once sea trials are completed. Our marketing campaign will commence at the end of May. Sales income from Kymaran will be used to keep the business running until we have reached our financial funding target.

Some of the exciting perks you can get for investing include:

·  Be a partner in the boat that is going to change the face of leisure sailing forever.

·  Sail with us across the Atlantic in the 2017 Cape to Rio yacht race.

·  Participate on a training course to learn how to sail the Dragon.

·  Buy a superfast Kymaran at a special early bird discounted price.

·  Get the coolest Dragon T-shirts and caps.

·  Our e-book on greener living and sailing.

·  A limited edition model of the Dragon.


The Impact

There is a growing trend for "green" yachts that are carbon neutral.  Although yachts are generally more environmentally friendly, many people wish to have even less of a detrimental impact to the oceanic environment. 

The demand for a cruising catamaran that can perform well in races has never been completely fulfilled in the yacht industry. The TD15 will be a cruising catamaran that uses processor controlled hydrofoils and wing sails along with sophisticated electronic control systems that will deliver exciting performance as well as a comfortable passage. 

By utilising green technology, we are helping to lessen the destructive impact on the environment, raise awareness of green technologies and highlight the serious damage already done to the environment. Our technologies can pave the way for the future so that our children will be able to benefit from clean oceans and a healthy planet.

Your contribution will go a long way to making this a reality.

Risks & Challenges

Our designs are unique and offer a major technological breakthrough in hydrofoiling performance. A hydrofoil is a wing like structure that operates in water to create lift. Hydrofoils situated underneath the boat lift the hull out of the water, increasing speed and performance by reducing drag on the hull itself. Although we have tested the concept using a hydrofoiling kayak with 100% success, we have still to test this on a large working model. We have every reason to believe this will be just as successful.

Our next challenge is to perfect the solar energy systems. We have made tremendous advances already, but more development is still required to perfect this. 

We currently have a number of prominent experts in the fields of aeronautic engineering, boat building, materials and solar energy advising and overseeing these new technologies.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    •  Tell your friends about what we’re doing.

    •  Share this with your social media contacts.

    •  Help us spread the message that the environment can be protected.

    •  Do what you can to minimize your impact on the environment.

    •  Share your ideas on green living and sailing with us.

    •  Suggest great marketing ideas and events to promote green sailing and living.

Thanks for participating!! "Sea" you soon.

Being lovers of the environment and the sea, we wish to provide a solution to the yachting world that does not pollute the seas. The principles we are using will be scalable to be usable on large ships. 
Imagine a sea with no more oil spills! You can be a part of this revolution in environmentally friendly innovations.
Videos of the sea trials of the Kymaran will be made available within two weeks, so keep an eye out here!
   What We Need & What You Get We require more funding to achieve our goal of launching the TD15 by December 2015.  
We are seeking £100,000 in to reach the next phase of development. This will be broken down into materials, rent of premises and cost of building, including the salaries of the engineer and workshop staff for the next 6 months. This phase will allow us to complete the first catamaran to a point from which sales will commence. We do not envisage further funding to be necessary after this as sales of the Kymaran and the TD15 will then carry the business from there on.
The funds will be disbursed as follows:
Rent: £15,000
Operating expenses: £15,000
Materials: £70,000


We will begin production of the
Kymaran in June 2015 once sea trials are completed. Our
marketing campaign will commence at the end of May. Sales income from Kymaran will be used to keep the business
running until we have reached our financial funding target.
Some of the exciting perks you can get for investing include:


·  Be a partner in the boat that is going to change the
face of leisure sailing forever.
·  Sail with us across the Atlantic in the 2017 Cape to
Rio yacht race. 
·  Participate on a training course to learn how to sail the
Dragon.
·  Buy a superfast Kymaran at a special early bird
discounted price.
·  Get the coolest Dragon T-shirts and caps.
·  Our e-book on greener living and sailing.
·  A limited edition model of the Dragon.

    The Impact 

There is a growing trend for "green" yachts that
are carbon neutral.  Although yachts are generally more
environmentally friendly, many people wish to have even less of a detrimental impact
to the oceanic environment. 
The demand for a cruising catamaran that can perform well
in races has never been completely fulfilled in the yacht industry.
The TD15 will be a cruising catamaran that uses processor controlled hydrofoils
and wing sails along with sophisticated electronic control systems that will
deliver exciting performance as well as a comfortable passage. 
By utilising green technology, we are helping to lessen the destructive impact on the environment, raise awareness of green technologies and highlight the serious damage already done to the environment. Our technologies can pave the way for the future so that our children will be able to benefit from clean oceans and a healthy planet.
Your contribution will go a long way to making this a reality.
    Risks & Challenges 

Our designs are unique and offer a major technological
breakthrough in hydrofoiling performance. A hydrofoil is a wing like
structure that operates in water to create lift. Hydrofoils situated underneath
the boat lift the hull out of the water, increasing speed and performance by
reducing drag on the hull itself. Although we have tested the concept using a hydrofoiling kayak with 100% success, we have still to test this on a large working model. We have every reason to believe this will be just as successful.
Our next challenge is to perfect the solar energy systems. We have made tremendous advances already, but more development is still required to perfect this. 
We currently have a number of prominent experts in the fields of aeronautic engineering, boat building, materials and solar energy advising and overseeing these new technologies.

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

•  Tell your friends about what we’re doing.
•  Share this with your social media contacts. 
•  Help us spread the message that the environment can be
protected. 
•  Do what you can to minimize your impact on the
environment.
•  Share your ideas on green living and sailing with us.
•  Suggest great marketing ideas and events to promote
green sailing and living.   Thanks for participating!! "Sea" you soon.

story:
Short Summary

  • Nedikenya in collaboration with Medishare Africa are organizations aimed to alleviated poverty to the vulnerable people in Kenya through creation of sources of water for doing sustainable income generating activities. This organizations are run by Daniel Manthi and Benjamin Musunza respectively. (www.nedikenya.org and www.medishareafrica.org)
  • Here in Mwingi - Kenya annual rainfall is between 650 – 1250 mm, which is not sufficient to sustain permanent rivers. The percentage of households collecting potable water at reasonable distance of less than 30minutes is less than 12.9% and 9.3% during dry and wet season respectively. The percentage of people accessing water clean and sufficient water is lower compared to that of the province 23.4% and national 30%. This calls for more effort to enhance the available water sources for utilization by the community.
  • This campaign will help us  construct an earth dam which will be used as sources of water for the community people for both domestic and agribusiness activities to generate some income to sustain their families.


What We Need & What You Get

  • With $122000 we will construct an earth dam which will be used as a source of water for the community people. During rainy season, the dam will be full of water which will be sustained till the next rainy season.
  • With the installation of a hand pump the community people will be using it to collect water for domestic use.
  • Since we do so many community projects here in Kenya, if the targeted amount from the fund raising is not reached, we will use the available amount to do small projects like environmental conservation, youth empowerment, women empowerment, capacity building in agriculture and many other.

The Impact

This project will be of great importance to the community because:-

  • Young girls and women in this area will now be relieved from the burden of walking for long distance searching for water. 
  • Since now water will be available and closer to them, this community will start some development projects like growing vegetables creating sources of income(agribusiness) and increasing nutritional value.
  •  I have gained experience though working with community on this kind of projects for several years. I have seen lives of people be transformed to better by utilizing the available resources.

Risks & Challenges

  • We face many challenges when working with community. Sometime some community people may not be willing to work if not paid if even the project is for their benefit. This is usually a challenge because there is usually no funds allocated for that. This forces us to do capacity building on the importance of that kind of project to them.
  • Other challenges is culture of different communities. But through it all we overcome because we have a strong spirit towards the work of the community. We believe that whenever there is a challenge, an opportunity is at the door step.

Other Ways You Can Help

I really need you even if you cant contribute towards this project. You are of great importance to me. You can help me spread out this good news to the your friends.

You can use Indiegogo share tools also.

story:
¡Versión en Español!      //      Versão em Português!

Jump to: Your Cash Machine ∞ Testimonials ∞ Sense of Meaning ∞ The Team ∞ The Main Features ∞ Timeline ∞ How You Improve Your Reward Per Hire ∞ Share & Improve.

Have a question? We have the answer. Contact us at hello@donehire.com.

Important: DoneHire is incorporated under the state of California and we are launching the first version of out platform with our pilot customers. We didn't launch this campaign for us, it's for you! So that you can improve your reward per hire before we launch our application for everyone! 

Before Uber, only taxi drivers were profiting from that market. Uber leveled the playing field so that everyone could benefit and profit from it. Uber not only is changing the transportation industry but also is improving the quality of life for thousands if not millions of people.

That's what we are doing with the hiring industry.

Organizations today are spending on average $4,000 per hire, reaching over $100,000 just for one hire. They have the budget, they have the money, so this is how you gain access to it:

Turn Your Job Hunting Into a Cash Machine!

It's beautiful: through DoneHire, get paid at least $1,000 for getting yourself, or your referral, hired! Yes, you read that right! Even if you are applying and you get the job, the money is yours! From the employer to you! Regardless if you are an employee or not of that company!

So... why apply or refer candidates to job openings through a job board or any other website, when you can do it through DoneHire and make good money in the process?

The better you are, the more you get!

The better you are, the more you will make! When applying, your reputation will increase every time: 1- you apply and 2- you are hired. When referring someone, your reputation will increase every time: 1- your referral accepts your invitation to become a candidate for the job opening and 2- your referral is hired. So, for almost every action associated with applying or referring someone, your reputation will increase. The higher your score, the more money you will make per hire and organizations will have a higher consideration for your applications and referrals. You can win up to $4,000 per hire! There's one additional way you can increase your reward per hire. Once you are a user of DoneHire, you will be able to invite your friends to become DoneHire users and for every invitation that transforms into a new user, you both will get an additional $20 for the next reward you receive.

Eliminating the noise and avoiding spamming!

We want to help you be more profitable and we also want to help everyone fill the job openings faster and better, so we do that by eliminating all the noise generated by low-quality candidates that have no fit with the job openings. How? Every month we will give you at least 20 tokens to use where 1 token equals one application or one referral and you will see, from the example bellow, that's very easy to have more tokens per month by increasing your score. You can get up to 100 tokens per month!

Here's an example of how your reputation increases with almost every action associated with you applying or referring someone, increasing your reward per hire and your tokens per month:

Click Here to Enlarge Image


What does it cost to use the system?

It's completely free for job hunters and referrers. Companies pay the fee.

This campaign is designed for the US market, organizations, and job openings. If you are located in another country you can still take this opportunity because you will be able to interact with the US openings. We will open operations in other countries, and for each one, we will probably have a different reward range, adapted to the country's economy.


The feedback and validation we have received have been so amazing that we finally had enough information to start developing and bring this solution to life.

Here are some of the comments we have received so far: (2 of the companies here are our pilot customers, 1 multinational and 1 company growing from San Francisco)

Here you can check the entire conversation our founder Carlos had with Karen Gaydon, the SVP of HR for Synaptics (www.synaptics.com):


Here you can check the entire conversation our founder Carlos had with Scott Zindell, the Talent Manager for Getaround (www.getaround.com):



At DoneHire we believe that all businesses should have a meaningful purpose that pushes them to go above and beyond their comfort zones, to improve quality of life and to leave this world better than they found it.

Not only DoneHire is built with a clear focus on improving lives, but there are also other amazing organizations out there already working hard to have a positive impact on life and our beautiful spaceship Earth. We want to support them!

We have made the decision of donating at least 6% of our business revenue to support organizations that we believe have the biggest potential for improving our lives.

So far the organizations that we are considering are:

Charity: Water

Most of us have never really been thirsty. We've never had to leave our houses and walk five miles to fetch water. We simply turn on the tap, and water comes out. Clean. Yet there are 663 million people on the planet who don't have clean water. Charity: water is a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.

Save The Children

Save the Children invests in childhood – every day, in times of crisis and for our future. In the United States and around the world, they give children a healthy start, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. By transforming children's lives now, they change the course of their future and ours.

Stand For Trees

Supporting Code REDD's Stand for Trees campaign represents one of the most effective ways an individual, a corporation, or a government can take on climate action now, and to keep trees standing.

The Savory Institute

Loss of grasslands leads to climate change, floods, droughts, famine and worldwide poverty. It's Savory's mission to promote large-scale restoration of the world's grasslands through Holistic Management.

Life Vest Inside

Life Vest Inside is on a mission to empower and unite the world with kindness. They inspire people to recognize the potential they have to affect real and positive change in this world through kindness.

World class executors! Meet the team that started this beautiful project, and with your help we hope to make it bigger, so to provide you with all the support and the best technology to improve the quality of your life.



Below you will find screenshots from our prototype, the same one we have demoed and showed to several organizations, recruiters, and potential users.

Every feature is designed to help you and organizations be more profitable. This is only a prototype so the design and the features may improve or adapt.

The search screen!

The map search screen!

Your favorite companies screen!

The job opening screen!

The referring screen!

The applying screen!

The employee job opening screen!

The tracking screen!

The profile screen!


This is only the beginning and a lot more will come down the road. We are focused on disrupting this industry in every way that we can and you can be part of it!

We are already incorporated and the web platform you see in the timeline is something we are launching to work in a close environment with our pilot customers.


Every DoneHire user will start making, at least, $1,000 per hire but if you support us between $1 and $1,300, we will increase the base of your reward, meaning you will start making more than $1,000 per hire and that starting reward will remain the same for 2 whole years. The same will happen to your tokens per month. Every support has a reward per hire increaser. For example, the '$1 or more' has a $1,300 increaser, meaning if you give $3 your starting reward per hire will be $1,303 (that's the increaser of $1,300 + your support of $3). Here it is how the money you provide is related to the reward per hire increasers and how they grow:

Remember the tokens are very important! They are the ones that will avoid job openings been spammed by too many candidates with no fit (helping you and organizations).

Sharing this campaign will also benefit you!

After you have improved your reward per hire, copy your unique URL link to post around the Internet, by clicking the link icon on the left side of this campaign. Share your link with your friends, family and networks, and for each person that improve their own reward per hire  through your unique link... you will get an additional $20 to improve your reward per hire! :-)

Please check our campaign updates to keep informed of everything that's happening with DoneHire.


We also have complimentarily special customized gifts for you. From $15 to $1,300, we will give you special and customized gifts with our brand and messaging. Check the different level of reward improvements for more details on which gifts and the quantities. This gifts will only be shipped within the US territory.

Below you'll see the gifts we have prepared for you and the messaging that goes with each one (designs may change/improve):

- DoneHire Customized Pen:



- DoneHire Sticker Sheet:


- DoneHire 8GB USB Flash Drive:

Please check the perks for details on gifts per perk and quantities.


We were recently selected by Manos Accelerator (www.manosaccelerator.com), an accelerator program located in San Jose, CA. They are part of and supported by Google For Entrepreneurs (www.googleforentrepreneurs.com). Their mission is to foster a new generation of Latino entrepreneurs by providing access to early-stage capital, mentorship support, and resources that will enable them to build and grow their startup companies.

We have many successes in our background and this is not the first time we develop a new HR solution. Carlos has been developing HR startups for 3 years. Joe and Sam bring amazing complementary skills and knowledge that makes us a powerful team. We have decades of combined experience in Human Resources, Technology and Business Development.

Also, Carlos travelled all the way from Latin America to the US specifically to build DoneHire. He left everything back there to pursue his dream of developing a job platform that could change the world and make people's life better! Meaning, he didn't come all the way to the US to quit! He even sacrificed being with his son to come to the US. And hopefully he will be able to rejoin with him soon enough, and you guys can help by supporting this campaign. 

DoneHire also has relationships built with 4 big companies (3 are multinationals) in San Francisco that combined have more than 25,000 employees and more than 5,000 job openings per year, all of them ready to start working with the platform and have validated the model. We are adding more relationships as we speak. From the organizations in the testimonial section, 2 are our first pilot customers.

We also have relationships built with important angel investors in Silicon Valley, meaning that your support will make us, even more, attractive to their investments. 

We will bring this to many countries and we will improve the lives of millions! We are starting with the US!

Regarding the gifts for the perks, we have everything ready! As soon as our goal is achieved and our campaign closes we have the suppliers aligned to start producing, packing and shipping.

story:
Short Summary

Part of growing a nation is to empower its people. African Grandeur is a retail outlet that buys articles from skilled artists and designers in Africa. These items are then imported and our aim is to grow the company and take it from the online sales site, to having retail stores across the nation.


The Impact

Together we can positively impact the lives of many people living in Africa. The continent has so much to offer, and we provide the channel for them to help spur growth.

It’s not only about buying what they make. In some cases, we supply the tools and materials for them to make their products. We can proudly say that our company actively creates jobs in Africa. We will also be generating jobs within the United States with the retail outlets we’re opening.

Africa is a land of picturesque beauty, intriguing sights, and fascinating sounds. The continent of Africa continues to captivate the world. For not only is Africa endowed with sensational wildlife, music and varied culture, it also boasts a variety of historical and cultural sites.


Yes, Africa is mostly identified with "nature” and of course a heritage of strong and vibrant images, but it’s impossible to ignore the fact that the country is also filled with friendly and hospitable people. It’s the people who will ensure that you feel the warmth and presence of the land. The people complete the host of warm hues, shapes and textures so that it is presented to you in the complete package of the African experience. African Grandeur taps into all of it. Your support will give skilled workers the supplies needed to create amazing crafts. By selling these crafts they are able to provide for their families. When the family is provided for, then the community fares so much better. 


What We Need

Below is a breakdown of initial and projected expenses:

  • First month's rent in advance, rent and Operating Expenses, Security deposit for the rental lease, Utilities security deposit ($4,500) With 6 month projection ($27,000)
  • Location Improvement Costs, Construction costs to customize the space ($9,000)
  • Store fixtures, including poles, racks, shelves, gondolas, hangers, mannequins, a cash counter, sizers, bookcases ($13,500)
  • Handyman and supplies ($2,300)
  • Inventory ($30,000)
  • Human resources per month - 5 in store staff ($15,000) With 6 month projection ($90,000)
  • General office supplies, technical supplies, cash registers, printer, IT consultant and tech support, high-speed internet and phones ($7000)
  • Marketing ($13,000) With 6 month projection ($76,000)
  • An exterior sign and center pylon signs (two) ($4,500)
  • Interior signage and décor ($1,200)
  • Initial startup costs ($100,000)
  • First 6 month budget ($260,500)

What You Get

Our perks represent the spirit of our business. As a token of our appreciation, we’ve listed the perks on the side and below for you. In truth, no amount of words could properly express our gratitude for making the decision to add your contribution towards the fulfillment of our vision.



We emphasize…

There are so many positive things that people can do to build a nation. There are things we can all do to help a hurting community. Artists, craftsmen and designers are hampered from living a better life because they do not have the resources to make the crafts that they are so good at making. Even more, once the items are made they need to market, post and package with funds that they cannot spare. We endeavor to be there for some of those within the continent of Africa who are in need of this help. By us placing continuous orders, they can continue working and providing for their families. We believe that together we can achieve more.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but we still want to give you an opportunity to help. Getting the word out would make a huge difference. Please make use fo the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Part of growing a
nation is to empower its people. African Grandeur is a retail outlet that buys
articles from skilled artists and designers in Africa. These items are then
imported and our aim is to grow the company and take it from the online
sales site, to having retail stores across the nation. 
The Impact
Together we can positively
impact the lives of many people living in Africa. The continent has so much to
offer, and we provide the channel for them to help spur growth. 
It’s not only about buying
what they make. In some cases, we supply the tools and materials for them to make
their products. We can proudly say that our company actively creates jobs in
Africa. We will also be generating jobs within the United States with the retail
outlets we’re opening. 
Africa is a land of
picturesque beauty, intriguing sights, and fascinating sounds. The continent of
Africa continues to captivate the world. For not only is Africa endowed with
sensational wildlife, music and varied culture, it also boasts a variety of
historical and cultural sites.

Yes,
Africa is mostly identified with "nature” and of course a heritage of
strong and vibrant images, but it’s impossible to ignore the fact that the
country is also filled with friendly and hospitable people. It’s the people who
will ensure that you feel the warmth and presence of the land. The people complete
the host of warm hues, shapes and textures so that it is presented to you in
the complete package of the African experience. African Grandeur taps into all
of it. Your support will give skilled workers the supplies needed to create
amazing crafts. By selling these crafts they are able to provide for their
families. When the family is provided for, then the community fares so much
better. 
What We Need
Below
is a breakdown of initial and projected expenses:


First
month's rent in advance, rent and Operating Expenses, Security deposit for the
rental lease, Utilities security deposit ($4,500) With 6 month projection
($27,000)


Location
Improvement Costs, Construction costs to customize the space ($9,000)

fixtures, including poles, racks, shelves, gondolas, hangers, mannequins, a
cash counter, sizers, bookcases ($13,500)


Handyman
and supplies ($2,300)


Inventory
($30,000)

resources per month - 5 in store staff ($15,000) With 6 month projection
($90,000)

office supplies, technical supplies, cash registers, printer, IT consultant and

startup costs ($100,000)
