story:
Bean Voyage Coffee Roasters

www.beanvoyage.com

A Quick Summary

A cup of coffee on average in the U.S. costs about $3 which in the global market can buy a pound of unroasted coffee beans. Nevertheless, the farmers do not receive adequate benefit from the transaction.

It is known that more than 500 million people around the world depend on coffee for their livelihood while 25 million of them are coffee farmers. Moreover, women represent the majority of the coffee farmers around the world, and they often experience additional challenges as they struggle with gender inequality. It is also reported that the 70% of the world’s poor are women and they face more difficulty accessing resources compared to men in general.

We want to revolutionize the coffee industry with our storytelling subscription based model to bridge the gap between coffee consumers of the global North and coffee producers of the global South, and also work towards more just and equal world for everyone regardless of their gender or class.


Background

From our interactions with coffee farmers from Costa Rica and Nepal, we were made aware that often the small-scale coffee farmers are unable to sustain their farming as the sales of coffee do not guarantee that their cost of production is paid for.

Additionally, the sobering fact is that lack of market facilitation directly results in low or stunted economic growth in communities. This inevitably results in social problems such as illiteracy and depreciating health care. Small scale farmers in these areas have minimal resources, making it impossible to expand their businesses outside of local communities, and/or leading them to leave their native community behind to migrate to the city in search of job opportunities.

While many farming communities in Costa Rica have women’s associations, our interaction with them has informed us that they lack financial and societal support. The lack of support for women in leadership roles in the coffee farming communities has presented additional challenges for increasing women's  leadership in the community and their ability to flourish in those roles.


Who Are We, & Why Us?

(L-R) Sohrab Amiri (CEO), Victor Zuniga (COO), SungHee Tark (CFO), Abhinav Khanal (CSO) and Bryan Tipton (CDO)

We are students from varying socioeconomic backgrounds and hence we recognize the value of opportunities which allow individuals to cease perpetuating the cycle of poverty and to exercise their freedom to move beyond the limitations of their particular socioeconomic position. Among our team members are those who have come to the United States because of greater educational and economic opportunities. We feel strongly about creating opportunities for those who struggle in challenging economies and those that experience gender inequality daily, and we know that we have the ability to facilitate positive change and to be of support. Our inspiration comes from our motivation to help and create positive and meaningful changes. We will use the resources available to us to aid coffee farmers in Costa Rica.

Our aspiration—to support local farmers in harnessing their skills and resources, strengthening their communities and stimulating economic development and the creation of jobs.


What We Need & What You Get

What do we do?

We are creating a web platform which allows coffee producers to sell their products on an e-commerce site. Through this website, we aim to bridge the gap between coffee consumers of the global North and coffee producers of the global South through their stories. The stories of the farmers will be shared with the consumers through the website, promoting a greater appreciation of the coffee.

And to do this, with more fair and sustainable prices, we need your help to start our operation!

We will also establish partnerships with local coffee shops on university campuses and surrounding towns and establish a subscription-based storytelling model of selling coffee in the US.

Here is a short summary of what the fundraised money would be used for. We are willing to share a more detailed breakdown of the cost, upon request. (beanvoyagecoffee@gmail.com)

  • Cost of coffee beans to operate in the first year ($ 6,000) - we promise to pay our farmers 25% more than the internationally set fair trade price to ensure that they cover more than just their operating cost and living wage.
  • Operating cost including shipping, packaging, etc. ($ 11,250)
  • Marketing cost ($ 750)
  • Roaster (5 kg) - ($ 7,000)

Our product

Our subscription based model will have the following components to surprise you at your doorstep every month!

Bean Voyage aims to ensure a vicarious experience with each and every single monthly subscription box to the comfort of your door.

Imagine the face of the farmer, the enabler, provider and creator of your warm and enticing beverage. The BV Box is dedicated to present you the journey from the hands of the farmer to your home. 

Each package within the box will contain the highest quality of roasted coffee beans. On the package you will find a portrait of the farmer as well as a small message from the farmer addressed to you regarding her process and passion put into harvesting their very own coffee beans. As you continue to look inside your BV Box, you will come across a story card which aims to narrate the story of the particular farmer who is providing her coffee beans to you. As you go along reading the story card, you will be able to discover the process through which the coffee beans are produced and the personal perspective of the provider. This will include the kind of challenges the farmer might be facing within her community and how your purchase is enabling her to overcome those challenges. 

This story card is not a simple newsletter that aims to share basic information, but rather also as a sign of gratitude towards you, our loyal customer who is directly responsible for the positive impact you are creating within her community as 20% of the profit will be going directly to the project the farmer proposes. We want to make this box special for you and we plan to do so by bestowing you with a surprise gift within each BV Box.  

We are happy to answer any of your question regarding our product! Please email us at beanvoyagecoffee@gmail.com or find us on our website: beanvoyage.com

The Impact

Together with farming communities, we aim to address various community-based social concerns. Our direct trade with farmers will ensure a sustainable source of income for the farmers, that it has real potential to restore balance, and to be a bridge to participation in larger economies. In addition, our consumers will be able to enjoy quality coffee with knowledge of where, how, and by who their coffee is produced.

Through interactions with farmers, we were made aware of the lack of resources and freedom to reach out to bigger markets, and the resulting social disparities in these communities. Moreover, farmers tell us that coffee is a potentially valuable and sustainable source of income. Our intention is to connect the rural coffee farmers in these countries with the coffee lovers around the world through stories, and use the profit to address the issues that they raise in their region. We are not only helping the farmers establish a sustainable source of income but we are also creating social-awareness and appreciation for coffee.


Risks & Challenges

The potential risks that we have identified for our social venture are related to both the customer segments and local communities that we are impacting. Our customer segment includes young professionals, and college students. With regards to them, we realize that we need to create specific and attractive packaging to create a vicarious experience for our customer. The specialty coffee business, as we realize, is quite competitive, and requires us to stand out for the customers. We hope to achieve this through creative marketing, and subscription based storytelling model, and one-to-one customer relations. Additionally, our model that focus solely on subscriptions and stories of the women coffee farmers is rare to non-existent. We see a great value in working with female farmers granting them the opportunity to become financially independent. Having recognized these risks, we also understand that social ventures require time and creativity in solving many of these issues. We are a team of quick learners, who are willing to compromise on venture decisions.




Contact us:

www.beanvoyage.com

beanvoyagecoffee@gmail.com
story_txt:
Bean Voyage Coffee Roasters
www.beanvoyage.com
A Quick Summary

A cup of coffee on average in the U.S. costs about $3 which in the global market can buy a pound of unroasted coffee beans. Nevertheless, the farmers do not receive adequate benefit from the transaction.
It is known that more than 500 million people around the world depend on coffee for their livelihood while 25 million of them are coffee farmers. Moreover, women represent the majority of the coffee farmers around the world, and they often experience additional challenges as they struggle with gender inequality. It is also reported that the 70% of the world’s poor are women and they face more difficulty accessing resources compared to men in general.
We want to revolutionize the coffee industry with our storytelling subscription based model to bridge the gap between coffee consumers of the global North and coffee producers of the global South, and also work towards more just and equal world for everyone regardless of their gender or class.

Background


From our interactions with coffee farmers from Costa Rica and Nepal, we were made aware that often the small-scale coffee farmers are unable to sustain their farming as the sales of coffee do not guarantee that their cost of production is paid for.
Additionally, the sobering fact is that lack of market facilitation directly results in low or stunted economic growth in communities. This inevitably results in social problems such as illiteracy and depreciating health care. Small scale farmers in these areas have minimal resources, making it impossible to expand their businesses outside of local communities, and/or leading them to leave their native community behind to migrate to the city in search of job opportunities.While many farming communities in Costa Rica have women’s associations, our interaction with them has informed us that they lack financial and societal support. The lack of support for women in leadership roles in the coffee farming communities has presented additional challenges for increasing women's  leadership in the community and their ability to flourish in those roles.

Who Are We, & Why Us?




(L-R) Sohrab Amiri (CEO), Victor Zuniga (COO), SungHee Tark (CFO), Abhinav Khanal (CSO) and Bryan Tipton (CDO)
We are students from varying socioeconomic backgrounds and hence we recognize the value of opportunities which allow individuals to cease perpetuating the cycle of poverty and to exercise their freedom to move beyond the limitations of their particular socioeconomic position. Among our team members are those who have come to the United States because of greater educational and economic opportunities. We feel strongly about creating opportunities for those who struggle in challenging economies and those that experience gender inequality daily, and we know that we have the ability to facilitate positive change and to be of support. Our inspiration comes from our motivation to help and create positive and meaningful changes. We will use the resources available to us to aid coffee farmers in Costa Rica.

story:
Hi, I'm Gunner,  I'm creating a coffee oasis (now a coffee desert) for my community in the Owens Valley and I need your help as I expand to the next level in coffee roasting. 

The Back Story  I'm a part-time barber in Oakland, CA and owner/coffee roaster of the Indy Coffee Roasting Company in Independence, CA.  As an the owner and roaster I use the freshest (newly harvested) sustainable, seasonal, Farm Gate (Transparency & Fairness to farmers), that I purchase through Coffee Shrub in West Oakland, California. They're a company I trust and value. I roast a European style coffee that is inspired by a trip to Italy and one of the Bay Areas best coffee roaster, Bob Baldwin.  2015 was an amazing year for my micro roasting company and as demand continues to rise I'm faced with the need to upgrade to a commercial roaster as my home roasters can no longer keep up with demand. This upgrade would increase my production, allow a more consistent coffee bean, and give me opportunities to add the new accounts I have had to put on hold this year.  To make this upgrade possible I need your support. ..and yes,  Awesome Perks Await You!   Contributions raised go toward the purchase of a San Franciscan SF-6 Roaster plus freight, installation, and a pricy exhaust system. Help me  make my dream come true of creating a coffee oasis and keeping the Owens Valley caffeinated. Thank you and please share my Indiegogo campaign with anyone who appreciates community, Eastern Sierra high desert towns, coffee, entrepreneurs, motorcycles and cats.  Cheers! -Gunner


To learn more about how I got started please read on.

In the mid 90's I met and befriended coffee roaster Bob Baldwin, co-owner of the Main Street Coffee Roasting Company in my hometown of Redwood City, CA.  Bob had formerly trained with Alfred Peet of Peet’s Coffee and is considered one of the best coffee roasters in the San Francisco Bay Area.  One day I watched Bob roast on the tiniest of sample roasters. Surrounded by coffee gadgets and tools, he roasted and smoked his cigar while we talked, until his desired end roast had arrived. For tasting he pulled out a sample of an earlier roast and ground it up for cupping. Witnessing the coffee roasting process on a small scale and tasting the fresh results through a French press made a lasting impression on me. The solitude, the creativity, experimenting with temperature and time, (cigars!) tools and machinery, and coffee! Then experiencing the result of a roaster’s labor in that first sip of a new crop, a new season, a new harvest, a new coffee bean. My destiny was formed.

 In 2015 my lovely wife and I made Independence, CA, our home, (part-time) where I began to hone my craft as a coffee roaster. Soon my new hobby developed into a vehicle to promote the awesomeness of the Owens Valley. I named the roasting company after the town of Independence, a hub and restocking location for hikers along the Pacific Crest  and John Muir Trail, and each roast was named after a specific destination or location in Inyo County.  I then packed and hand stamped each bag thinking I would only sell a few bags a month. Not the case! Sales rapidly grew and to date production has become overwhelming to keep up with demand.  

After months of researching commercial roasters, I was led to The San Franciscan Roasters, family owned and manufactured in Carson City, NV. The San Franciscan SF-6 is “primarily designed as a manual artisan roaster for the craftsman”.  (That's me!)  I’ve had the honor to roast on one and loved it!  (Thanks to Richard at Cafe Santana, Oakland, CA). Scouring the classifieds and calling upon coffee houses in search of a used San Franciscan roaster was to no avail. Not to mention the small business loans, grants, grants for women, grants for start ups, grants for underdogs, etc. brought me to the conclusion that most small business owners face; We don't qualify. 

In January 2016, I emptied my savings and borrowed what I needed for a deposit on a commercial roaster.  Today I'm asking for your help in contributing to my new roaster campaign so that I may continue to create a coffee oasis in the majestic Owens Valley.   

For your viewing pleasure, please check out all the videos I've created. 

With gratitude, 
Gunner
Indy Coffee Roasting Company

story:
Hello to everyone.


We would like to say a few words about us and why we chose indiegogo and for what purpose.

We are a homebased design studio and we started our design activity to express ourselves and make some extra money in the same time with our jobs in Greece of Economical Crisis. 

We created Cosmolab from nothing and slowly we made it a small homebased business. We want to be honest that it was very hard in the beginning because we are both young guys in their first steps to their lifes and we make this try in Greece of Economical Crisis, but with work and love for what we have decided to do, we started to make something beautiful.

In this point to you want to see some of our work before we continue our story?

There you are, we hope you will enjoy our work!

SOME OF OUR WORK

0.1 Poster design

0.2 Magazine Cover Design

0.3 Poster Design



I will continue our story and I will show you more of our work in a while.

I think that it is obvious now that design is our biggest love and we need to show all this creativity we feel to you. Design isn't just a job for us, it couldn't be because design is epression, is love, is passion.

We feel that we need to show you some more of our work now :)

0.1 Banner Design (Local Job)

0.2 Music Album Cover


We don't want to get you tired so for more of our work you can visit our website where you can see more details. Visit www.cosmolab.gr

We thing that it is time now to tell you why we create a campaign to indiegogo
  • We started this campaign because we need your support in order to help us create our own real office and stop working from our homes. Why we do this now? Because we feel that now it's the time to start focusing on what we are doing and do it take it more seriously, because we feel that now we have reached the skill level that we need so we deserve our real office to express all this creativity we have.

    We think that we have the skills to create our own office and stop working from our homes but what we think does not matter. What do you think is what has value for us, you will be our biggest judges of our work!


  • We would like to thank you for the support you give to us so we will give you our love with some services to you. We do not want to name them services so we will give you our love back with some design.


    SO WITH YOUR SUPPORT OF:

    8$ - Get one of our design in digital format (.JPEG). 

    19$ - Get one of our design in 8.3 x 11.7 inches printed with your own custom signature (optional) and shipped to your place. 

    29$ - Get one of our design in 11.7 x 16.5 inches printed with your own custom signature (optional) and shipped to your place.

    39$ - Get one of our design in 24 x 36 inches printed with your own custom signature (optional) and shipped to your place.



    OR



    GET A CUSTOM DESIGN / GET EXCACTLY WHAT YOU WANT IN ANY SIZE YOU WANT


    45$ - Get your CUSTOM POSTER Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    45$ - Get your CUSTOM FLYER Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    55$ - Get your CUSTOM BROCHURE Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    48$ - Get your CUSTOM BANNER Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    48$ - Get your CUSTOM POSTCARD Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    55$ - Get your CUSTOM BOOK COVER Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    55$ - Get your CUSTOM MAGAZINE COVER Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    55$ - Get your CUSTOM CD/DVD COVER Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format

    65$ - Get your CUSTOM T-SHIRT Designed by your needs in JPEG/PNG or PSD format


The Impact

Your contribution has two sides.  Firstly you support us to open our fisrt office and stop working from our homes and Secondly you get one of our works printed or a custom design of your choice. Your help is very important to us and we would like you to know that we appreciate it a lot.


You're making a difference

You make the difference because you help two young persons in their first steps to their lifes in Greece of Economical Crisis.



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
You can help us spread our effort to more people through your social media or email or directly your friends and people you love.





Thank you for spending time reading this.

You can contact us for anything you want from the contact button above or directly at info@cosmolab.gr

For more of our work you can visit our website where you can see more details. Visit www.cosmolab.gr

Cosmolab Team, Dimitris & Harris

story:
The project and me

I am danish guy who grew up on an organic farm working with fruit and vegies all of my life. I moved to both Aarhus and Copenhagen to study anthropology and was curious as to how to bring awareness of good quality farm produce to the city. 


I met a guy who had built a smoothie-bike, and was immediatly struck by its  smartness, since it was a delicious, cost-effecient, wasteless, one-man operation. 
I thought, this is something I want to try out with the strawberries and apples from my parents farm. 
It came to my knowledge that it was a hit at food festivals, as well as street sales, and music festivals.
For that reason I was curious to develop the concept into an updated streamlined set-up that could be sold, to whoever wanted to try and do the same thing. 
Your contribution will be helping me to initiate that goal so that we can spread out small shops, with quality produce where money goes directly to the operator and not bigger corporations. 


The financing

In order to built the prototype with the advanced good quality material the budget looks like this:

A Blendtec bike-blender: 500$

A professional 240w Sammic juicer: 500$

A high quality 50w solar panel with charger: 500$

A 90ah Gel Battery: 300$

A Yeti Tundra Cooler: 380$

Generatot wheel: 500$

Materials to build and paint - estimated at: 2245$

Total = 4925$

These costs are what you can help me cover - I do already have a "Christiania bike" (2000$) that I can build on. So any donation will go straight towards the newer equipment. 

If the goal is not reached I will try and seek funding from other places to cover the rest :)




The Impact

This project is about building a more sustainable and personal shopping experience, where u have direct contact to the person making your smoothies. You would therefor also expect the person to know where exactly the products come from.

As I have had succes running a smoothie-bike for two years, many people have been fascinated with the concept, and told me that they have really enjoyed the experience.

Of course I will invite you all to come to the events I am attending this summer in Copenhagen, to experience the taste, and quality of the smoothies, and maybe the new bike :)



Risks & Challenges

Of course there is a trial and error dimension to the creation of a drawing in real life. The idea about this project is therefor to learn about and test the prototype, in order to reach a final design that can be put into production. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Any interest in the project is appreciated, since this campaign is also about getting a worldwide response to the idea. Therefore its in my biggest interest for you to share the campaign if you like it :) You can use the indiegogo share tools, to link straight to the project.
story_txt:
The project and me


I am danish guy who grew up on an organic farm working with fruit and vegies all of my life. I moved to both Aarhus and Copenhagen to study anthropology and was curious as to how to bring awareness of good quality farm produce to the city. 





I met a guy who had built a smoothie-bike, and was immediatly struck by its  smartness, since it was a delicious, cost-effecient, wasteless, one-man operation. 
I thought, this is something I want to try out with the strawberries and apples from my parents farm. 
It came to my knowledge that it was a hit at food festivals, as well as street sales, and music festivals.
For that reason I was curious to develop the concept into an updated streamlined set-up that could be sold, to whoever wanted to try and do the same thing. 
Your contribution will be helping me to initiate that goal so that we can spread out small shops, with quality produce where money goes directly to the operator and not bigger corporations. 




 The financing

In
order to built the prototype with the advanced good quality material the budget
looks like this:
A
Blendtec bike-blender: 500$
A
professional 240w Sammic juicer: 500$
A
high quality 50w solar panel with charger: 500$
A 90ah Gel Battery: 300$
A Yeti Tundra Cooler: 380$
Generatot wheel: 500$
Materials
to build and paint - estimated at: 2245$
Total
= 4925$
These
costs are what you can help me cover - I do already have a "Christiania
bike" (2000$) that I can build on. So any donation will go straight
towards the newer equipment. 
If
the goal is not reached I will try and seek funding from other places to cover
the rest :)








The Impact
This project is about
building a more sustainable and personal shopping experience, where u have
direct contact to the person making your smoothies. You would therefor also
expect the person to know where exactly the products come from.

As I have had succes running a smoothie-bike for two years, many people have been fascinated with the concept, and told me that they have really enjoyed the experience.
Of course I will invite you all to come to the events I am attending this summer in Copenhagen, to experience the taste, and quality of the smoothies, and maybe the new bike :)


Risks & Challenges
Of course there is a trial and error
dimension to the creation of a drawing in real life. The idea about this
project is therefor to learn about and test the prototype, in order to reach a
final design that can be put into production. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Any interest in the project is appreciated,
since this campaign is also about getting a worldwide response to the idea.
Therefore its in my biggest interest for you to share the campaign if you like it
:) You can use the indiegogo share tools, to link straight to the
project.

story:
As most everyone knows we recently moved from our old location that was in a not so great area with heating issues to a new location. We thought it was a dream come true. We went from bad to an amazingly beautiful space in a great area to what we thought was a welcoming landlord. Sadly, our dream has turned into a nightmare. 

We moved in and began pouring money into this new location to renovate and make it Infinity ready. But there were issues with the heating (not again). When we told the landlord he came out and saw our poles. The landlord went from super helpful to wanting to find anyway to get us out immediately due to his personal beliefs and him thinking what we do is wrong and dirty. We'd been honest about our studio and love of both fabric and metal but it seems maybe his realtor left out our love of chrome. 

We tried and tried to get him to fix the heating issues but to no avail. A lawyer had to be called in and we brought in our own heating guy. What we found out was that there are major code violations. But still the landlord hasn't been willing to fix his mistakes. So we called the city. While there were violations on the landlords part it seems the landlord wasn't so honest about what needed to be done to remove the drop ceiling. We were told only he had to approve it, not that we had to get a permit, not that we had to immediately have the sprinkler system brought up to ceiling height. 

So now here we are, cited for the sprinklers that we have to bring up to code but also with other fire code violations that the landlord wont fix. What that means is we can't teach in what was supposed to be our beautiful new home until everything is fixed. With a landlord that doesn't want us there and unwilling to take care of his part we've got no choice but to move yet again. But, after putting so much money into moving already and loosing out on all of it we just don't have the cash in hand to move. 

That's why we need all of you. We love this studio which is more than a studio, it's our family. Losing it is not an option. It's been growing since 2007 and there's no intention to stop that growth because that would mean losing this family of amazing people too. This has turned into a nightmare but we have a realtor working overtime with lots of options to get us moved into a better home. We just need the funds to make it happen. Any help we get would mean the world to us. Teaching is our life and passion and there's nothing else in the world we want to do more than continue helping all our amazing students grow and become better and stronger.


UPDATE: just when we thought things couldn't get worse as we were clearing out the studio yesterday to make it fire safe until repairs are done Tuesday that we are paying for we get served eviction papers. Our "wonderful" landlord is claiming he never got rent this month. Funny because our attorney handed the check to him personally and got receipt. This landlord has made it abundantly clear he doesn't want us there and we're taking care of repairs we shouldn't have to just to make the space useable while our realtor secures our new location. All we want to do is teach our students

story:
A Story of Rebuilding...

My wife and I sold our house and left our home in Las Vegas to come to Phoenix and fulfill our dream of opening our own fitness and yoga studio.  We had a prime location, a great partner, and what we thought was solid financial backing... Unfortunately, our investor suffered a mental and physical breakdown, causing him to bail out on the business after being open for only 3 months. Due to the fact that our backing disappeared unexpectedly, we were unable to market the business properly or pay the lease. As a result, my wife and I were forced to close the doors to our studio, leaving us stranded in Arizona and unemployed.

However, we refuse to let go of our dream to help the community live healthier lives. My wife and I aren’t quitters - our goal now is to start over and create a Movement...


The Movement

There are a lot of buzzwords being thrown around in the fitness world today. Functional Movement, Primal Movement, etc.

The key is Movement! The ability to move freely and without injury. The ability to carry heavy items like luggage and groceries. The ability to Move furniture or large appliances around your home without fear of strain, pain and injury. The ability to do the every day things we tend to take care for granted and don’t give a second thought. Nobody wants to lean over to pick up some dropped keys and throw out their back!

Simply put, we are here to create strong, stable, healthy Movement using Kettlebell Sport, Pilates, TRX, Yoga, Indian Clubs, Gada Mace, and Sand Bags, all with a dash of high intensity interval training.

To make things easy, members and personal trainers will pay a flat fee for 24-hour access to The Movement. Classes will be taught throughout the week and will be available through an upgraded membership fee, or on a pay-as-you-go basis.

If classes aren’t your thing, we still have your back. Movement will feature 3 challenging 20-minute workouts every day. These 20-minute workouts will be changed daily so you won't get bored (however, a 5-minute warm-up and cool-down is always recommended).

- In addition;  The Movement will be ideal for Personal trainers!!! Trainers will be welcome to come in and train their clients any time, day or night. You will just need to pay your personal trainer fee, and have your clients be paid members as well. 

Come Join The Movement!


Location

The plan is to open multiple locations throughout the entire Phoenix metro area, but we have to get the first location locked down before the Movement can spread.


Why Crowdfunding

During the financial battle with our former investor, I couldn't help but notice that even with absolutely no marketing money, we were able to continue getting new members through Groupon. So my thought is, “Why let Groupon take half of the money raised when we can just use ALL of the money towards the business?” Therefore, to maximize our financial investment in the Movement, we have decided to use reward-based crowdfunding!

You’re not just handing money over for nothing; you are pre-purchasing a membership and helping to build a healthier, happier community. You’re also investing in a certified instructor. I’m W.K.C. Fitness Kettlebell Certified, American Ketttlebell Alliance Kettlebell Coach, BBC K-bell Kettlebell/Bootcamp Certified, Hot Pilates Certified, TRX Suspension Trainer Certified, and a BattleRopes Instructor. You’ll also be getting some cool swag too!  ;)

Our goal of $50,000 is to purchase most of the necessary Competition Kettlebells, Pilates balls, 1lb-8lb Dumbells, TRX Suspension & RIP trainers, Yoga blocks, Indian Clubs, Gada Mace, Foam Rollers, Ultimate Sand Bags, Building lease, Security & Sound System, etc...

If we can reach $100,000, we can upgrade all of the amenities (Showers, Sound System, Floors, Room Divider, other accrued construction cost), in addition to purchasing ALL of the necessary equipment.... Then we would really have a Movement!


Basic Level

$1 - Thank you


Premium Level

$5 - 5 day pass


Premium-Plus Level

$10 - 10 day pass


Copper Level

$25 - 1 month Membership


Silver Level

$50 - 3 month Membership


Gold Level

$100 - 3 month Membership + T-shirt


Gold-Plus Level

$150 - 3 month Membership + T-shirt + Kettlebell Wrist Guards


Platinum Level

$300 - 1 year Membership


Platinum Plus Level

$400 - 1 year Membership + T-shirt + Kettlebell Wrist Guards


Platinum Premium Level

$500 - 1 year Membership + T-shirt + Kettlebell Wrist Guards + Indian Club Set w/DVD


Diamond Level

$1000 - 3 year Membership 


Diamond Premium Level

$1200 - 3 year Membership + T-shirt + Kettlebell Wrist Guards + Indian Club Set w/DVD


Black Level

$3000 - 5 year Membership + T-shirt + Kettlebell Wrist Guards + Indian Club Set w/DVD + 12kg-32kg Adjustable Competition Kettlebell


Black Diamond Level

$5000 - Lifetime Membership + T-shirt + Kettlebell Wrist Guards + Indian Club Set w/DVD + 12kg-32kg Adjustable Competition Kettlebell

story:
We, at Amber Bikes, are having a common passion for cycling. We've already started to manufacture some trial part, that are currently tested by local pro and semi-pro riders in Lithuania.

Bike components are actually having a straight effect on riding your bike. They can increase your result and experience.

We would like to create and efficient parts by investing in research and development, bus also to be able to give to your bike a nice colorful touch.  

What we need now is a real kick off.

  • Mass manufacturing
  • Invest in advertisement/marketing/sponsorship of event and athletes
  • design and engineering on request 
  • research and development  

You can get at a very good rate our early bird products:
  • 10 chainrings 104BCD for 270eur
  • 3 chainrings 104BCD for 90euros
  • 1 chainring 104BCDfor 35euros.
Later will be added some merchandising. 
We want to manufacture products for you, by you!

Some of our products live!

Chainring has been tested and approved with succes on a custom Wittson Titanium bike.

Also on a Merida XC bike...

Challenge

We want to have something more than others in this business.

We believe that every riders need a customized product to his bike, parameters, expectations, abilities... This can mean different specs (sizes, form ...) but also possibility to customize your products (colors, design ...)

We believe we can do it at a normal price. Currently on the market you have only standard products, take it or leave it.

Social

For every single sales of bike components we will donate to UNICEF 1% of the paid price. So each time you make a purchase at Amber Bikes, you are also helping children around the world in getting better living, health, eductation conditions.
Because we believe that kids of today are the future of tomorrow.


Other Ways You Can Help ?

Maybe you have some genius idea for us ?

Or you are a know rider at some levels and you would like to test our components ? A retailer/shop owner that would like to sell our products ?

We are open to anything that will move the idea forward, let us know !
